Would it not be nice to be able to set a time for the music to start? Link a playlist, best of (maybe you're waiting for a song to come out?), Incorporate a timer into the alarm clock too. Would be cool. Just a thought....

title: Starting a radio plays song you choose as base
author: bgmrk
body: It's annoying that when i get to a song i'm feeling, and i right click and go to "start radio" the radio plays a different song then the one i choose. It would be great if spotify just went right into the radio without skipping or even pausing the current song. Then after that played a new song that sounds similar.

title: Spotify In Canada
author: bgmrk
body: I would LOVE to see spotify in Canada, I have been using it via VPN, but sadly can't subscribe to it via credit card cause i'm under a canadian address, I know a bunch of people here would love to have access to Spotify!

title: Genres
author: abb0r
body: I think it would be a good idea if you can browse through the music catalogue by genre. (Clicking a genre should open a new page with popular/new releases of this genre to discover new music.)

title: Implement an actual shuffle function
author: RoninTheOrigina
body: Yes, you read that right. The "shuffle" function in Spotify is nothing more than a randomizer. There's a difference? YES. RANDOM - Play one song. The next song can be ANY song in your playlist. Including the one you just listened to. Though I've never had this specifically happen, I literally just heard the same song that I heard 2 songs ago. This is how Spotify's "shuffle" currently functions. SHUFFLE - Take your entire list, shuffle them (like cards), and play the first song in the shuffle. Once finished, move that song off the pile. Once the pile is depleted, shuffle the deck again and start over (maybe pop a message up). I know enough about programming (not much) to know that shuffling is probably a bit harder than random, but come on. I may be in the minority, but I don't have a lot of little playlists. I have one list with nearly a thousand songs in it, because I like all the music, and am rarely not in the mood for one of those songs. But what I can't stand is hearing the same song over and over again. I think there may even be songs in my list I haven't heard yet, while I've heard others 4-5 times. I know it may not matter much, but I would probably lay down the money for at least a year subscription if this feature was implemented. EDIT: Another user pointed out that I can see what all is queued up in my shuffle by clicking the Play Queue link, and that Spotify supposedly sets up a rolling shuffle of 50 songs. It would be nice if this range could be expanded to say 50-100% of your playlist. EDIT 4/6/12: I just dealt with the same song 16 tracks later. The song played the first time yesterday afternoon. I went home, listened for a bit on my home PC (just a few songs), then started listening again this morning. If the list recycles itself after a day, or if you log in from another computer, I see that as an area for improvement.

title: [Connect] Needed functionality: Using Spotify UI to stream to Sonos
author: Dannemann
body: Hello I am tired of being "forced" to use Sonos UI when streaming Spotify music to my stereo. It would be great if Spotify could could team up with Sonos and develop a feature enabling the Spotify UI to stream directly to the stereo via Sonos. I heard a lot of people having the same wish. That being said, Spotify really rocks 🙂 Regards /Jesper

title: Displaying album credits
author: Peppe
body: I understand that including all album artwork is considered a premium feature, but at the same time, all people who participated in the making of an album should be credited for their work. Musicians, composers, producers, engineers and everybody involved - plus all the "special thanks" - people, deserve to be credited. This could be implemented by simply displaying the album credits in text form, along with the original front album cover and tracklist. No lyrics, pictures or bonus features, just the credits. Not linking, but displaying the credits along with the album front cover + tracklist by default, in all versions of Spotify. The complete album artwork could still be a Spotify Premium-feature, with this approach. This is not a feature for the listener - most people don't care much about songwriters or who plays bass on track five of this album, but from the perspective of the music creators, this is very important - their (ok, our) careers depend on these little things. Being associated with the music you've recorded (or written, engineered for et c) is still a very important part of building a career in this business.

title: [Music] Block / Hide / Blacklist Tracks or Artists
author: Viktor
body: The Star feature should be complemented with a way to mark tracks as excluded. Those tracks would then be skipped even when included in the current playlist.This way the enjoyment of a good album wouldn't be disrupted by tracks you don't like, while the album in its entirety can still be kept in the playlist.The Anti-star can easily be implemented as a flipside to the regular star as they are mutually exclusive. Click the star once, the track becomes a favorite. Click again, the star icon changes to the anti-star and click a third time and either flag is gone.A no-brainer to me.

title: iPhone Media Library feature
author: maximusmmiv
body: Spotify desperately needs a Media Library feature so that I can drill down through my library by artist, and then by album. Viewing my starred tracks as one giant 6,000+ song playlist is completely unmanageable. Right now, I'm making playlists of albums to work-around this, but it's obnoxious.

title: Podcasts. Please? Help me move completely off of iTunes!
author: energetik
body: Podcast support in the client would be amazing. I miss so much by focusing on Spotify and not iTunes, that I miss listening to all of my podcasts. Please help 🙂

title: Shuffle all music on mobile device
author: patglennon
body: Posted by user jayafink on the support side of things:[quote] Can you shuffle all of the playlists and tracks within on the Ipod Touch? I made lots of playlists by artist name, with hundreds of tracks in all of them. In spotify itself you can click on "library" under "collection" to shuffle all of it, but there is no "collection" or "library" buttons on the Ipod app. It seems you can only shuffle within a particular playlist and not all of them on the Ipod. Is that true or am I missing something? [/quote]I wholeheartedly concur. I am an album guy so I am alway creating offline available playlists for individual albums. But sometimes it's good to put all music in play randomly. Doesn't seem to be supported on the mobile version currently.Can we see this feature at some point?

title: [All Platforms] Spotify Lite Version
author: AdyMiles
body: Please can you do a second simpler, less memory-hogging and bandwidth-hogging version of Spotify? i.e., Spotify Lite (I don't have a fast computer and even optimised I have big lag problems with other programs whilst Spotify is running.)

title: [Last.fm] Scrobble Tracks played offline
author: deliveryboy555
body: Let's have Spotify locally save all mobile offline play history and write it to Last.fm scrobble list when you turn it back online. Even better - a Spotify play history on desktop and mobile applications that tracks all play history online or offline.

author: manux
body: Hello, It could be great to be able to remote control my computer Spotify app from the Spotify mobile device app. (iPhone un my case)

body: It sucks to have my ears blown out when I'm in the middle of riding my bike...

title: Picture on Profile
author: Holly_A
body: I would like to suugest the option of adding our own pictures or avitars WITHOUT linking it to our Facebook accounts. I know there are some of us that were fortunate enough to get Spotify before it linked with Facebook and I would love to add my picture on the account page.

title: Clear play queue
author: TomR
body: I have to restart my spotify when I accendently start a song from a search instead of adding it to the queue (happens often to me), would be lovely if there would be a clear button for all the songs added to the queue by spotify it self.

title: Ability to Delete Radio Stations
author: Jon_R
body: Why are you guys starting us out with Radio stations that you pick for us. Why can't we have no stations and then decide on genre or artists ourselves. Now I'm stuck with a David Guetta station and I don't even know who he is. Also why can't we get a like or dislike button for the songs that come up in the radio station. Skipping a song doesn't mean we don't like it, maybe we are just not in the mood to listen to it at that time.

title: ROKU with Spotify?
author: iambigd
body: New to the forums but not new to Spotify. Recently I was at my brothers house and he had his Roku fired up with Mog and I have to say it was awesome! I argued the Mog vs Spotify with him for about an hour and it was a stalemate however the Roku argument he won hands down. I have looked through the forums briefly and have onyl found a few larthargic ways to add Spotify to the Roku. I have read on some user groups that Spotify has plans to build an app for the Roku but they don't have a date or time frame. Does Spotify have an official announcement to bring there service to the Roku? I would like to know, if not I am seriously considering a switch. I use my Roku with Pandora (which I can't stand) and to be able to use my playlists via the Roku would be the kicker that I believe would put Spotify over Mog and best of all I can tell my brother to shup up. Thanks Dennis

title: [Music] Stop Playback after a Track
author: Styrke
body: I hate to stop the music in the middle of a track, so i would love some way to make Spotify stop playback after the current track. Right now I can simulate the desired behaviour by right-clicking an empty playlist, (that i have created for this purpose only) and selecting "Choose as Current Playlist" and making sure that the play queue is empty. While this is a nice workaround, I think that it would make sense to include a real "Stop Playback After Current Track"-function in Spotify. Update (2015-02-01): The previously suggested workaround doesn't even work any more as Rapti has pointed out in a comment. At one point it could even make Spotify crash completely. I would like to point out that a saner, more flexible queuing system could allow even finer control over when to stop playing. Thus people who like this idea might also like: Make entire play queue editable (I have added my own comment to that idea about how Google Play Music seems to work)

title: Gapless playback on mobile devices
author: dbfreedom
body: Good news that the desktop Spotify no longer has artificial gaps between songs, but could this also be implemented on mobile, please?

title: Make entire play queue editable
author: Dommedagsprofet
body: There's currently two queues in Spotify: The editable queue. ("Queued tracks")The locked queue. ("Next tracks")If you press the queue button with tracks in both lists, you can see that these two queues follow each other. The editable queue always plays first. The problem is having a locked queue at all. You can't empty it without interrupting playback, and you'll have to use a workaround to do so. You can't reorder it or add or delete songs. After finishing the editable queue, Spotify always continues playback from the locked queue. The workaround is starting playback at the very last item on a page. The locked queue will then have no further items. Then you can continue by purely using the queue right-click function instead of double-click or enter. This adds items to the editable queue. These tracks can then be reordered and deleted as you wish. This UI behaviour is, however, not very user-friendly and quite frankly really annoying. It's also very unconventional having two queues in a music player. I've never seen any other software using either a dual-queue system or a locked queue system. Here's a good implementation suggestion from user Styrke: ----Google Play Music's queue system is really easy to understand and use. Just do what they do. I can describe it by three (3) easy bullets: Double clicking a song starts playing it and adds the rest of the list that the song came from to the queue. (The queue gets overwritten)Right click one or more songs to add them to the top ("play next") or the bottom ("add to queue") of the queue.Everything in the queue can be removed or rearranged by drag-and-drop---- EDIT: I updated the terminology to match the new Spotify. Items are no longer yellow and white, but are now under separate headings and in the same color instead.

title: Add Equalizer in Spotify
author: spotifyfan
body: For ipod touch there is a huge need for eq because Spotify bypasses the regular Apple Sound Settings. I use high end headphones but need to be able to fintune the settings so I can enjoy my music and tech equally.So please, please make an EQ for the spotify app

title: [All Platforms] Explicit Filter
author: sekuether21
body: Add a button that controls whether Explicit songs are played or not. When it is off and you're listening to an album or playlist, the explicit songs are skipped. That way you can still listen to your favorite album or playlist when more impressionable members of the family (kids / parents) are around.

title: [Partnerships] Apple TV Support
author: muffin16
body: I think there should be a Spotify feature for the Apple TV, similar to the Netflix App which is available. As currently, the only way Spotify can be played on the Apple TV is through AirPlay which requires an iPod Touch/iPhone.

title: Show original year of album release
author: incandenza
body: I'd like to be able to see the date an album was originally released, even if the current version is a re-release. So many albums are re-released that for some artists it looks like all of their albums came out in the last few years, even though some of them may actually be a decade old or older. When this happens, I wind up just having to go to Wikipedia or Allmusic to find out the real info. But why drive me away from the Spotify experience?

title: Full screen artwork (for those late nite jams)
author: MandaGee
body: So.... it's Friday night, your friends are round, you've sorted your music for the night by queuing a shedload of music.... now we're on 'Play Queue' and I'm stuck looking at the interface - boring! It's time for some atmosphere - no need for fancy visualisers, just give me a 'full screen' option on the artwork for the current song! Maybe we could even flip it over and read the back cover & credits too!! Just like the old vinyl days.....

title: Discount Family Subscriptions!
author: djbyron
body: Before I made the switch from Rdio to Spotify they (Rdio) came up with a pricing model that allowed families to purchase a slightly discounted subscription. $9.99 for single unlimited user$17.99 for 2 family members (20% discount)$22.99 for 3 family members (50% discount) Would love to see a similar pricing model so the rest of the family could get in on the action!

title: Subscribe to Artists
author: chopztix
body: I know for a fact that myself and a lot of people I know would love a feature that lets you subscribe to an artist or a group, immediately letting one know when a new album/track has been released.

title: Display total historical plays
author: arelol
body: On the top listened to songs for me spotify should show how many times you've listened to that song, like itunes e.g. does.

title: Spotify for browsers
author: djazz
body: From this getsatisfaction thread: https://getsatisfaction.com/spotify/topics/please_make_browser_based_spotifyAndres (Employee) over 3 years ago:"We have no plans to make a browser based version, we feel we can provide a much better product with an app and offer features which wouldn't be possible via a web browser."Today, webapps are the most spread apps, as they work the same across devices (cross platform).Three years ago, it would be difficult to build Spotify for browsers, because it would require APIs that you could not simply access from JavaScript. Today, with HTML5, APIs exists for:Bi-directional secure (TLS) WebSockets with UTF8 or binary Native audio playbackA whole new types of input types such as "search" and "range"2D Canvas Context for advanced dynamic drawing of 2D elements (lines, gradients, text, images, shapes, raw pixels)Realtime audio processing/analysis with the Web Audio APISandboxed FileSystem access (e.g. for offline playlists, local settings)Application Cache for offline usage of the appDrag & Drop API (e.g. for dragging tracks to playlists)History API for sessions and bookmarkingBinary data: Typed arrays/ArrayBuffer, Blobs and File API (for reading files, writing files)!XHR2: Binary data with Ajax/XHR requestsWebWorkers, multithreaded JavaScriptCSS3: Keyframe animations, smooth transitions, shadows, custom fonts, new selectors.PeerConnection API for Peer-To-Peer connections!!Today, Google Chrome (the world's second largest browser) got all of these APIs and more (except WebRTC, but it's in the dev build, so it will soon be here too). Chrome even have it's own built-in appstore (Chrome Web Store) where users can install extension/apps, without having to restart their browser. Another approach to get Spotify to the web is to use Native Client (NaCl) to compile C/C++ code for the web. An example is the game Bastion that was compiled with NaCl to run in Chrome.This would be the easiest way for the Spotify developers, as they only had to tweak their code very little to make it compile with NaCl. ( Offtopic: I made a chrome extension for Spotify, which convert spotify links to links with mouseover info, for example image of the album, artist name, title of track, popularity. Get it HERE. Thank you :] )

title: Outbox
author: Garywoo
body: With all the social sending music features on spotify, an outbox to track what music I've sent and to who, would be a huge help. I'm always thinking how much a friend would love a song and then sending it to them, only to have them tell me, I have already sent them the song in the past. Having a tracker on the outbox would also be useful, to see if they have listened to the song. Perhaps having a feature of a notification if you try to send the same song to a friend twice or another message if they have heard the song in the past, even if you have never sent them it before. The outbox request has been active on the old GetSatisfaction forum for over a year, so I think it's about time it got some serious attention on these new forums. Thanks.

title: Repeat TRACK Mode!
author: MattSuda
body: UPDATE: Repeat track mode is now available FINALLY!!!!!!! AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH! Thanks to everyone for your support helping me get Spotify to add this! 😃https://web.archive.org/web/20140331181407/http://news.spotify.com/2014/02/07/repeat-once/ Daniel Ek told me in person that Repeat One is his favorite Spotify feature.https://web.archive.org/web/20141028073027/https://news.spotify.com/2014/09/04/community-visit-our-o... -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Why isn't there an option to just repeat a track? I hate having to place a song in a playlist of its own, and then put it on repeat which just repeats the playlist. People have been suggesting you add this feature for years now! EVERY music app should have this feature! This feature should be on all the Spotify apps across all platforms. Add it to the same button as now with a 3-step repeat mode: 1. Repeat ALL/PLAYLIST 2. Repeat TRACK 3. Repeat OFF My mockup of what this would look like in the iPad app (similar for desktop and other mobile devices): My Comments: If Spotify wants to compete with the competition, they need to add this basic feature! It worries me that Spotify hasn't implemented this popular simple idea from 4 years ago, but instead they implement more complex newer ideas. If you ask some people -- this has been a request since the launch of Spotify. I love Spotify, but it hurts that a simple feature like this gets passed up every time new features are rolled out. I feel like I'm living in the 1990s with no repeat track mode anywhere to be found within Spotify. This is a basic feature and it's being looked at like a grain of salt. I comb through Twitter search every day and a lot of people are very confused on how the repeat mode works so I link them to this idea. I've referred 50+ people now to the link... some didn't know that it only repeated the playlist. This is very confusing for a lot of people, especially newcomers. Oh and look at all of these confused people: https://www.google.com/search?q=repeat+song+%20spotify https://www.google.com/search?q=repeat+track+%20spotify https://www.google.com/search?q=repeat+spotify News articles that agree: http://mashable.com/2013/03/01/spotify-changes/ http://www.complex.com/music/2013/01/11-things-spotify-needs-to-win-the-online-music-war/repeat

title: Close Button Closes Spotify [Windows]
author: jeff
body: Or at least minimize it to a tray Icon. But I would say close it. Maybe this is more of an opinion, but I've only used 2 programs that are this bad. Skype and Spotify. And Skype is a really bad program. So I don't know why in Spotify, the Close and Minimize button do the same exact thing. I would like a quick way to close the program and stop the musik. This is mainly a problem for me on Windows 7 and I believe linux is very similar.

author: Rayno1400
body: It would be great to be able to manage Spotify through BMW iDrive, either by a dedicated Spotify app on BMW system or at least by a connection of iDrive controls with Spotify app on the iPhone.

title: [Desktop] Notify Spotify of incorrect metadata or broken tracks from Desktop App
author: timiambeing
body: There should be a link on every track/album to easily notify Spotify of incorrect metadata such as incorrect artist, track name, album art etc.

title: Spotify Radio on Mobile
author: xpedient
body: It would be nice just to plug the phone on the car stereo and play one of the spotify radio stations and forget about it.

body: I use my iphone in my car for navigation and music. I prefer for my phone to be mounted in landscape orientation for navigation purposes, but the spotify app is hard to use when it is sideways. constantly changing the orientation is inconvenient. Could spotify implement a landscape orientation? even if it lacks some of the less important features.

title: User Notifications
author: daveraleigh
body: When somebody subscribes to your playlistWhen somebody "follows' you or adds you as a favoriteability to interact with users via their Profile pageYou done a great job of launching apps (looking foward to more!) but its still tough to really communicate with other Spotify users. and a big one re: Music Notification when an artist in your library has new material added to Spotify

title: Gapless Playback
author: Seegs108
body: Many albums that are released are meant to be gapless between songs. It's also something useful for concert recordings and other split music and media that is played through Spotify. This is a very common feature that is used by the best music programs. Is anyone else interested in seeing this implemented soon?

title: Please make the Spotify Android app functionally equivalent to the Spotify iOS app
author: SteveBrammer
body: A new version of the Spotify iOS app (0.4.23) has just been released, giving 320kbps streaming quality amongst other improvements. Can you please realease a new version of the Spotify Android app which is functionally equivalent to the iOS app? We need playlist folders (which iOS has had for some time) and 320kbps streaming. Or is Android always going to play second fiddle to iOS in Spotify's world? Update 2012-04-16: Spotify iOS app (0.4.24) has now been release, and still no update for Android!

title: iPad app
author: Niklas
body: We want a ipad app! 🙂

title: Way to prevent duplicates in playlists.
author: LakeWorthB
body: I have big playlists, and would like a built in way to prevent duplicates from occuring in my playlists. This could be an option to prevent, or select/hide duplicates.

title: Enable email registration to Spotify
author: jayy
body: It would be nice to be able to open up the registration system to more people not just Facebook. This idea will never disappear. I figued I'd post it here in this lovely new community of Spotify.

title: [Playlists] Sorting Options for List of Playlists
author: COCCIDIOIDES
body: I would love to be able to sort my playlists by Artists, then drill down by album so as not to clutter my Spotify. It's pretty hard to organize my playlists the current way. Any ideas on a future iteration that will enable this capability?

title: [Android][Playlists] Group by Album on edit playlist screen
author: alicjasjz
body: It will be very fantastic if in Android app on edit playlist screen I could have possibly to group track lists by albums. Now I can sort only the tracks, but there should be also option to enable for sorting list by Album names, so in consequence all tracks from the list would be as sub-items of album name item to which them belong. Now instead to change only positions of tracks I would have also possibility to change at once positions of album items with all track sub-items from it

title: [Mobile][Playlists] Choose your shows for Daily Drive
author: Isenman
body: I love the daily drive playlist, I listen to it almost every day. However, as a part of the playlist it includes episodes from podcast, some I don’t mind and some are from shows I don’t listen to and just skip. What I am asking for is the ability to remove shows I don’t want to listen to and add shows I do enjoy. Either by Manual selection or by leveraging the activity I spend listening to shows.

title: [Community][Podcasts] Bring Back ELT
author: Meeka
body: You need to bring back the podcast Every Little Thing by Gimlet Media. I can't believe you'd cancel such a show with a dedicated community and fanbase. At least give the crew the rights so that they can keep doing their thing. You can claim you care about your users' experience when you keep supporting Joe Rogan but won't let ELT continue. I'm truly disappointed.

title: [Mobile][Browse] "Continue playing from here" button
author: FelaDamonte
body: When I'm finishing a playlist I'd like to search for a song/playlist to play that song next, and then the corresponding playlist/album/radio (of the new selected song)

title: On/off switch for suggested songs
author: Vloudermilk
body: Add an on/off button for users to decide whether or not they would like Spotify to play suggested songs when the user is listening to a personally created playlist.

title: [Mobile][Search] Search liked songs by genre
author: sandro_2233
body: Wouldn't it be useful to be able to browse your liked songs by genre? For example, I want to hear rock songs, then I just go to the search bar for my liked songs and type in "rock" and all my liked rock songs appear. Of course, the same would work for other genres as well, e.g. pop, metal, lofi, french songs, german songs and so on. I think this feature would be of great use and would save time

title: Option for a homepage without videos and songs that automatically start playing
author: pgfb
body: The new homepage is incredibly annoying. I don't want all the videos and I DEFINITELY don't want random songs (from artists I have never listened to!) to automatically start playing as soon as I start Spotify. When I click mute, this is simply ignored the next time I start Spotify. I don't mind suggestions for new songs/artists, but I don't want them forced on me like this. Please bring back the old homepage.

title: Canvas option to play on a TV
author: Idjimen
body: Would be a good idea to have audio and visual. May draw in more customers.....great selling point to friends and family.

title: [Desktop][Other] Fullscreen - Artwork Display
author: 666VOID
body: Please bring back artwork display when enabling fullscreen.It used to be this way, but now it only shows a tiny version of the artwork and the rest of my giant monitor is filled with some band dudes. When listening to music and not on my PC I treat Spotify as a screensaver and like to look at the artwork.Please bring this back - at least as an option.

title: [Mobile][Other] Add Ability to Block Podcasts or Artists
author: d_steinburg
body: Need the ability to block podcasts or other content from showing up on your home page or autoplaying. I’ve unfollowed podcasts that I used to listen to that have since become triggering due to some recent life events. I’d like a way to just prevent this stuff from coming up, especially after I’ve unfollowed it.

title: [Mobile][Podcasts] Parental controls for shows in Spotify app
author: ossifrage
body: My young daughter has figured out she can watch videos in the Spotify app. Previously we've had the app without limits because she was just listening to music. Can we have some means to limit access to video (show) content through the app? A moderator suggested Spotify kids, but it's not available in my region.

title: [iOS][Playlists] Since the addition of the plus icon I can’t see my liked songs in an album anymore!
author: gyokushin
body: Since the addition of the plus icon I can’t see my liked songs in an album or playlist anymore! I understand that change can cause confusion and objection, but by doing this you have literally removed functionality that I use everyday. I regularly go to an album or playlist needing to see which songs I have already liked, I can’t remember the name of every song I like especially on film or movie soundtracks, but I do know that I want to listen to a song that I have liked from that album. Before this change I could see a heart icon indicating that I have previously liked that song, but now there is literally nothing at all to suggest that I have added it to any of my playlists, let alone the fact that I like it. There is a conceptual difference between “liking” something and “adding to a playlist” and I understand the change, but I think you may have forgotten about albums and have essentially removed functionality that some people may rely on. I’m not asking you to reintroduce “liked songs” but please introduce the tick back into albums so I can see which songs I have already added to a playlist. Or, if you do change your mind, please put liked songs back again, there was no problem with the way it was 😅 P.s. the plus icon makes no sense at all right now!! If I add a song to a playlist called “instrumental” the plus icon doesn’t change, but if I then click it, it adds it to my “liked songs” playlist. So isn’t it essentially still acting like a like button? If you are serious with this change, that that plus icon needs to be filled if a song is added to “any” playlist not just my “liked songs”.

title: [Your Library] like button
author: aoifee
body: The new update has turned the heart into a plus button. The heart was much more aesthetic and appealing. Additionally it has taken away from the experience of liking songs, making it feel less like an expression of appreciation and customization to your playlists, and more like a methodical business-like process or even job. I suggest that you change it back, as I have heard nothing but negative feedback from others that I know and online.

title: [Community][Developer] Marry (+) and 💚 and optimise user experience with secondary suggestions
author: jamestt
body: I had a small 💡 moment, you could add a (+) next to the 💚 to make adding to playlists easier. This would solve the problem of not impeding user experience and keeping that widely desired separation between Playlist and Likes but also retain the classical reimplemented plus design. Marry the two by including both, separately, side by side. Other suggestions that could optimise user experience:The ability to merge two playlists into one without duplicates.Customise playlist photos on mobileModernising loading screens.Fancy flickering dynamic heart button or other aesthetically satisfying button actions when you tap them.Toggle and isolate your own created playlists from others/AI DJs — and allow it to remain that way until you exit app or toggle back. I don’t have any attachments to include as of right now but if I design some visual notes later down the line, I shall update.

title: [Playlists] Automatically sort a playlist into genres or otherwise similar songs
author: HeddevH
body: The problemLike so many other Spotify users, I have multiple big playlists that are just a big mash of songs I like, not really sorted in any way. I feel like all of my friends who use Spotify or other music apps also have at least one huge generic playlist with all kinds of music mixed together.These lists, over time, usually slowly drift from one genre to another, depending on the kind of music we're currently becoming more interested in. But once I find a genre I truly like and want to listen to it separately from everything else, I only have all of those songs in a big playlist with lots of other stuff mixed in. The goalRather than going through everything manually, it would be awesome if we could let Spotify do most of the work, and let it create the basis of a separate playlist focused on one type of music for us. The app is pretty good at finding similar music, so I assume the parameters to find similar music within a playlist are already there. An example of how this feature could work:For a playlist, we get the option to "Filter songs into separate playlist" (or a catchier name). Once you click it, you need to select a number of songs from your playlist. Once you've selected at least X songs or one or more genres, you can specify how big you want the resulting playlist to be. If I put in 20, Spotify will choose the 20 songs that are most similar to my original selection and throw them all into a new playlist for me, "Selection of {original_playlist_name}". Possible additions could be thatinstead of selecting initial songs, Spotify could also suggest prominent genres or artists in the original playlist;you can dynamically adjust the sample size, and see which songs get added/removed as you increase/decrease it;you get a popup with the next 10 most similar songs after creating the playlist, and can immediately add them to it. That's about it! I feel like this is a big feature I'm missing when it comes to finding new music and exploring that genre, slowly adding more to it. Thanks for reading, and please add any original thoughts or alternatives you think of!

title: Be able to remove a suggested mix from home screen
author: Ritha
body: Sometimes you listen to some songs randomly or have someone use your phone for music which affects the mixes suggested to you, which are displayed on your home page. I want to suggest that one may be a able to remove a suggested mix so that it may reflect what they want to listen to instead of being stuck with these mixes on your homepage. I would like to be able to control what I see on my homepage at least in that aspect.

title: Songwriter
author: SHH5
body: My idea is that there should be a page where songwriters can post their lyrics on Spotify. But only for artists to see. Artists can like the post and request to have the lyrics for their own and the songwriter can approve who they think would be the best fit for their lyrics. The songwriter can take down any posts say if they have given the lyrics away so other artists know the song is no longer up for grabs. This would really improve the music industry and take Spotify to another level as to get your lyrics seen can be a challenging process. Spotify can change all that and make songwriters lives change.

title: [Mobile][Your Library] Increase control over track frequency in favourites
author: sahed
body: I enjoy being able to add songs that I listen to within the favourites folder. It is a convenient way to listen to songs. However at present there does not appear to be a way to increase the chance for a particular song(s) to be played more frequently (in 'shuffle' mode) than any other song. So for example, I have liked the tracks "You can call me Al" and "Original Nuttah 25" so that they appear in my favourites folder, but I might want to play the song "You can call me Al" more frequently within the 'shuffle' mode than the track "Original Nuttah 25". I think the advantage of enabling functionality like this would allow users to have more granular control over the frequency by which tracks get played from within their favourites folder. A rating system like a clickable set of stars (or something similar) might work to achieve this? I understand that users can opt to use folders to separate their music (so that specific tracks get played more often than others) but if you prefer to continually add tracks to your favourite folder, instead of separating your music through folders, then it is a shame that there is no way to have more control over what tracks are played more frequently from within the favourites folder?

title: [Desktop] [Web Player] add a checkmark for songs that are already in a playlist
author: casst
body: I think it would be cool to add a checkmark or indication beside playlists when adding a song. explaining is not exactly my thing, so I made it more visual LUL. as you can see, I make a lot of playlists; most of the time they are not even finished, but they are fun to make when I need to pass some time. However, I usually forget what songs I added to a playlist, so I get easily irritated when trying to add a song that is already in a playlist and trying to find more songs which ends up being in the same playlist already. I strongly believe this would be great for people who loves to make playlists - like myself, to have this feature because I am sure that most people becomes frustrated when they try to add songs that is already in their playlist. This feature will save a bunch of time and will not ruin the fun of making a playlist!

title: Sort saved music by release date!!
author: jmiles4miles
body: Sorting & filtering diversity could definitely expand in a few areas, but I organizing your saved music in your library by release date/year is a big one that is overlooked. For example, I like seeing the newest albums at the top of my "albums" section. So when new albums come out that I save, I use the "recently added" filter to push them to the top. However, if I save a throwback classic rock album from the 70's, that has no business being sorted with all of my recently released albums at the top of my screen!

title: [iOS][Podcasts] Make a functional “new podcast” feed
author: AcrylicAlysz
body: I really miss the convenient “new podcast” feed in my “library” on the iPhone app. The new horizontal “your shows” on the “home” page is clunky, incomplete and not user friendly. I primarily use Spotify for podcasts. This feels like a backwards move that discourages users to pick spotify over other podcast platforms. Thank you for your time.

title: [Web Player][Other] having a custom spotify profile home screen for the web player(renamed)
author: Echo_The_Cute_Wolf
body: ima say this again let's have this on the web player Having a Spotify’s custom profile home screen for the web player would allow users to customize the look and feel of their web-based music listening experience. Users could rearrange the order of their playlists, choose from various background images to set the mood of the profile, add custom messages in the profile description, and even set the order and size of their artwork for each playlist. Additionally, users could also choose to feature their favorite playlists and artists on the home screen to make it easier to access and explore their music. This feature would provide a more personalized and enjoyable music-listening experience, while also increasing user engagement with the platform. how about that title and PLUS it's not the same! -𝓑𝓪𝔂𝓔𝓬𝓱𝓸0

title: [iOS][Your Library] HORRIBLE SHUFFLE ALGORITHM
author: DAnbutts
body: The shuffle algorithm for liked songs is horrible, i have more than 2000 liked songs yet it seems to prioritize my most listened to songs. My shuffle plays the same 200 songs instead of truly randomizing the total 2000 songs. I have tried uninstalling and installing, i have cleared caches on my phone, i have also re organized my playlist by album/artist/order. Yet problem persists on all my devices. The shuffle algorithm is clearly the problem. There is about 100 Reddit pages of people having this same issue yet Spotify refuses to fix the issue. I have spent 3 hours with tech support chat and it is utterly useless. I will be cancelling if this continues.

title: [Mobile][Podcasts] Podcast by language and not country
author: molram
body: Hi,I am a user living in Germany but my mother language is spanish. When I want to explore the Podcast, I would love to explore by Language and not country, or have some mean to have a better way to explore Podcast depending on these 2 criterias. My main problem is when I press on any category I only see the podcast in german, and I want to see the results in spanish, or gave some means to set this. I asked even for support and they recommended me to make a post here. So here we are :), I would love to have this "fixed?/implemented?"? Thank you in advance,Antonio

title: [Mobile] Option to disable AI DJ voice
author: Spaceboy88
body: Please allow us an option to turn off the AI DJ voice. I like the songs it plays, but the voice can be annoying and distracting. It would be nice if you could have the option to turn it off. We can still see what category it’s pulling music from on the top header text without the commentary.

title: [Mobile][Other] Allow DJ voice to be disabled (STFU mode)
author: sspotts
body: I moved to streaming music because I do not, ever, under any circumstances, want to hear any kind of "personality" talking between songs. Whether it's AI or human. I just want to hear the music. So if you're adding an AI "DJ", allow us to make it not speak and just play music, please. Just music. It ruins the moment to have some random chatter in between songs, introductions to songs, and anything else that's not a song. Please, if you think some people will like it, know that others will not, and allow us to disable the speaking part. Let the AI figure out what songs to play, but let it be quiet.

title: [Desktop] Disable Hotkeys/Shortcuts or Create Custom Key binds
author: Ryujin_
body: Add the option to create custom key binds or disable keyboard shortcuts in the desktop app. It's really annoying when I accidentally hit a hotkey/keybind/shortcut because I forgot to click back into whatever I was working on after checking what song is playing.

title: [Mobile][Playlists] Add bookmark within an Album or Playlist to continue listening from later
author: megabidoof
body: Hi, For times when I want to listen to a playlist or Album fully, but have to stop midway, I want to add a marker or bookmark for where to continue listening from again later.There are various reasons for stopping and interrupting the queue of songs. For example:Listening during a journey then arriving at the destination.Listening during an activity then completing it.Suddenly wanting to play a different song outside the album or playlist, which then clears the queue or losing track of where you were. I used to use the Like icon for this, as it visually marked a song. But now this feature has disappeared in recent updates and I often won’t remember where to continue a playlist or album from. As a workaround, I now screenshot the last played song, despite not being ideal as it is a feature outside the scope of Spotify. I appreciate that some artists or curators designed their album or playlist to be played in a specific order. There are times when I want to have the intended experience whilst balancing real-life demands that require me to pause, then resume later.I would like for there to be some kind of visual marker or new feature for this. Or bring the heart like icon marker back on songs.Many thanks,megabidoof

title: [Android][Browse] Allow users to revert to the old layout
author: Soshi
body: change idea: Please let me change the layout back. While I appreciate album art, scrolling through gigantic blocks of screen space with no utility is honestly infuriating. The UX just doesn't make any sense and there's no reason to implement this change, which makes it harder to find what I actually want for the benefit of... larger album art? I cannot imagine this was tested with users, and would simply like to go back to the old interface for Android.

title: [Discover] A "work mode" to prevent working/studing music being mixed with the normal genres
author: Auxiliaris
body: I listen to entirely different kinds of music while studying/working (lofi, classic, ect.) than in my free time when riding the bus ect. A work mode would prevent the "for you" recommendations from being messed up.You could get recommendations for work while being in work mode, and normal ones when you turn it off.This would solve my problem of having lofi ect. in my "mix of the week".

body: So like x the new dj does the vibe change thing but sometimes I wish it would just stay on the same vibe and not change after a couple songs

title: [iOS][Other] Private Session In One Click
author: mdanilau
body: Hello! I like, that Spotify has a huge library, which includes a lot of kids songs and nature noises. It's extremely useful to distract a baby in the road or to play rain sounds for better sleep. There is a private session functionality in the app, but it takes a lot of clicks on iOS (and I assume on any mobile device) to enable it:Settings -> Privacy & Social -> Private Session Toggle Playing a kids song or nature sounds may be an urgent task, so there is no time for three clicks. As the result I had "white noise" and "rain sounds" in the Spotify Wrapped last year. It would be nice to have any solution, to make it possible to enable a private session in one click.

title: [Mobile][Other] Go back to the old layout
author: Uh10
body: Nobody likes this, nobody wants this, just keep the same layout as before. It wasn't broken, so don't try to fix it. You are not TikTok. You are Spotify. Just be Spotify. I miss the days when we had multiple apps and websites instead of just the same one over and over again trying to copy whatever's most popular. And who asked for a DJ, too?

title: [Mobile][Other] Shuffle Artists
author: Lightning95
body: There should be a feature on Spotify where you can shuffle through artists and only play songs by them. You should be able to select as many artists as you’d like to shuffle together. For example if I want to listen to The Front Bottoms and McCafferty and only those two, I should be able to select them in my library and press Shuffle Artists to play songs by those two artists.

title: Get a Spotify app functionality of a 60 year old turntable
author: Acerbic-Curmudgeon
body: I dumped SIRUS XM streaming service and subscribed to Spotify when I found that you had the complete discographies with all of the albums of bands that I like. However, I was shocked and dismayed, to learn that there is no way to add multiple Albums to the playing Queue. Doesn’t it shame you that your program doesn’t even have the technological functionality of a 60 year old phonograph, or a 40 year old CD player? If I were one of your programmers, I would certainly be ashamed about this. I wrote you about a year ago to complain about this issue, and basically got a reply reminiscent of the old Lily Tomlin bit about the phone company saying “we don’t care, because we don’t have to“. Well, this has been bugging me more and more over time. And if I ever find a streaming service that has this functionality where I can stack albums like, on an old phonograph or CD player, I’m going to drop Spotify in a heartbeat and switch over to them. Mike

title: [Android][Other] The new home screen is bad. And the old one was better.
author: clockboi
body: You recently updated the home screen removing many features I enjoyed that already did what this so called update was claiming to do. The new home screen feels under developed because it's clearly trying to turn music listening into a ticktock experience and that is so far from what I want out of my music app. I honestly feel repulsed that they are even trying this. How am I supposed to access discovery and everything else that was offered from the old home screen? I can't and that's stupid. The new home screen has video playing for most of the cards there. I specifically turned that feature off in the settings for every other time video had been played. YET, video is still playing in the new home screen. Am I going to have to go on desktop to get the old version of the home screen I liked? or is that going to be removed as well?

title: “End of the Queue” Sleep Timer Option
author: AriW20
body: Add an “end of the queue” option for the sleep timer. The sleep timer will turn off once the last song in your queue is played. With the current system songs get stopped in the middle once the timer is up. That isn’t so good is it? With this system you can choose exactly how many songs you want to play before Spotify stops!

title: [Web Player][Browse] Add comprehensive filtering options to the UI
author: Wootenblatz
body: Before I explain my idea, I'd like to reference this idea as related suggestion. That idea is definitely something I would appreciate. While it is Library specific, I'd like to suggest a more pervasive set of UI filters. In my idea description, I'm going to refer to high level music Genres as Categories as that is how the Spotify API presents that concept. Subgenres of music will be called Genre, again to match the API. This idea is not suggesting changes to nomenclature, but I want to clarify these terms to ensure the idea's intent is clear. For instance, most people consider Hip Hop a genre (Spotify Category ID 0JQ5DAqbMKFQ00XGBls6ym) and if we look up an artist like Jay-Z (Spotify artist ID 3nFkdlSjzX9mRTtwJOzDYB), he is associated with the following subgenres that appear like so in an API request:"genres": ["east coast hip hop","hip hop","rap"] With that out of the way, my idea is as follows. Regardless of which screen I am using in the UI, I want to filter results based the following concepts (when applicable). I'm going to present these in a short user story format. As a user I would like to be able to filter results by Category on any screen that is not organized by Category already. As a user I would like to filter by based on Genre on any screen that supports filtering by Category or is already organized by Category. As a user I would like to filter results based on the type of release the result is classified as, including Albums, EP, Singles, or Playlists. I'd expect that non-music results would include or omit this filter based on the content type.As a user I would like to filter results based on when it was released. If possible, New (two weeks), Recent (last three months), This year, Last Year and then either by numeric year or decades (i.e. 2020s, 2010s, 2000s, 1990s, etc...)As a user I would like to see a column in results that shows which artist released the track, separate from all of the artists that appeared on the track.As a user I would like to filter results by the "Release Artist" column to quickly differentiate between "featured on" tracks and tracks released by a specific artistDependent on the above: As a user I'd like to have a way to perform some kind of negation search by release artist. Either a search engine pattern of -Artist Name or a more dynamic option similar to how Excel tables support quick filtering by column headings.In closing I'd like to provide some real-world application use scenarios that become possible with the above that are nearly impossible with the current UI: I'm looking for new full albums for a specific music genre (category) and/or subgenre. My goal is to discover new artists for a type of music I like or new releases by artists I'm already a fan of. By filtering result type for Albums, I will not see all of the playlists, EPs, and singles. I'm searching for a specific artist but only want to see albums that were released by that artist. I'd start by searching for the artist's name then select "Albums" in the release type filter and enter the artist's name again in the Release Artist filter. I'm searching for a specific artist name but would like to only see results that were released by other artists. For instance, I want to find all of the songs that 2pac appeared on as a featured artist but were not on his albums. I'd search for 2pac and filter the release artist column using the negation mechanism described in the last item.

title: [Mobile][Playlists] Filter playlists by artist
author: ivana_tyson
body: I use playlists daily. We need the ability to filter playlist searches that include songs from a specific artist. If a playlist is 10 hours long, I don't want to scroll through each list and hundreds of songs to see if the artist is included. For example, if I am looking for a Silent Disco playlist that has songs from Sean Paul, or a Christmas Playlist with songs from Leslie Odom Jr., or Country Playlist with songs from Morgan Wallen. Please make that possible.

title: [Community][Social] Digitize Kat
author: Madogu
body: The new AI DJ is a fun addition to Spotify. And I'll be honest, X is an awesome first go at it. His voice and personality really shine through. But you know what I really miss? The banter between X and Kat from The Get Up. I know this might be a bit outside your wheelhouse, but if you could not only Digitize Kat, but have those AI DJ's interact (ala "Nothing Forever"), that would be AMAZING!!! 😍🤩😜🤯 #digitizekat

title: [Other] Spotify Store Front
author: Creepie_Spider
body: I love the artist merch shops, but browsing the is painful, I very much think that having a store front to browse all artists you follow, as well as recommendations, be able track products and general make the Spotify shop more fleshed out.

title: [Mobile][Playlists] Bring back enhanced (2023)
author: JustGordon
body: A couple weeks ago, I got an update from spotify and my phone automatically installed it. To my shock and horror, Spotify has removed the only feature I use called ENHANCED. I was pretty annoyed but hoped it was a bug and eventually got help from Spotify Support. They said that the feautre has been removed and is likely not to come back unless we have at least 180 votes to gain the attention of Spotify's team in the community section. Enhanced is a really usefull feature to myself as I have found new songs to listen to and also the ability to forsee the playlist in advance whilst adding the music that I like or removed the ones I don't. Please can you share and get other people to vote on this topic too! Thank you very much

title: Keep The Enhance Button
author: WhoWright
body: Spotify has had the enhance button and the enhance shuffle but i believe the button is more convenient and less annoying. I am in an area with bad service so i tend to notice when i want to take my music off of shuffle with the enhance shuffle, I am forced to wait an extended amount of time due to enhance shuffle not getting service. With the enhance button, it gives more options like listening to my playlist in order with new recommendations thrown in or shuffle if i hit shuffle on the playlist. It gives us more control over the playlist when the enhance button is there. I am a big fan of the option in general but i personally believe the button is more beneficial than the enhance shuffle option.

title: Availability on the VIDAA platform
author: pmans
body: As a avide spotify user, my spotify account is linked to all my devices. It was a massive surprise to me when I bought a new Toshiba smart TV (that uses the VIDAA operating platform) to find that I am unable to download the spotify app. All Hisense and Toshiba units use the VIDAA platform, and Deezer and Apple Music is both available (among others). When engaging spotify support - they recommended I post it here. To my understanding - it should be an easy fix - since spotify is available on most other app stores and platforms... The site where spotify can be linked to this platform is:https://www.vidaa.com/partners/ Thanks so much. Looking forward to downloading the app on this platform soon 🙂

title: Maps
author: ck40
body: Let us ad pictures to maps, and make them available for mobile

title: [Playlists] Group songs
author: k2r79
body: Hi 👋 To date, songs can be shuffled in all types of song queues (playlists, radios, artist pages, etc.) which is cool to have that feeling of surprise when the next song comes up. When listening to truly independent songs that don't have any relation to the previous song in the album (most music after year 2000) this works perfectly but when listening to older songs (the Beatles for example) or more niche genre (like Dream Theater's Metropolis) songs that should be played in order end up being shuffled without respecting the artist's vision. I know this feature is pretty complicated and has a big impact but it would be great if artists and users could define song groups (if needed) that would avoid a song from being separated from its siblings. A song group would be atomic and ordered. When adding a song to your playlist, you would get a popup asking if you want to add the song group or just the single song. If the song group is added to the playlist, when shuffled the group would be treated as a single song whereas it contains multiple tracks. A user could also change the way song groups are managed through the setting panel.

Don't be like YouTube where there is only one "add to playlist" button that makes it highly inefficient and annoying. Who's the product manager/owner behind this decision?

title: [Community][Other] Make Spotify available in Somalia
author: katarighe
body: Dear Spotify users, My name is Mohamed, a Spotify user from Canada. I'm temporarily living in Somalia as of October 2020 (during COVID-19) for personal & family reasons. I feel very bored when Spotify becomes unavailable in the location where I’m living and this is disappointing. Many people in Somalia were thrilled when Spotify has expanded to Africa 2 years ago, that was on February 2021. This included neighboring Kenya, Djibouti, and Ethiopia. However, users in Somalia are frustrated that Spotify hasn’t become available here yet. The company launched its service in to Ethiopia 3 months ago as of today. I am happy that I can listen to my favorite playlists in most parts of the world but frustrated that Spotify is taking a long time to launch its services in Somalia. Accessing via Virtual Private Network (free or paid) is also not worth it since Spotify does not allow listeners to use VPNs due to piracy or security concerns. After sending 2 separate emails to Customer Support team last month on this issue, a representative told me that the Spotify is still launching regularly in countries around the world and the process is not yet over. They recommended me to wait until the Spotify becomes ready in Somalia, especially when this page disappears (see screenshot below). While the Customer Support team can’t confirm if or when this is due to be released in the country, only the product teams are in charge of this issue. The only way to get their attention is to make my voice heard by the Spotify community, as listeners can then vote, discuss, and show their support for my proposal/idea. Therefore, I am proposing this idea to the community recommending Spotify launch its service in Somalia. Millions of Somalis want to get their hands on the millions of songs exclusively on the portal that are not available anywhere else, like YouTube, SoundCloud, or Deezer, which remain available in the country. In the last 5 years, Spotify expanded its service to 180+ countries from Europe and North America to Africa and the Pacific Islands without any restrictions, representing 90% of the world population, and the access is very similar to YouTube or Netflix. To support my idea/proposal, I conducted a survey of around 100 people living in the country asking them if the platform should become available or not, and here are the results:All of the participants agree that Spotify should become available in Somalia and no one has opposed my idea/proposal.Right now, the majority of the population access Music via the YouTube video-streaming platform.If Spotify is launched, dependence on the platform (YouTube) would be significantly reduced.Stream-ripping and other piracy-related Music activities would also be over, as they will rely on the internet for listening to music and podcasts. Somali artists at home and overseas have been releasing their songs on Spotify for the past few years, which can only be accessible to the Somali diaspora community where Spotify is available and not here.Similar to the Ethiopians, the Somali diaspora is mostly present in Canada, the US, the UK, Sweden, Denmark, Norway, Italy, Africa (especially countries bordering Somalia), and the Middle East. Common artists on the platform include Hassan Aden Samatar, Sharma Boy, and K’Naan.One participant told me that if he can access millions of movies and TV shows on Netflix – then why not Spotify do the same as well with their songs and podcasts?Aside from the survey, here is the overall situation of Somalia (following research):Not subjected to international sanctions or embargoes, similar to Cuba, Syria, Iran, North Korea, and Sudan.Has PayPal, Visa & Mastercard payment services allowing users to make online purchases, such as Spotify Premium.Uses Somali Shillings (SOS) and United States Dollars (USD) for domestic transactions while USD is used for international transactions.Has high-speed internet access like Fiber Optic (up to 50 megabytes) and 4G LTE (up to 100 megabytes).The number of internet users in Somalia has increase to a 3-digit figure in the past decade.Over 70% of Somalis have access to 4G LTE Mobile Internet with 5G currently on the works.Considered as one of the top countries in the world with affordable high-speed internet.In 2020, the country ranked number one in Africa, and seventh worldwide in terms of mobile data prices.1GB of data costs $0.5 USD and unlimited high-speed internet of $15-20 USD monthly. Compared with Canada, that is 5 to 8 times cheaper here.I pay nearly $100 CAD (or $75 USD) monthly for 100GB data, with hidden data charges.Mobile data plans in Canada are the most expensive the world. Official languages of Somalia are Somali, Arabic, and English, similar to the Arab World and Djibouti.Here is the screenshot below saying that Spotify is inaccessible in my country. When I attempt to manage my account details and my music playlists, the request is denied and redirects to the page instead. It is quoted as "Spotify is currently not available in your country. Follow us online to find out when we launch." My IP address is 102.68.17.7 and the location is Mogadishu, Somalia, the browser is Google Chrome and the operating system is Windows 10. On the opposite, was able to access Spotify via Virtual Private Network (VPN) but the system will prompt me to turn off before using it and will return back to the same message (per screenshot). I have now concluded with my discussion. Besides your vote, feel free to ask questions regarding this post. I'm ready to answer them comprehensively. You are also welcome to give comments on what my life is like without Spotify. 😁😁 Thanks,Mohamed Proud Spotify listener since 2019.

title: New podcast episodes

I gotta get on google and find people who also got duped by this curveball, just to find out that we gotta navigate the app twice as much now just for pods. “What’s New?”?! This bs you just threw at me, that’s new. Why? Makes no sense

title: [iOS][Your Library] Bring back the “like song”
author: ZackSkellington
body: Why can’t I “like” a song anymore? Why do I have to click the plus sign and “add it to playlist” of my liked songs? This is a horrible idea. Where did the little green heart go to show me which songs I’ve liked? When I open an album, the little green hearts that show which songs I’ve liked are gone. Please bring them back. Nobody likes this new “add to playlist” idea. We just want to like songs. Not have to add them to a playlist called Likes Songs.

title: Bring back Hearted Songs & More Queded Options
author: Jeanessya
body: I would love to see the hearted songs option to come back. I would also like to see more options for the que settings such as; being able to add songs from hearted songs from artist being able to be added to the que and being able to remove all songs from que. This would be a more a user friendly experience for me and a few people. Sidenote: I think a playlist from the top (consumer/listener) streamer from all different genres monthly/weekly would be nice and an amazing experience. It would be also be nice if some of the older songs were available (“Chocolate Coated Candy” by Pleasure P), but I know this may be out of y’all’s control. Just a thought. Y’all are rocking it! Thank you! Apple Music could never! 😬🤭

I'd like to be suggested songs that are similar to those I listen to during the day. title: [Other] A new set of personlized playlists like the repeat playlists.
author: Amayy
body: The repeat playlists contain 30 songs as of now. But on the Desktop App/Web App, we can see our monthly top 50 songs. I have to use a third-party service (volt.fm) to get my top 99 songs of all time (wrapped), monthly (4 weeks), and 6 months. It is easier because I can just use my phone to create that playlist. It also supports auto-update when your stats change. Spotify needs to have more songs in their personalized playlists or stats playlists and take some things from wrapped to daily usage. I think people would love to see these mixes, without having to wait for wrapped. I would love to see my stats in the Spotify App anytime I want in this way. I hate to go to the website (volt.fm), again and again, to create playlists or see how am I doing. On the profile page, there could be a list of the user's top songs with the same 3 categories: monthly, 6 months, and all-time or playlists in the Made For You category. If there are new playlists, there is no need to make a whole new section to see stats. We can simply see our top playlists for different time frames.

title: [iOS][Search] ‘My Library’ search switches to ‘All Spotify’ search if no results
author: sebwin
body: Modify the ‘My Library’ search window to search ‘All of Spotify’ if no results found in your playlists.I spend most of my time in My Library when using Spotify (iOS app). Very frequently I’ll hear a new song I want to hear.I’ll open Spotify (which will open in ‘My Library’ and instinctively click the ‘magnifying glass’ at the top of the screen and start typing the song, which will result in “Couldn’t find…” I’ll then have to perform 3 clicks to exit and enter the main Spotify search bar and re type my query, which is annoying. I’d like the option that, if you type something in the ‘My Library’ search bar that comes up with no results, either: - The same window automatically performs a whole Spotify search- A button appears saying “No results, search Spotify?” which automatically passes my query to the same search window

title: Track Limiter

body: AS I LIKE TO LISTEN TO JUST SOME PARTS OF THE MUSIC TRACK, A TRACK LIMITER WILL BE USEFUL TO PLAY JUST WHAT WE LIKE

title: [Playlists] DJ AI
author: Sup3rH4ns
body: I was wondering whether at you had considered developing an AI to massively improve your cross-fade function so that it actively mixes tunes rather than just doing the basic fade which seems rather crude given what machine learning should be able to do in this area. Beat matching, taking key and other such things into account. Like a DJ AI. Kinda like chat G P T maybe, but for music rather than language. AI is being used to try and do things better than humans in many different domains. It seems feasible that an AI could be developed to mix better than most humans without *too* much difficulty. The feature would massively improve the ecosystem and potentially revolutionize DJing.

title: Off to Bed Spotify
author: n598
body: Part of having a Spotify account is the strength of the suggestive algorithm. I feel like I have a strong ability to direct the product through my liked songs and listening habits. That being said, a lot of users will listen to a different genre of music while they sleep than the music they like to explore and listen to while conscious. The Spotify algorithm is really impressive so it's annoying when it's providing me new music in a genre I don't need any new additions to. There should be a way to stop including certain music when Spotify calculates what music to generally suggest you. There are two easy solutions: 1. a button that stops a playlist from influencing your algorithm. 2. a button that turns off your listening habits' influence on the algorithm for a set period of time (suggestion: 8-10 hours) before reverting back. I think the playlist switch feels more intuitive (as many people don't even include the songs on these in their likes) but I am always in support of more advanced user controls to let us realize the algorithm as a tool and aide. The playlist button is also a one time click experience v. a continuous engagement with the button every day. I think the one time click is something every user would prefer, and it's not like y'all need the feature as an engagement mechanism, they are already using the product.

title: [Mobile][Playlists] Explore Playlist Mode
author: Rjelm90
body: The idea is to have a mode to listen to a playlist. Let’s say you find a new playlists or get a playlist recommendation. You want to browse through it all but you don’t have time to listen to it in one sitting. So you turn on the explore mode on that playlist. Here the app registers which songs pf the playlist you have already played. Next time you go onto the playlist and play it, it continues where you dropped off, so you get to go through all songs and you know which ones you have already heard

title: [Mobile][Other] Permanent Spotify Notification and more pinned folder/playlists
author: aflechtreck

I don't always want to unlock my phone when I want to start music or switch to Spotify while using another app. Second idea is to have more pinned folders/playlists and to have those displayed in the Spotify Notification to be able to start them form there. This is again about being able to change playlist faster and easier. Also it should be possible to create a folder in the phone app and not only on desktop. And automated/manual folder images. Thanks for listening to suggestions:)
