Near about 90% of indian population is middle class and a large number of youth is your costumer. Most of them don't have subscription of Spotify including me. So why don't you do one thing, you should run ads of different companies or foundations which will give you money for ads. Because Indian middle class population doesn't need subscription and they will not take subscription after seeing your ads . So it will be better to run ads like YouTube and make more money 💰💰. If you want to increase time on _Spotify _ by Indian audiance you can give them some greed like if they listen songs or something for 3 hours a day they will get like 20 rupees and after month ends they have 600 rupees which they can withdraw which is so much for a youngster in middle class family and you can show them 3 to 4 ads in an hour so it will be more profitable for you .

title: [Mobile] Blind people - Shake Phone for getting the next song
author: Andy-Meier
body: It would be so much easyer for our blind son to get to the next song if he could simply shake the phone for that. Just make a toggle on/off for this function to prevent misfunction when people sports (jogging,…).It would be great to get the shake-for-next-function on spotify.

title: [Desktop][Your Library] Like all songs from an album
author: Gruel1
body: Like on mobile apps, when one clicks the three dots on an album, one can like all the songs within that album simultaneously instead of having to click like on each individual song of the album.

title: [Desktop]Users should be able to post another picture so the profile is showing 2 different pictures
author: _tian4
body: At the moment, users can create a profile picture for others to identify their account. We are able to write out name but then thats it. All personalization is done and the profile can look boring and bland.Behind the profile, there is just empty space. Users should be able to post another picture so the profile is showing 2 different pictures: 1 as a circle and a rectangle on in the background so all space is used. In idea to do this is when people want to edit their name, they can also edit their background at the same time. Users dont have to and can stick with a circle, not compulsory.This adds more style to peoples accounts.

title: Suggesting Songs to Friends
author: PepperSama
body: Just like there's an option to like a song, there should be an option to suggest a certain song to a certain friend. Let suggested songs accumulate in a certain playlist as well (i.e. A playlist called "Suggestions by [username]").

title: [Other] Please stop marketing Spotify Duo exclusively to romantic couples!
author: echoforest
body: Spotify Duo is available to any two people living at the same address, and those two people may not be in a romantic relationship. Yet Spotify seems to assume that every pair of Duo customers are a couple. This makes things awkward for siblings, friends, parents & their children, etc. who live at the same residence.I think it is fine and perfectly reasonable to have advertisements for Spotify Duo aimed at romantic couples, as many customers may be together, however, once two people become Duo customers, the app should not assume that they are a couple. Ever.This would require a change of wording (and possibly imagery) across every piece of messaging post-signup.Thank you for taking the time to read my suggestion - I hope it is written clearly enough! This has personally been bothering me, and I'm sure it is bothering others too.

title: 🌙❤️☺️ [iOS][Developer] Add more sleep timer options
author: 0linski
body: I usually like to fall asleep listening to podcasts but can only put the timer to a max of 1 hour or end of episode and this is a problem for me because I usually listen to about two or three podcasts around 35 minutes long each. Could I kindly suggest an upgrade on the sleep timer options with either more hours or more episodes before shutdown so my playlist doesn’t continue during my sleep? Thank you immensely for your time. ❤️

title: [iOS][Connect] More ways of logging in.
author: W1key
body: Right now you can log into your account using either your email and password or the original method (e.g. Facebook). The issue is, if you have connected your spotify account to facebook, you cannot link it to google or apple to log in differently. Let’s change it so it would be easier for everyone to change our ways of logging in.

title: [iOS] Play next or play last
author: Getthetowelout51
body: I have recently come over from Apple Music and Spotify is better but one thing I do miss is the play next or play last feature instead of the just add to queue feature as I would like to queue music but want to listen to whole of album I am listening to first

title: [iOS][Connect] Longer Student discount
body: Hello, The reason why I bring this idea up is because I was actually able to apply for a student Spotify account in high school since I was able to take some college courses. The reason why I believe it should be extended is because you don’t know what the persons situation is whether that be they took early classes or graduate school. I was for some reason able to receive the discount in high school since I took college course that my school allowed to get ahead. In all honestly I could afford it more being a high school student more so than a college student. Now is the time when I really need the discount and since the 4 years are up it is now unable for me to apple to my account. I wish they would have looked more into my previous request in high school and charged me regular price than now. Please extend this as I have more bills to pay for now then I ever did. not only that but the fact that it includes Hulu is an extreme plus. I’m just an actual college student (a junior) looking to save money for my future and still be able to enjoy Spotify and all the pros it has in my life. Whether that be calming music to study to or watching Hulu in my free time.

title: [Other] Allow multiple profiles on the same device for easy family switching
author: rkwilson1
body: Provide a way for us to switch between profiles within a single account or easily toggle between accounts on the same device - see Netflix, Stan, Amazon, Binge, Apple... for examples of how this can look. Having to log out of an account then log into another is antiquated at best. The only reason I haven't switched providers is that I like Spotify, but this is wearing thin now.Please don't close this thread, like all the others requesting this feature, just because it may involve some dev!

title: [Social]
author: remplia
body: bring back the old form of sharing lyrics

title: Playlist Folders
author: Sofiachrisa
body: Implement playlist folders as an option to organize custom/liked playlists by genre, author, or just overall vibe 🤭 I don’t like scrolling through all my playlists especially when I forget what I named it, so it would be cool to have playlists better organized

title: [Search] Search by Lyric
author: MRKUS
body: A lyric search feature would be a useful tool for Spotify users, making it easier to find songs for which they do not know the title. Users would be able to find and listen to music that they may have heard before but were unable to recognize if they could search for songs by lyrics. Users might also search for music based on a certain lyric or phrase that speaks to them, providing them with more tailored choices. This function may also be useful for users who do not speak the language of the song they are looking for since they can utilize translated lyrics to find the music they are seeking for.

title: [Social] International Family Premium
body: My wife has been seconded overseas for some months. We now cannot use the Family Premium account. The idea of an account that allows people to live in different nations for some periods of time has been raised before by someone else, and rejected on the basis that "it doesn’t meet one of our Idea Exchange guidelines, namely point 7: No pricing, subscription or content related requests." Also, the reason was given that a Family Premium account necessitates that all persons live in the same address. We know that, we understand that. We want this stipulation to change, or for an alt account to exist whereby family members can continue to benefit from a family package, even when not living at the same address. In 2023, this is a reasonable request. Please do not dismiss this request simply because of extant policy; instead, consider changing your policy. Please also consider if Idea Exchange guideline point 7, specifically the subscription section, is appropriate; because by having it you are laying out your stall that you can arbitrarily dismiss ideas without giving them due consideration.

title: search mode on android auto for people with speech difficulties
author: zarradaniele

I think that for safety in the car it could be a distraction to type a song but there is always the passenger. in many other apps the function exists for example google maps. ok! the possibility of not being able to find a song by typing it puts a strain on a person with speech difficulties. for example a Mute person. hi and thanks

title: [Tizen][Search] Filter/search your library on Tizen
author: tim_pear_

For instance, if you use the current search feature with speech-to-text search (the keyboard is well developed by Samsung but not utilized by Spotify's app) to find one of your own playlists, first you have to say the playlist name correctly, then scroll all the way down to playlist results and then hope your playlist shows up somewhere at the top.

title: [Desktop][Other] Play count should use monospace font
author: vimmy
body: See screenshot attached. While 547,912,381 and 155,342,800 are both in the hundreds of millions the font kerning makes it look like 155 is the bigger number. It's a very small detail but either using a monospace font or adding a space before / after the separator (, / . depending on locale) might make it more clear so each individual digit is aligned in a column.

title: [All Platforms][Other] Add an alternative german translation without "gender star"
author: Sacer
body: Even though this idea: https://community.spotify.com/t5/Closed-Ideas/Please-let-me-disable-the-stupid-Genderstern/idi-p/546... got closed with a reference to another closed issue here: https://community.spotify.com/t5/Closed-Ideas/All-Platforms-Other-Please-make-genderstar-in-german-l... I just want to open it again. The approach of ideologized language does not fit the valid rules of the german language and therefore it disturbs the whole experience with your service if language settings are set to "German". Please understand that noone want's to cancel that custom version of the german language a minority of people share and use (it's actually only 10% of the population). We just want to have the native german language added back as an option. This wouldn't be so hard as you only have to remove everyting like "*innen". I'd volunteer for the job of i18n that, if it's a matter of staff costs. Just don't ignore over SEVENHUNDRED upvotes for that idea! Please consider that idea. It's not hard to implement and would make the experience of Spotify better for the majority of your german customers. Thanks! inb4: I'll open that idea again, and again, and again. So please at least TRY to dialogue with us.

title: [iOS][Other] Equalizer on Apple Watch
author: Sclievre
body: When I listen to music, I like to tune it to a very specific sound signature. Right now compared to the iPhone, my watch always sounds dull through my AirPods. Therefore, I don’t like listening to music offline on my watch as it does not sound very good. Adding this feature would mean me listening more often on just my apple watch on runs and other situations.

title: [Mobile] Option to resize Lyrics font
author: Jeffian95

title: [Podcasts] DISABILITY as a Podcast Category with Subcategories
author: atypicaltruth
body: Hello,Currently, there are 19 primary categories and 91 subcategories for podcasts and disability is not included in any of these. Disability-themed podcasts are spread out into a variety of categories that do not exactly fit nor represent the content. Even in the primary categories of "Health & Fitness," disability is not an option amongst alternative health, fitness, medicine, nutrition, mental health, and sexuality. The lack of disability as a category or even a subcategory for podcasts mirrors a critical problem in our society - ableism. Creating a podcast category for “disability” helps the disabled community in several ways:1) it makes it easier to find podcasts relating to disability, therefore, more accessible to those who are searching them out2) it helps disability podcast creators to be more discoverable to the demographic of people who are searching it out Being disabled has historically been stigmatized and those within disabled community are working to change that. We are a large community - disability does not discriminate, it impacts every other identity factor: race, ethnicity, sexuality, gender, and socio-economic status. We deserve the ability to have convenient access to content that we can relate to, we deserve representation. Will Spotify be the first to make this bold step for our community? I sure hope so.

title: [Desktop][Developer] More accurate and sensible volume slider
author: Cheesebag
body: The Spotify volume control is a pain to work with. It's been a while since I've seen audio or video software that has this problem, but apparently the most popular audio streaming service is unable or unwilling to implement a proper volume slider. This includes the web service and desktop app. The problem: the slider is linear and our hearing is not. The slider is zero at the one end, 100% at the other end, 50% in the middle, etc. But our hearing is much more sensitive to small variations in amplitude for silent sounds than for loud sounds. In practice, the lower end will appear to be very sensitive, lacking fine control. This makes it difficult to set the correct volume anywhere around the lower/middle end of the slider, while any changes in the lower 10% are barely even noticeable (because you're so close to zero already). In the first graph below you can see how the same increase in volume on the slider will result in a different perceived loudness change depending on how loud the music is. The solution can be quite simple: use an exponential scale. That will make your controls feel significantly nicer and more usable. A volume slider using such a scale will counteract our logarithmic hearing, resulting in a linear perceived loudness scale, where every change in the slider position will always result in the same perceived loudness difference no matter how loud the music is initially. E.g. slide it up 10% and it will always sound 10% more loud.The conventional conversion factor would be 10^(-30/20 * (1-x)). This calculation will produce an energy multiplier that will reduce loudness by 30 decibels when x is 0, and will leave it at full volume when it is 1. Each 0.1 increment of 'x' would change perceived loudness by exactly 3 decibels, which is a pretty commonly recommended increment for volume controls.Few users care about the units but this will feel much more natural and helps them to find the correct volume as easily as possible. Exponential, logarithmic loudness attenuation is the way to go.

title: Allow to Disable Podcasts Bar - Disability Issues
author: aod1985
body: I use Spotify Desktop and the top 'bar' on my home page is ALWAYS Podcasts, which gets in the way of accessing my music content. There's no way to disable this promoted podcast content despite paying for Spotify premium (surely if I pay I should be allowed to rearrange my content?). But here's the issue - I (like many others) am severely deaf so Podcasts are simply unusable for me. You are filling my home page with content I literally am physically unable to use, and can't hide. This is frustrating and anti disability-access. If you continue to promote Podcasts so heavily it becomes clear that part of my subscription fee is being used for content I cannot access and I may become eligible for refund of part subscription fee under Disability Discrimination schemes. If you treat Podcasts like other content (i.e. not clearly and unavaoidably promoted or able to hide) then there is less of a claim against discrimination.

title: Track Recording Date
author: david100
body: Please add the date a track was recorded, preferably by adding a column or, alternatively, by adding a "properties" or similar category to track right-click options. Jazz and classical enthusiasts would find this particularly interesting and helpful, because a particular artist may have recorded different performances of the same piece at different stages of his/her career, and the information used to be available on vinyl LP covers. I'm not interested in CD/track issue dates of previously recorded material as the dates are irrelevant to the original recording date. It's possible that jazz and classical enthusiasts, particular those of us old enough to have grown up with vinyl, are only a small proportion of Spotify's customers - but I hope there are enough of us to get this idea accepted.

body: DetailsJust this week at WWDC (June 22, 2020), Apple announced support for third party music services on the HomePod. title: [All Platforms][Playlists] Add the same song to multiple playlists simultaneously
author: conner_thewhite
body: There is no reason why Spotify shouldn't have a functionality on at least the desktop app where you can drag one song into as many "selected" playlists as you want and have that song added to all of them at the same time… Here's a little more info to back up this request: I'm, for one, the kind of person who obsesses over music, and a huge component of that is the way in which I organize my playlists. I believe it is probably safe to say that most people wish their music was better organized, but the primary reason why they aren't is simply the amount of time it takes to put together quality playlists. Instead, what most people end up with are a small handful of enormous playlist hundreds, if not thousands, of songs that have no rhyme or reason to why they are in the same playlists. To avoid this dilemma, I have spent hours and hours sorting through all my favorite songs and making different types of playlists that they may fit into. One thing I learned early on is that a particular song is likely going to fit into multiple playlists, and this is where the problem lies and the primary reason why most people avoid making well thought out playlists altogether. In order to add a song to all the playlists I want, I have to sit at my computer and continuously drag a new song I want put into different playlists into each individual one over and over again which, when organizing dozens or even hundreds of songs, can take an insane amount of unnecessary time. And that is if you happen to be creating and organizing playlists on the desktop app… if you are trying to do this on your phone, you might as well forget about it - it would take you an hour to add 20 different songs to 10 different playlists. That is why I believe Spotify should add a function (starting on desktop and eventually moving onto mobile like they are likely to do with the "folders" for playlists) in which a single song can be added to multiple playlists at the same time. Attached is a picture originally posted by a subscriber named anaraee who had requested this a few years ago, but apparently wasn't able to get enough traction then... hopefully this time will be different.

title: [Mobile] Add setting to stop videos in app from autoplaying

You gave us the ability to turn off the Canvas music videos, but now autoplaying videos are infiltrating other places on the app, like album covers. (see picture below) There is a play button indicating that it is a video, but it just starts automatically playing without me pressing the play button. I would like for this "feature" to stop. A lot of users can not have constant motion as it is overstimulating and those users should not be forced to endure the videos without having control over it.Please give us an option in the settings to have these videos NOT auto-play!

We still have the feature for add them by clicking on the "plus" icon, but we no longer have a way to remove the song without having to make way more actions than before (click on the plus, remove from the liked playlist, click on done), so my suggestion is: - If you long press on the "check green mark" icon for liked songs, you remove then from you liked songs. I have thousands of songs on my liked songs playlist and sometimes i want to bring them back to the top of the playlist because they got forgotten with the time since i have somemany and some times the shuffle feature doesn't have enough time to play them on a normal day. I used a lot the heart icon to add them and remove then in quickly way (bringing them to the top) and now without the old way i can't do this no more.

title: [Playlists] Solution to false/abusive reporting
author: CloudlightRec
body: Whenever someone reports a playlist - the title and cover art are removed immediately. This is often abused to hurt record labels and playlist curators. After contacting support - the account of someone who abused this system gets taken down. This person then creates another email and free Spotify account and repeats the process. There is a simple solution to the problem - enable reporting feature only after 10 hours of music/podcasts were streamed using the account. It won't change the experience for a normal user but makes copyright abuse impractical. It's cheap and easy to implement and would stop 95% of false claims. Thank you for your consideration.

title: [Your Library] AI create a mashup
author: RohitShelar
body: As you may know, the music streaming market is highly competitive, with many platforms vying for a share of the market. To stay ahead of the competition, I would like to suggest that Spotify consider using AI to offer a unique and differentiated feature that would set you apart from other music streaming platforms.Specifically, I suggest that Spotify explore the possibility of offering a mashup feature that uses AI to automatically generate unique and creative remixes of songs. This feature could allow users to select two or more songs and have the AI create a mashup that combines elements of each track to create a new and exciting remix.I believe that this feature would be highly appealing to users who are looking for a new and innovative way to experience music. It would also give Spotify a competitive edge over other platforms that do not offer a similar feature.

title: [Mobile] Remove current Song from Playlist
author: Hansholz
body: Hi This is a usability improvement for the Mobile devices. Sometimes I want to remove songs from a playlist. This is currently quite a long task to perform on the mobile device. I first have to select the right playlist.Then I have to locate the song, which is not listed alphabetically. They are listed in the order I built the playlist with the oldest first and newest last.Some of my playlists have up to 900 songs in them and scrolling slowly can be difficult and timeconsuming.Then click on the "pencil" icon and delete the track I don't want.I think it would be a better user experience if we could delete songs as easy as it is to add them to a playlist. So here's a suggestion for the mobile app, look there's even a space for it on the info page! Cheers J _____________________UPDATE 3 June 2017I have been contacted by user eviljojo22 who has developed a Plugin that creates a playlist named "Remove from Spotify" and every 45 minutes minutes it deletes every song in it and also in every playlist in which that same song appears (which may not be what you want). However, this is an option that may help you before Spotify gets round to providing this very simple function. Good luck (and Thank you EvilJojo22)Connect on https://spotify-playlist.eivo.fr _____________________UPDATE 7 February 2019I have been contacted by user bamboony who has developed an android app that might solve the problem in the short term:https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=org.bamboomy.delete.deletespotifytrack _____________________UPDATE 15 February 2022They delivered! This feature now exists. Click the three dots while playing a track and select the option "Remove from this Playlist"

title: [iOS][Playlists] Enhance mode add & delete for CarPlay mode
author: Rocifi
body: Enhance mode is a wonderful way to take advantage of Spotify’s awesome algorithm recommendations. The ability to add or remove recommended songs with the plus and minus button is great, but is unavailable in car (CarPlay) mode. This makes adding a song you like impossible while driving safely. You have to like it, and go back later to hunt it down. Vice versa for songs you don’t like. You can’t safely remove them while driving. Adding the plus and minus to CarPlay car mode would be wonderful!

title: [All Platforms][Music] HiFi Quality - Lossless Streaming 16bit 44.1khz
author: timiambeing
body: I've just started a trial of Qobuz - they offer the standard 320kbps as well as lossless FLAC streaming (and high res downloads if you purchase them) the sound quality is noticeably better and on classical it's just wonderful to get all that resolution through your hi-fi or headphones! The catalogue has a way to go to get to Spotify's level, but they are getting there. The iPad app isn't' too bad (the desktop app is in need of an upgrade but I hear they are putting all their efforts into mobile apps right now). So - lossless streaming - if Qobuz can do it then so can Spotify, they must have the same source - and obviously if you are asking £20 a month then those record labels and distributors take enough notice to make the high res tracks available for streaming. What this all means is soon, very soon, we will get lossless streaming and closely followed by high res downloads - but if Spotify aren't careful it will be Apple who get there first with an audiophile premium offering, and when they do it will be a much harder market place to make money in! ** please don't lump this suggestion with the main one on lossless downloads, that's a different idea entirely guys!

title: [Social] Rooms/Shared Listening Concept
author: marcdreizehn
body: Hello there! I know this idea has been brought up before, but all those ideas were several years ago by now, and I couldn't find a recent discussion about this. Imagine having "rooms" within Spotify, where you can listen together, simultaneously, to the same track with everybody else in the room, no matter where in the world they are, and no matter what device they're using. You can step up and join the DJ queue, and all DJs in the room play one track, one after another. The friend feed on the right side turns into a chatbox, and you can communicate and talk about music while listening to the same tracks. Think tuntable.fm, plug.dj, jqbx.fm, ... but right inside Spotify! Check out this Medium article by Austin Condiff I found today, detailing this concept (following mockup taken from that article). I've been hoping to have some social aspect like this within Spotify, and I think this would enrich the community even further. You could create rooms based on genres or moods, and enjoy music together with friends and strangers alike. An upvote/downvote function would keep rooms democratic and true to their respective themes. The mentioned article perfectly explains the concept and benefits of this feature, please check it out! Thoughts? Thanks and have a great day!

title: [All Platforms][Social] Spotify Badges & Achievements
body: I think it would be cool if Spotify had “Badges” you could earn. Badges could be shareable to Social Medias and what not like, “Jordon earned the Platinum award for listening to every Logic song on Spotify.” Or “Jordon earned the longevity award for listening to Spotify for 40 hours straight! Wow!” Stuff like that. Badges could be displayed on your profile when people view it. This could make Spotify more like a Social Media.

title: [Your Library] Double tap to like songs
author: MatthewKistler
body: You should be able to double tap to like a song. Because people are used to it (it’s on every other app) it would be widely accepted. And the plus has not been very good in my experience.

title: [Community][Other] Add "remove video podcast content" option to Spotify Family
author: lentil_maps
body: Please add an option to "remove video content" to Spotify Family! Since video podcasts were added, my children now watch videos on Spotify instead of listening to music. I had given them unlimited access to Spotify (unlike other apps) because it was only used for music. All you'd have to do is add another toggle for "remove video podcast content" next to "Remove explicit content". Spotify Kids is not an option for us. My children are teens and tweens. And because they're teens and tweens, they have a very difficult time turning off compelling video content (just like some adults). If Spotify becomes just another screen to stare at, I'm not sure we want to keep our Family membership.

title: [Other] Location-based music suggestions
author: GoodIdeasMan
body: Dear Spotify Feedback Team,I am writing to share an exciting idea for a new feature that could revolutionize the way users experience music on your platform. The idea is to introduce location-based music suggestions, which would allow users to enjoy customized music experiences that reflect their current location and environment.The location-based music suggestions feature would use geolocation data to detect the user's location and suggest playlists or tracks that are tailored to the environment. For example, if the user is at the beach, Spotify could suggest playlists with beach-themed music, while if the user is in a forest, Spotify could suggest playlists with more relaxing or natural sounds. The music would change dynamically based on the user's location, seamlessly transitioning from one playlist to another as the user moves from one environment to another.The feature could also include curated musical regions, which would showcase the unique musical cultures of different regions and locations. These curated playlists could be created in collaboration with local artists, music historians, or tourism boards, and would allow users to discover new music and cultural experiences that are specific to each location.We believe that the location-based music suggestions feature would be a great addition to the Spotify platform, providing users with a personalized and engaging music experience that is tailored to their current location and environment. This feature could be particularly useful for travelers or those exploring new regions, but could also be a great way for anyone to discover new music experiences that are unique to their local area.Thank you for considering this idea. We believe that it has great potential to enhance the user experience on the Spotify platform and we look forward to seeing it come to life.

title: [iOS][Podcasts] add podcasts to kids accoutns
author: maholland33
body: It would be great if you could add kids podcasts to Spotify kids accounts. My kids love "Smash Boom Best," "Brains On," Etc. They listen to them more than music and I would love to be able to add them onto their kids accounts on their own devices.

title: [Podcasts] Bring back new episodes
author: jfow1
body: Removing the ‘New Episodes’ section of podcast and replacing for the ‘what’s new’ section is incredibly untidy and hard to track! bring back the new episodes section please

title: [Desktop][Podcasts] Podcasts and Playlists
author: davez12
body: I have a playlist of 500+ songs that I play on shuffle while at work. It takes a few days to get through the whole playlist and songs don't get repeated during that time. If I to listen to a podcast after work, when I come back the next day I have to start my playlist over, which means I'm listening to a bunch of the same songs every day. Please make it so I don't have to restart my playlist even if I listen to a podcast.

title: [Mobile][Developer] Change/ Disable voice personality of AI DJ
author: bishop_moonhead
body: As the title says, it would be a great feature if we could change or disable the voice or personality of the AI DJ.

title: [All Platforms] "Don't Like Button" should be added to all sections
author: zenDroid
body: Hello everyone, I am not sure why it keeps changing between updates, although in the past Daily Mixes have the Like & Dislike button. But this time around it has been completely removed and is only available Under Your Weekly Discovery. It would be nice if the "Don't Like Button" was added everywhere, from Weekly Discovery, Daily Mixes, even when searching specific songs, albums, genres etc. to better filter our music preferences.Also I find on Android on the drop down menu the Don't like button rarely ever works and have to enter the app directly. Like always works perfectly fine. I would appreciate it if this could be considered.Thank you

title: Songs should show the type of genre it is
author: MEXA_14
body: Sometimes you discover a certain song that becomes your top 1 favorite and you want more of that specific style, but you don't even have any idea of what genre could it be. It happens me a lot with EDM music, and Rock music, I love so much certain songs but its hard to find a similar one when I don't know what type of genre it is. For example I found "Don't say goodbye" by Alok and the rhythm is the exact style I love to hear in Electronic music but I have not a single clue of what type o genre could it belong to.

title: [Desktop][Developer] lyric translations
author: jnshn
body: Hello!! I am loving this new lyric feature!! I do however, like many other people, listen to music different than the language I speak. If there was an option in the lyric section to translate the lyrics (even if it's crude and through google translate or something) that would be sooooo helpful. an option to go back and forth between the translated language and original language would be great. It would also be great to have some kind of karaoke function where in instrumentals you can follow along with the lyrics OR have an option where you can lower vocals to do karaoke. I have no idea how hard it would be incorporate these items but just throwing out ideas!

title: [Mobile][Browse] Bring back like indicator on album/playlist
author: jgerminario
body: Spotify just decided to remove the most useful feature of likes—the ability to see which songs you've liked in albums and playlists. I used likes to see which songs I've listened to before, which songs I've liked, which albums I like more than other albums, etc, etc. And now all it does is spit the song into a giant, undifferentiated "likes" playlist. Bring back likes! What purpose does it serve to remove them except make the experience worse for long-time, loyal users?

title: [Android][Partnership] Weather based music
author: AtheshvarraaRaja
body: Listening to music according to the weather.

title: [All Platforms] Light Mode option
author: audiovrd
body: Hi, The new white text on black design physically hurts my eyes and gives very bad ghosting (i.e. persistent image like those in optical illusions that make you stare at particular color combinations and then look away). I know I'm not the only one with this issue because I've researched it in the past. Without an option to switch back to the old design (White background/black text), I'll need to delete my Spotify account and find another service. Please add an option to switch between the two (because I know many prefer black backgrounds). Myself and a host of others, however, cannot use these color combinations. Please let me know if there is a work-around; it would be much appreciated. It's basically unusable to me in it's current state. ~V

title: [Partnership] Add Sign-in with Google for Existing Spotify Users
author: mmichonski
body: Thanks, Spotify, for adding a Sign-in with Google button option. However, only new Spotify users creating a new account can currently use this feature. There is no current way to port over an existing Spotify account with all its great listening history and fine tuned song preferences into a new Spotify account. This leaves existing Spotify users with the only way to use this feature being to create a brand new Spotify account. Could you extend the Sign-in with Google feature to prior existing Spotify accounts, so that every Spotify user who wishes to can use it?

title: [Other] Toggle on/off the dynamic background color of the lyrics feature.
author: joechou188
body: Hi,It’s a bit sad to see the similar ideas have been closed. But it shows that other folks have the same feeling as me. We all enjoyed the lyrics function. However, some of the background colors are too bright to watch.I was hoping that there is a toggle to turn on/off the dynamic color. And, when turning it off, I can choose a color I like as the fixed background color. Thank you!

title: [iOS][Playlists] Shuffle Enhance
author: bc7hr-tk_20yh
body: Hey Spotify. I appreciate that you give us new music and things, but… I reshuffle using my shuffle button. And that becomes difficult when trying to move past the shuffle enhance, which takes way too long to click past several time especially when I’m busy. I also don’t personally enjoy it, so I find it frustrating when it ends up putting songs in my queue even without the enhance button on. I am not saying to remove the enhance ability by any means… but could you allow us to turn it off somewhere? Maybe at the top of a playlist, or in our settings? It would be really helpful.. thank you so much

title: [Desktop][Discover] new release button
author: PurpleFan
body: What i want to suggest here it's pretty simple: I found myself using and spend a lot of time with Spotify app on my desktop pc, in my case it's Mac mini but vailed for regular Windows pc.sometimes it's nice to follow up on new releases before Friday and listen to them. What i want to see here?same button that already appears on the mobile app. (bell button) Platforms:Desktop - Mac and Windows PSB example from my Iphone app

title: [Playlists] Ability to link together Tracks in Playlists
author: bvacaliuc
body: Hi, Wouldn't it be great if you could "pair"/"link"/"lock" or "chain" tracks together in a playlist? Then even if you shuffle-played, certain songs would always play together. mock-up of how linking/pairing a song might work. This idea was actually started by @Sartoris in 2012: https://community.spotify.com/t5/Closed-Ideas/Ability-to-link-together-tracks-in-playlists-also-for-... But in 2015 it was closed as not having enough votes. Coincidentally, about the same time, I signed up for Spotify premium. As I listened to all the songs I've "liked" with shuffle, the one thing that kept coming into my mind was the terrible feeling you get when a song that is meant to follow another is not played. You get the feeling of being violated; it is a terrible experience. As I searched for this feature, I saw that idea was marked inactive and decided to open it again. That idea had gotten 138 likes in 2015 and as of January 2020 has gotten another 116 for a total of 255. There were another 18 ideas then that all linked to the one above (see attached). So I re-submitted this idea in 2015 and since then you wonderful people have given it over 880 votes! Thank you! From the rules, we see that we needed to have over 500 votes to keep the topic alive in monthly discussions (check!). We also see that we need 100 votes per year to keep it alive (check again!). So we're in good shape on that front. Now we have to see what we need to do to get it moving forward from "Not Right Now" to "Under Consideration". Again, from the rules above, Spotify says that they use these criteria:Helping artists.Data and other information we've collected.Information from research testing, focus groups, and surveys.Feedback in the Community and other support channels. (That's us!)Our overall short- and long-term business strategy.Hmm. Ok. So I would say that playing tracks that are meant to be together really helps the artists because their work is rendered in the correct way that they intended. I'm wondering how many artists are dying inside when their specially arranged songs are cut up because someone shuffled their playlist? I can't speak to Spotify's data and research, focus groups and surveys, or about their business strategy. However, it occurs to me that anything that affects the order of which song plays can affect revenue because Spotify pays someone when a song gets played and they don't pay the same amount of $ for every song... Sure its a tiny fraction of a cent, but it adds up. So my first guess is that Spotify's hesitation to implement this idea is economic. I think we should continue the discussion along these lines to see if we could come up with some kind of consensus on this notion. Letting a song "pair" with another in a playlist would be enough to make a lot of people happy. Would we be willing to put some $ behind having this feature? Lets say Spotify charged you $0.01 (a cent) everytime you were shuffle playing and the queue hit a linked song and played the one that came after it. Would you be ok with that? If not, what would make it ok? I think answering the economic question is one thing that is keeping this idea from moving forward. @wsmyth commented in May 2019 that he would be willing to spend $1/month for this feature. I would do that too, would you? From the many, many great comments, @WesleyM77 posted in April 2019 a link to a US Patent. There are two patents, actually, [US8214740B2] and [US9396760B2]. Reading through the two patents, it's clear that they cover this idea in many of its possible methods. So apart from the economic impact, Spotify may be prevented by the patent holder from implementing this feature. It has been noted that only one service has this feature, and now this explains it. The patents expire in 2030. So, here we are. We want a feature, someone has successfully patented the feature and so we can't have nice things. Everyone including the patent holders want to make money, so is there a price that Spotify could negotiate with the patent holder and then pass on to the users that would be acceptable to all parties? Spotify, would you look into this and get back to us? Thanks very much! -bogdan linkingSongs.pdf

title: [All Platforms][Podcasts] Option to disable or hide podcasts entirely
author: m447
body: I don't listen to podcasts and don't intend to. But it currently takes up valuable space in both the Spotify mobile app and also in Android Auto. It's annoying having to see podcasts all the time when I don't care for them and don't want to see them. Is it not reasonable to just have a toggle to show podcasts or not?

title: [Mobile] See all Songs on Artist Page
author: TLuck
body: Dear spotify, First of all, thanks for your awesome service! I really enjoy my premium account on my desktop and iPhone version and use it at home and wherever I go. However there's something that bothers me often while searching for a song, especially on the iPhone version. I often search for a song of a specific artist. So I use the search function and reach the artist's page. Once there, the app only shows the 5 most popular songs of the artist. But often the song I'm looking for is not listed there (maybe nr 6 on the list or lower). Now I have the option of searching through the albums, which can be quite time consuming, or try to use the search function again and hope to find it with a more specific combination of words (provided that I know anything more than the artist's name). Now every time I get to this I'm thinking why can't I tap a button ('see all songs') which allows me to see all the artist's songs in a list? That is something I'm looking for intuitively. On the desktop version, the list of 5 can be extended to 10 most popular, but also here I'm thinking: why only 10?! Actually, the list I'm looking for can be brought up by the app already by playing the first song (while not in shuffle mode) and tapping the playlist icon. This brings up the kind of list I would like to see: all the artists songs I can just browse through. Only now I'm playing the first song, which I didn't want to hear at all. Preferably, I would want to be albe to sort the list in order of popularity or alphabet. Cheers!

title: [All Platforms][Playlists] View all playlist followers/who likes my playlists
author: Peter__
body: I would really like the ability to view all of my playlist followers and I am sure I am not the only one. What I am suggesting is a simple system, where you could press on the "# Followers" section of the playlist Window: I would suggest it would either give you a drop down of all the followers or even better (in my opinion), a redirect to another page with all the followers on it similar to the Following/Followers tab in the Follow page of the client. Please add your kudos and any comments here! Peter

title: [Playlists] Smart Playlists (Nested)
author: SuperSpasm
body: A smart playlist consists of other playlists, as one big joined playlist - it can be played in sequence or shuffled. I believe this could be a game changer for the Spotify (playlist) eco-system. ImplementationIn playlist creation, allow the user to add "sub" playlistsAlso let them add other smart playlistsPlaylists can be shared/reused in multiple smart playlistsRegular songs can still be added alongside playlists. NOTE: This is not accomplished by playlist folders! See below. Benefits over playlist foldersPlaylist Reuse: Any number of smart playlists can share a playlist! whereas only one folder can contain a the same playlist.This will allow having smaller, "atomic" playlists as building blocks of larger ones.Example: Below "Oldies" is shared / reused by different smart playlists:Easy morning [smart] = (Oldies -> Chill) Nostalgia [smart] = (Oldies -> 90's -> Specific songs)Sharing (A) - This could encourage playlist creators to make more nuanced playlists, as they will have a tool to compose more of them out of parts, instead of investing in a single large one, or copy-pasting like crazy.Sharing (B) - This could also open up an entire new content eco-system for compiling other creator's playlists, and re-sharing them as a new whole.Easy "temp" playlists - Currently, to combinine playlists for a party, drive, etc- you must break your organizational hierarchy to create a folder.This causes a mess to be cleaned later.Having a single "temp" smart playlist would allow you to change it's contents on the fly, without messing up your playlist organization.I have more ideas, but I'll add them as a reply so this is more readable 🙂 I realize this is not a small feature - but for a few years I've felt It's absence, and I really believe this could be a game changer - if done properly. Happy to hear any thoughts! 🙂

title: [Your Library] Order/sort albums by release date/year
author: Suikkari
body: Now that the original release year should be available please add an option to the new album view to use it for sorting. there could be options for at least: "SORTED BY ARTIST / YEAR" "SORTED BY ARTIST / TITLE" "SORTED BY YEAR" There could be some kind of subtle separator where the artist changes when listing the album covers. Also the release year should be shown in the album images.

title: Comments in songs, albums and podcasts
author: juanvelezz
body: Hello Spotify! My name is Juan Vélez and I would like to suggest the idea of adding a comment section on songs, albums and podcasts. The spotify community should be able to share their opinion and thoughts on all type of reproductions on the app. That way songwriters and artists can be in touch with what their audience wants and likes, improving the streaming experience. The comment section should have a censor for negative or bad comments. This idea can bring listeners together and creates a space for everyone to share how they feel about the music they love.

title: [Mobile] Please bring back the old group session. "Play from same device"
author: tgerhardt1
body: The old group session, "play from same device option" has been removed and it has saddened many people. It seems the only group session option is now remote group sessions, where the music is played on each individual device. This group session, "play from same device" feature was personally one of my favorite features of Spotify. When it was first introduced, I quite literally showed all of my friends to use it. I understand it was in beta, but this feature was used by many people, quite literally all the time. We know this feature did not work perfectly, but we would use it regardless of the tiny flaws, it was honestly my favorite thing about Spotify. Whenever I, or any group, would have friends over, I would always offer to start a group session so that everyone could contribute to the music being played. Having this option, friends could seamlessly contribute to the music being played so that one person would not selfishly play music the entire time. It was so fun having everyone able to contribute, without having to hand over the one single phone to everyone that was connected to the device, just to add a few songs to the queue. Having someone scan a code and then instantly able to add songs to the queue was a perfect idea for hanging out with friends, in person. It appears with the new update, there is only an option for remote group sessions where the music is played on each individual device, I'm asking to consider bringing back the "play from same device." To recap, this feature allowed people to share music during in-person hang sessions, and from the people I had introduced to it, all found it to be one of the most fun features of Spotify. So, dear Spotify, please bring back this feature! Thanks,Troy and many others!!

title: [Mobile] Navigate to Featured artist’s page
author: elviskurian
body: Easily navigate to a featured artist’s page. Example: Get it together by Drake feat Black Coffee and Jorja Smith. If you go to the album, play the track and click on either the artist’s name or ‘3 dots’ > ‘View Artist’, the app will only take you to Drake’s page. The app should provide the option to select one of the 3 artists featured instead. I understand that this feature exists if you navigate from an album or playlist but it doesn’t appear when you’re playing the track itself.

title: Spotify & "Song Radio" is Essentially Just an Echo Chamber & Doesn't Breed Discovery
author: cawul
body: This hasn't always been the case, and I don't know if this has to do with the amount of time I've had my Spotify account or if something about the algorithm has drastically changed - but whenever I start a radio based off a song or artist (which is with the intention to find a NEW artist or NEW music that is related to the song/artist I'm starting the radio off of) it just creates essentially a playlist of music I've been listening to - and not even within the same genre off the song. I've realized that I haven't found any new artists or any new music, and just continuously listen to the same things over and over again which is quite depressing. The point of the song radio or at least how I use it is to discover new artists that are in the same realm of the artist I'm listening to, and I think you all at Spotify are putting everyone - artist AND listener - at a huge detrimental disadvantage by having it go that way because then there is no discovery for new artists and there is no way for listeners to get into new music without scouring the platform instead of giving good recommendations based off your algorithm. More than anything I want to be able to discover new artists based off song radio, not just hear the same songs I've been listening to. If I wanted to listen to those songs, I would just continue to listen to them. Especially since maybe when I start a song radio off something that is midwest-emo/indie, it'll still play hyperpop/rap in the same playlist which are two completely different genre's and moods.

title: [Music] Tag Music
author: user-removed
body: It'd be awesome to be able to add my own tags to all of my songs in playlists, so I can easily and specifically sort my songs how I like. Should be a pretty simple tool to implement. Thanks

title: [Playlists] Option to skip songs added by user in shared playlist.
author: dingodance
body: I am in a large shared playlist with my lifelong friends. And in this playlist is a certain friend with questionable taste in music. Without fail, I end up skipping songs only to see that they were all added by this one friend. Sure, I can hit the skip button, but the 15 seconds before I skip will often totally kill the vibe of the previous songs. It would be great for users of a shared playlist to be able to "skip songs added by this user." Or, at the very least, to be able to select individual songs within the playlist and choose to auto skip them from playing.

title: [Playlists] Shortcut to add a song to the current playlist when using Smart Shuffle
author: Loski1
body: I just tried the Smart Shuffle feature for the first time on one of my playlists and I LOVE IT! The recommended songs were perfect, I pretty much ended up adding all of them into the playlist. But this would be WAY better if instead of the heart icon to like the song, you guys created a new icon to replace it specifically for Smart Shuffle only where if a recommended song comes up and the person likes it, they can click to add it directly into the current playlist they’re listening too.

title: Crossfade next song
author: Alvaroxii
body: Hi I want to ask for a feature for the app, when I press "next song button" I want to crossfade the next song. I mean fade out the song that is actually playing and fade in the next song. Exact the same option "crossfade" but every time that I change the song. I hope you can do it. Thanks. Greetings from Argentina.

title: [Mobile][Other] Volume Intervals
author: colecody27
body: Idea This idea would implement functionality to assist with workouts or other tasks that require keeping track of time intervals. This would allow the user to create one or more intervals that alternate the volume between high and low after a specified period of time. Both volumes and durations will be set by the user. This would prevent the user from having to utilize an additional application that uses an obnoxious noise which could break user concentration or interrupt the flow of music, or continuously referencing a clock or timer. This functionality not only assist with the time intervals but would also provide users with an increase in volume when they are in need of "extra motivation" for instance. For example: Take for instance, running intervals on a treadmill. This user wants to run for 1 minute and walk for 2 minutes for a total of 30 minutes. The user would create an interval with a "high" and "low" volume. Let's say low is set to 25%, high is set to 50%. The user would then input the duration for both volumes which in this case will be: low set to 2 minutes, high set to 1 minutes. Once the user begins their music, this interval will begin, alternating between the two defined volumes notifying the user when to walk and run until the end of the 30 minutes.

title: Exclude Audiobooks from Spotify Wrapped Album Charts
author: kikibeh
body: Currently in every years Spotify Wrapped audiobooks the user listens to throughout the year are included into the album/artist charts which sum up who you listened most to and which album. However, this always messes up my stats because often times one audiobook will pop up, In my opinion, audiobooks should not be included there, becuase this is not music. Clearly if you will listen to a whole audiobooks its time consuming and therefore most definitley exceed your real music stats. This is sad and always cracks me up at the end of the year because I will never truly know which artist/album truly would have taken the audiobooks place...I, therefore, suggets to either exclude audiobooks (through their category) fully from spotify wrapped or do an additional wrapped page only for audiobooks like the podcasts one. I hope I am not the only one bothered about this, and maybe spotify will be able to fix this by the end of this year. I would be really happy 🙂

title: [iOS] Allow users to turn off Auto-repeat for car bluetooth
author: derekontherocks
body: Hello! I originally thought this was an issue with Autoplay, but after some testing it appears to be unrelated. When connecting to vehicle bluetooth, Spotify automatically turns on repeat for whatever I'm listening to (album or playlist). This is not how I want Spotify to behave, but there's no setting that allows me to change this behavior; I therefore have to manually turn repeat off, even though I'm not turning repeat on in the first place. In addition, this behavior persists when I disconnect from my car, meaning repeat automatically turning on affects my out-of-car listening experience as well.

title: [Android] Default output device
author: Heuveilander
body: Add an option to the Android app to set an output device (e.g. speaker) to default.

title: [Desktop] Restore Organization options to Sidebar Desktop App
author: Thecak3isalie
body: I strongly remember there being an easy button to reach in the toolbar in order to organize the library list in the sidebar of the desktop app.EX: Alphabetical OrderWhile using a smart phone or tablet this option is and has stayed available.iTunes, iHeart Radio, Pandora, Zune, and Amazon music all have this basic functionality available as it makes it simple and efficient to make your selection while also reading through your listening options to figure out what musical mood your in 🙂 Pretty Please add this functionality !(using the large window option for the library is messy and littered with too many icons, images, it's slow, and visually overwhelming to look at and make a decision)*But if other people prefer that method, I'm happy for them ! Best Wishes- Andrew

title: [Playlists] Play multiple selected Playlists
author: jeanjnx
body: Sometimes I'm getting tired of listening to a specific playlist or style, so I want to listen to a mix of playlists. It would be great to have a function to select multiple playlists to play.

title: [Amazon Echo] Enable saving songs to playlists via Alexa voice commands
author: shakeheartbreak
body: Amazon Alexa is installed in millions upon millions of homes worldwide. And yet, the functionality available for it is sorely lacking compared to its implementation on Google Home and other "smart" speakers. Here's one example. Currently, it doesn't seem possible to save music to playlists via voice commands on Alexa. With Google, you can just say "Add this song to my music" and it'll immediately save it to your linked Spotify account. So can you add a simple voice command to your Alexa skill that will allow this? At the moment, users are having to rely on third party skills instead, such as: Song Keeper - https://www.amazon.co.uk/CAct-Song-Keeper-for-Spotify/dp/B079F69G67 Playlist Helper - https://www.amazon.co.uk/Civica-Playlist-Helper/dp/B08D6PM1YM/ref=sr_1_1?dchild=1&keywords=playlist+...

title: [All Platforms][Other] Spotify Kids Amazon Appstore
author: acone06
body: The amazon fire we have is mainly used by our 6 year old daughter. She's got her own profile here so she's got related app for her she. Since Spotify Kids was just released it would be ideal to make it available in the Amazon AppStore

title: [Playlists] Remove a song from a Blend and prevent similar songs
author: hmthws
body: I had a suggestion for the new Spotify Blends that came out for Spotify. I really like this new feature and I think Spotify has done a really good job with it! However, I listen to a genre that my friends do not like. I noticed that a lot of music of that genre appeared in my Spotify Blends even though I have other music in common with my friends that could appear instead. Right now, the only option is to 'hide the song' but that only works to hide the song from your own device. Can we have a 'remove from playlist' option for songs that we don't like in the Blend? Removing the song should ideally be permanent, and should work on the entire playlist on all devices. Also, once we remove songs from the Blend, then can it prevent similar songs/songs of that genre from appearing again in the Blend? It would be even better if right after we remove a song, it is instantly replaced by a song that is different from it like it is learning from the feedback. Thanks!

title: [Mobile] Add / Delete multiple Songs at once
author: scottsummerfiel
body: I would like to have a checkbox system for adding/deleting multiple songs at once. It is very time consuming to do them individually.

title: [Android]: Bring back "Pin playlists to homescreen"
author: maffia-ric
body: According to a discussion on https://community.spotify.com/t5/Your-Library/Move-playlists-to-Homescreen/td-p/5453989 it is "currently not available". Albums are possible to be pinned to the homescreen, but the support to do the same with playlists is removed recently Through this way I would like to request to add this functionality back to the android app

title: [Android] Option to queue item for download when not on WiFi
author: mikekyle
body: When I'm away from home and a new podcast episode or album comes to my attention. I sometimes click the download button in the phone app. This just reminds me of my policy to not download when not connected to WiFi (and tells me how to change this.) possibly in addition to this, there should be an option to queue the item so that it will be downloaded later. I guess some kind of queue exists - eg. My discover weekly seems to wait until I have WiFi to download. Why not let us use that queue too! I use android but I guess this is likely to be the same with the apple app?

title: [Podcasts] Split out podcasts into separate app
author: pwilczynski
body: There have been many posts about improving the UI for podcasts within the Spotify app. But the more reasonable architectural decision seems to be to use a separate app for podcasts / audiobooks. Trying to cram too much into the spotify music app is confusing; it bloats the experience and distracts the user. As an episodic medium with repeat consumption and curation, podcasts are just very different than traditional music. In particular, once I've decided to listen to a podcast, the likelihood of me wanting to listen to music is extremely low - podcast-specific search, prioritization and discovery is much worse when mixed up with musical content.

title: [iOS] Airplay 2 Support for iOS
author: Chrisbju
body: New idea for earlier closed ideas: Experiencing delay with Spotify when streaming to multiple Airplay 2 devices. Works with Apple Music

title: [Sonos][Partnership] Spotify and Sonos Voice Control (native)
author: jz307
body: Hello,Sonos released their own virtual assistant called Sonos Voice Control. The service is integrated with Apple Music, Amazon Music, and Sonos Radio, but not Spotify. Spotify is my families preferred platform, but I need this integration to work for some specific uses in my house. Please work with Sonos to connect Spotify to their assistant.

title: [iOS][Other] Spotify Alarm on iOS
author: HarryBill
body: I see that the new Google Clock app has a Spotify feature (alarm), and I thinks that’s super cool but, I have an iPhone therefore I can't use Google Clock so if you can also try to impliment this feature on IOS devices (IPhone,IPad,etc) than that would be great. Thank You

title: [Connect] [Kids] Add Spotify Connect support for Spotify Kids
author: fergusyarrow
body: When playing music through Spotify Kids, it is not possible to cast the music to a Google Chromecast audio device. This has lead to many conversations revolving around “but why can’t I put my dance party on the stereo”, and so we have to go back to the main Spotify app to get said dance party going and avert the tears 😀And with the kids stuck at home on account of school closures and lockdowns, there are a lot of dance parties happening. And they much prefer the app geared towards them than the regular app. Because the Spotify Connect feature is already implemented in the main Spotify app, it should be implemented also in the Spotify Kids app to have the same connectivity options.

title: [Mobile][Other] Collaboration Notifications
author: LasAnya
body: So, I’m Anya and I have a great idea for Spotify. This would be for phones. Made in 2023 with an example from 2020.So, imagine you’re following two artists, say, Lady Gaga and Ariana Grande. They release a new album, song, or single together, say, Rain on Me. What if you got a push notification when they released that?“Two artists you follow, Lady Gaga and Ariana Grande, have released a new single together titled “Rain on Me (with Ariana Grande).” Tap to listen.”When you tap on the notification, it will send you to the new album/song/single.It could also be adapted to a link in an email if you would prefer it.thank you, and I hope this idea becomes implemented as I would love it! 😊

title: Enhanced songs list
author: Jason_Stephenson
body: Make a playlist for the "Enhanced Songs" so I can listen to just those songs (and uncheck the ones I don't like). This would make my listening experience way more productive than listening to my entire Liked Songs list which has 500+ songs.

title: [Desktop][Developer] add a like (heart) button to Macbook touch bar
author: milkshake_monster
body: i like how the touchbar includes scrub, play/pause, and forward/back, but it would be literally perfect if there was a like (heart) button. it would be so much more efficient to tap the touchbar instead of switching back to the spotify window on my MacBook when I hear a good song and it would really complete the spotify/mac integration

title: [All Platforms] Option to have a true shuffle.
author: jonathanleyerle
body: So I’ve been noticing more and more recently that Spotify’s default shuffle feature doesn’t fully shuffle your songs. It does some sort of grouping to try to get similar songs together based off of what I’m sure is dozens of factors. Every time I shuffle a playlist (the one I noticed this with the most is ~100 songs and 6 hours of mostly full albums) it will group the songs mostly or completely together by album/artist, and given the number of times I’ve re-shuffled and checked the order there’s no way it’s just a coincidence. They also generally seem to be in the same order as well. If I hit shuffle play on a playlist it’ll generally put the same artists at the beginning every time. With larger playlists of albums I am really not a fan of this shuffling method. If I have 6 hours of music on a playlist I will hardly ever have 6 hours to actually listen through the whole thing, but when I do listen to it I would like to hear all of the music on it equally, and not just the artist or two your algorithm likes to shuffle to first. Anyways, I’m a reasonable man, all I’m asking for is an option to have a true shuffle (take all songs in the list, put them in a random order, and once they’re all played reshuffle them and play them again). Make it premium only if you want. I don’t think you should scrap the current shuffle algorithm because it sucks. Looking at some of the suggestions on here it seems like some people lobbied hard to have it that way. Just add an option for a true shuffle for those of us that don’t care about potentially getting the same song twice in a row.

title: [Mobile] View & Shuffle all Tracks in Playlist Folders
author: volcanicglass
body: The latest spotify for android update, as well as the newest iOS update, removed the "shuffle all" option for multiple playlists within a folder. I used this feature every day and it's my favorite spotify feature. Please bring it back!

title: [Android] Lyrics at the front screen in Samsung flip phones
author: Mirimirimurmur
body: When you play a song you can see the lyrics at the little screen in samsung flip and while your busy you can look at it instead of opening your phone in the middle of doing something with dirty hands or when your hands are full I thought about this idea when I finished showering and put on my clothes but then I forgot the lyrics to a really great song but my hand were full so I wanted a way to keep my phone closed but still see the lyrics. And in the future maybe even make it a mini karaoke.

title: [Desktop][Other] Picture-in-Picture for lyrics
author: uolcher
body: Hi. Finally the lyrics arrived on Spotify. I’m really happy about this and now I think Spotify is really at the top of every music platform. But I wanted to propose something about the desktop app (PC & MAC) that miss. It would be great to put the possibility of having the lyrics in Picture-In-Picture, function already present on Musixmatch, platform with which you have the collaboration on the lyrics. I hope that the ideas will be taken into consideration

title: [Your Music] Organize "YOUR MUSIC" by GENRE
author: shadoguardian
body: I like the new update where you can save music into the "YOUR MUSIC" group where it sorts music by song, album, and artist. There should also be another filter. GENRE. I listen to all different genres but there are times when I want to listen to only one type of music.

title: [All Platforms][Your Library] Change Folder Image
author: chalandra
body: Hello, I recently found out about folders again on Spotify! It's such a great feature to organize my 50+ playlists that have either been made myself, made by others, or made by Spotify. Another great feature is changing the playlist picture on desktop! It gives me the creative freedom to spruce up my playlists in the best way; however, it is an eyesore on mobile. I believe that Spotify should implement a feature to let users modify folder pictures on desktop (Hopefully they will implement changing either on mobile...) along with playlist pictures. Yes, this idea has been submitted many times, but I hope that this time it can have enough kudos! Thank you for reading!

title: [Playlists] Public Playlist Folders
author: liayzabel
body: Hi! I've seen this idea being thrown around before but often closed/inactive, so I thought I'd give it another go. (see here) The folders feature has been around for quite some time now, and I love the idea of being able to organise my playlists as I do have more than 80 saved (lol). However, having the folders public to followers would:1. improve the look of user profiles' playlist tab De-clutter the playlist tabs by being able to group/organise them2. help followers find playlists better and easierallows users to make more public playlists as it no longer gets lost in the public playlists taballows users to highlight their current/most popular playlists This often gets turned down due to lack of likes/votes, so make sure you show so we can finally grab Spotify team's attention and make folders go public! 🙂 Thanks:D

title: [All Platforms][Social] A 'Spotify soulmate' in Wrapped
author: AlexanderWho
body: Since there is a Spotify Wrap at the end of the year there could also be a feature where you can see the user that was most similar to yourself over the whole course of the year, This could include their listening habits, music taste, favorite genre, favorite song etc... It could be interesting to see who, out of the hundreds of millions of Spotify listeners, is just like you. It could be a novelty that is added to the Spotify Wrap. Afterward, you can add them as a friend and share music in the future.

title: [All Platforms][Playlists] Prevent the enhance function from adding previously removed songs
author: bobotash
body: You can click the minus button (remove from playlist button) on a bunch of songs, yet the next day the enhanced playlist is full of songs you already removed. This is problematic since the enhance function eventually turns into a collection of songs the user has previously removed, which defeats the purpose of finding new songs.

title: [Playlists] See which playlists a song has already been added to
author: xclarra
body: Sometimes I think of or hear a song and I want to add it to a certain playlist but I’m not sure if it’s already in there, or I just want to know what playlists it’s in (e.g. I accidentally added the song to the wrong playlist and want to take it out, but wasn't sure which one I accidentally clicked/pressed on). It would be nice to to have a feature where you can check which playlists of yours a song has been added to. I know that you there’s a notification if it’s a duplicate, but it would be more convenient if the song is in multiple playlists to just see all of them at once rather than getting that notification one by one for all of them, if that make sense. Edit: someone in the comments suggested having checkmarks next to the playlist names in the "Add to playlist" drop-down and that would be perfect!

title: [All platforms][Your Library] "Queue Album" option on songs
author: BluOxygen
body: When right clicking a song on PC or tapping the 3 dots on mobile, add a "Queue Album" button so I don't have to click "View Album" and then "Queue"

title: [Amazon Alexa] Swap Spotify accounts without changing Alexa account
author: rowets
body: I have a Spotify Family account for myself and my wife I have an alexa unit in every room, every unit is using MY amazon account as all the lights and home automation can only be setup on one Amazon account I want to play Spotify in the room i’m in My wife wants to play her music in a different room Both myself and my wife also want to use the home automation whilst playing music, eg, turning on the lights This can be done using Apple music and Amazon music but Spotify require to swap to a different spotify account for the other person To swap to a different spotify account means changing the Alexa profile of the alexa device and then all the home automation no longer works from that device. Please can you allow both myself and my wife to play music in different rooms WITHOUT having to change the Amazon Alexa account It would be great if I could say ‘Alexa, play spotify from Trevors account’ and my wife could say in a different room, at the same time, ‘Alexa, play spotify from Jackie’s account’ This is not a duplicate of other suggestions, I’ve checked and anything close was raised before the ability to swap alexa accounts was implemented. Swapping alexa accounts is only a work around and is not a solution to this problem. Many people want this feature and your chat team said I should raise it here Here is a link to the forum, lots of people are leaving spotify because only spotify do not support this feature, you guys need to catch up https://community.spotify.com/t5/Premium-for-Family/FAMILY-AND-ECHO-ALEXA/m-p/4900618#M26242 From my research it seems there is talk about Spotify only has one concurrent music stream whereas Apple and Amazon music have multiple streams, but please can you improve on this, the thread above was started over 18 months ago, something should be done to improve on this issue Again, please don’t write this off as a duplicate and do nothing/say it relates to a 3rd party, people still want this feature Thanks Trevor Rowe 19/2/2021 Folks, just a quick update on this. Spotify say this The Community team talks with various other Spotify teams several times a month about ideas with over 500 votes (our criteria for being a top idea). It’s from these meetings that we apply one of the following statuses to each idea…. This idea has reached over 500 votes so I asked on chat for timescales/what will happen next and was told to keep an eye on this thread. That really sounded open ended! As the person on chat could only deal with app and account queries, I was told to also contact the support team to get action on this So as well as voting for this issue (please continue), Spotify need to keep up with Apple and Amazon and fix this issue - with your help we might just get this solved!

title: [Your Library] Sort local files by date added
author: karenremom
body: Would love to be able to sort my local files by recently added on my macbook.

title: [Mobile] Fans also like (expand on Mobile)
author: lightsgoblack
body: Hello, I would like to request the RETURN of a feature that used to exist. In the mobile version of Spotify, please add back the ability to 'Show/Expand All' in the 'Fans also like' section. It was very useful for music discovery purposes, but for some reason the new version of the app only allows/requires you to scroll horizontally, preventing the ability to easily screenshot a much larger selection of similar artists. Thanks in advance.

title: [Mobile] Custom background
author: THEZERT
body: It would be great if we can custom our background when we share a song through IG stories. Not only use color in given pallet but we can use our picture from our phone.

title: Apple CarPlay Main/Home
author: msamuel4
body: The main screen of Spotify in Apple CarPlay displays/suggests a lot of podcasts/songs/artists that people may not be interested in. The main screen would be better served showing Recently Played, user created playlists, Spotify created playlists specifically for the user, artists similar to artists recently listened to, etc. The current setup of the main screen is unsafe. Because the media displayed is of no interest, I pick up my phone to navigate what I want to listen to. This contradicts the purpose of Apple CarPlay which is suppose to support the driving experience; not hinder it and make it unsafe.

title: [Mobile] Option to customize Your Daily Drive
author: caffdawg
body: Just got a playlist called "Your Daily Drive". So far, it's great because it mixes in news-like podcast snippets inbetween suggested songs. However, it'd be great to mark a podcast as 'do not play again' or 'dislike' so it doesn't show up or similar podcasts don't appear. It would also like to love/like songs that appear, as well as the ability to complete skip a podcast if its something I'm less interested in. Podcast runs similar to normal podcast, but I feel that this is a different experience (and a catered one), we should have more freedom to skip/like/love/dislike to make this experience improve over time. Thank you!

title: [All Platforms][Your Library] Delete Songs from Account History
author: juniper7997
body: There should be a way for me to control my history of songs played. Sometimes I accidentally play things I don't want to hear or I try listening to songs I don't like. I should be able to remove them from my history so that my stats are accurate for song and music suggestions. Also....My account was hacked and someone played music I would never listen to. I can't delete those songs from my history. I can only remove them from my recently played section. I DON'T LIKE THAT! I tried to ask a customer service agent to delete the songs, but they said it couldn't be done. Wow! Move to the 21st century, Spotify, and give your customers some more control. Sheesh!

title: [Desktop][Social] Enable Group Session on Desktop
author: brooks29
body: Group Session was recently added to Spotify and it seems like a wonderful feature so far.
