Unfortunately, it is only available on mobile and tablet so those of us who primarily use the desktop app cannot use it. Please include desktop users in the party! I greatly prefer the experience and UI on the desktop app and I believe it is better suited for adding songs to a queue (as you do in group session).

title: [Your Music] Creating "Collections" of Albums
author: Walrusman
body: I have an idea that could make using Spotify better for people who put a lot of effort into managing their music libraries (and for everyone else as well). Collections menu in Your Library The idea is simple: Being able to create collections or lists of whole albums. Of course you could just add albums to regular playlists but then it just adds the songs separately, which is messy, so you can't easily see which or how many albums are there in the list or checking if there are missing songs. You can add and remove whole albums to collections, much like songs to playlists By having album collections we could easily see which albums are added to them and it would make it quicker to select certain albums for downloading by toggling the download button of a collection containing them. We could also re-order the list of albums quicker than re-ordering a simple playlist of consecutive albums broken down to songs. This would also make it possible to listen to certain albums in a specific or even random order without having to add every album to the queue one by one. You can download/un-download every album in the collection with one tap, you can also either play the albums in order or shuffle them, or even shuffle all songs within the albumsAdding or removing albums from collections

title: [iOS] Siri Shortcuts Support
author: brutedawg
body: PREFACE: With the release of iOS 12, iPhone users can now utilize Shortcuts to make the most of their daily routines by automating tasks and steps in both native and third party apps. Currently, the extent to which Spotify can be utilized via Shortcuts is to simply Open App. IDEA: I wish to see more options and a wider scope of utility of Spotify in Shortcuts to the capacity of playing specific playlists when I leave my home, and adding the current song to a new custom playlist that I can name, or even copying a song link to a tweet. I know the Shortcut app would be capable of handling a workflow along those lines but it seems it would require a bit more generosity from the Spotify app. MODERATORS: Please note that this is NOT the same idea requested here considering that post is requesting for "Siri Integration" not "Shortcut Support". In addition, this idea is no longer an announcement as prefaced here and is now a public feature in iOS 12 as of Monday (9/17).

title: [All Platforms][Other] 2-Factor Authentication
author: ThomasVH
body: Spotify should, as a matter of good practice and safety, implement 2-step authentication. Previously, Spotify enabled the option to log out other sessions other than the current session. This would prevent hackers from stealing accounts, which would additionaly lead to less account hacks and less work for Spotify employees to assist in these cases. More info: https://twofactorauth.org

title: [All Platforms][Other] Time to feature Dolby Atmos
author: SteveStevens
body: I can do that very briefly. Don't let Tidal overtake you. Tidal now supports Dolby Atmos. I am a musician and work as a sound engineer. Atmos and similar formats are now gaining more and more interest. That is why Tidal now has a corresponding offer. I can only recommend Spotify to do so, otherwise you will lose users to the competition.

title: [Desktop][Playlists] Add heart icon to recommended song list
author: dqh-au
body: I use the 'Recommended' section under a playlist to find new songs. Sometimes I work through many pages of recommendations. I would like the heart icon to display so I can easily identify which songs I already like, as well as provide a way to manage the 'liked' status without having to actively play the song to access the bottom-left heart icon.

title: [Desktop] Don't go to sleep when playing audio
author: dtki7
body: I don't know about Windows, but on Linux the host will go to sleep while playing music. Most media players do not share this behavior. I suggest to add a call to `gtk_application_inhibit` and `gtk_application_uninhibit` in a "playback status change" callback (e.g. https://github.com/GNOME/rhythmbox/blob/56a31de234440f2813228a5bceac174758a5677e/plugins/power-manag...). Thank you very much.

title: [iOS] Like or dislike a song from the Lock Screen discover weekly playlist
author: Anirog
body: When I'm playing the discover weekly playlist I could quickly like or dislike a song from the lock screen on my iPhone or iPad. This feature has been removed and replaced with a previous song button. Now I have to unlock my phone, open Spotify and select the heart icon to like a song or select the three dots at the top of the now playing screen and select 'Hide song' It was much more convenient to have the like or dislike option on the Lock Screen. Please see screenshots below: Before the update the like / dislike buttons on iPhone Lock Screen👇 After the update, the like / dislike option has been removed from the iPhone lock screen and been replaced with a previous song button 👇

title: Mobile App addition - list of new releases sorted by top artists from a specific Country
author: Kakxime
body: On the Mobile App, you could add a feature to see the most listend artists new releases, and it's filtered based on your country and genre. In my case I would choose Germany and "rap", I would see a list of top artists in Germany with the genre "rap". With the press of a button like the one for settings we could see this list and with in it we could change the search filter for Artists, of course could listen to the songs and sort the list maybe by date of release.

title: [Your Library] Album reminder messages Google Photos style
author: Digimuziek
body: Are you tired of adding an album to your collection, only to forget about it a few weeks later? Just like with photos on you mobile phone. I propose that Spotify adds reminder messages for albums in your collection, just like the ones you receive in Google Photos. These "Play it Again" reminders could maybe come in the form of messages from the artist. it would strengthen the connection between fans and artists on the platform.Imagine receiving a message from your favorite artist, reminding you of an album you added to your collection months ago. This kind of personal connection is what music is all about, and it's what we're trying to bring to Spotify.If you agree that reminder messages for albums would improve the fan-artist connection on Spotify, please give this post a Like. Together, we can create a platform that truly puts fans first and helps us all stay connected to the music we love.

title: [Desktop][Your Library] Bring Back Separate Song Title and Artist
author: Frostman233
body: Not sure who thought it was a great idea to reformat how one can view songs by artist or by title...? It is much more convenient to have the two, side by side, while viewing a library rather than only being able to view the artist name or song name under the other...

title: [All Platforms][Friend Feed] More social networks to find friends
author: firelordraul
body: Friend activity is cool, but Facebook I don't use much and friends either. Adding more social options would be nice.

title: [Playlists] Spotify charts in iraq🇮🇶
author: 7snowingsky
body: Spotify launched in iraq since November 18 (2021) . However Spotify chart not available in iraq yet🇮🇶 As iraq listeners are very huge fan of it's own country music . And As BTS.ARMY who are wanting to support their music we are all so interesting to know about stats and popular of our favorite music that we plays in your app We request Spotify team to make Spotify chart available in iraq🇮🇶 We're waiting for your positive response to our idea thank you❤

title: [Music] Custom Start & Ending Times for a Track
author: krth8
body: Hi. I'm a big electronic music lover and there is only one feature i would like added to spotify. The option to choose a part of the track i would like to play and have the settings saved. In the world of electronic music there is almost allways 2-3 minute build ups, and not many radio mixes of each track. This can be a problem when having a party and a track lasts for 7 minutes with 3 of them is a buildup that not everyone would like to listen to. It would be nice to have a feature like this that i can change on each track, just drag 2 buttons to a start and end point. and maybe have a 3-5 second fade on where i choose to set them. Made a quick illustration on what i mean.

title: [Android][Browse] Make the songs in the "home" page of the Spotify Mobile app have rounded corners
author: SotosTsorb
body: The Spotify app displays the podcasts in the home page of the mobile app with modern rounded corners, while music is presented with corners that have no radius. Just make everything more modern, it's simple.

title: Improve playback scrubbing (like Apple Music)
author: pajubhai
body: Spotify playback scrubbing is challenging to use, especially while running or exercising. It requires precise placement of the finger on the playback position to skip along the track. Apple Music has a much easier and intuitive scrubber that just requires placing you finger anywhere on the track and sliding - it works well when exercising

title: [Desktop] Ability To Remove / Hide Window Controls
author: OhItsTom
body: An option to hide/disable the minimize, maximize and close buttons from the topbar/window frame. Can benefit users that have two monitors and use spotify maximized (fat fingering the edge of the screen and closing spotify).Could be a simple launch flag like --hide-window-controls, or a setting inapp.This would also benefit those who enjoy a 'cleaner' aesthetic, or for those who use spotify on a vertically mounted monitor and want more real estate on their topbar.

title: Please put a "Heart" on homescreen of Spotify on Android Auto
author: Machiel_M
body: It would be a lot safer if one could just (dis)like a song while diving. I'm using Spotify in the car all the time. I also use the LIKE feature a lot - liking new songs an disliking them later.I like the new Coolwalk screen of Android Auto. It's great to see some Spotify album artwork, while navigating. The previous - next - play/pause buttons are easy to use. If there could be a heart somewhere as well, it would be perfect!Thank you in advance for concidering this request/idea.

title: [Desktop][Playlists] Option to cycle playlists when playing folder
author: jwasdfgh77
body: An option to "Change playlist every [ n ] minutes" so I'm alternating through each playlist. I basically do that now manually, click one and play on shuffle for 10 mins or so, then click the next. So being able to play a single playlist at a time with a song or time limit and then with shuffle on/off for the folder that'd pick which playlist it goes to next.

title: Make "Liked Songs" playlist shareable
author: ihsanthaqif22
body: Hi Spotify, is it possible to share our library playlist with others? because it will be a whole lot easier than creating a new playlist each time whenever we want to recommend a bunch of our favourite songs to others? or perhaps making our "liked Songs" playlist public? that will certainly help Thanks!

title: [iOS][Other] Native Apple Watch hand gesture support
author: Stompy
body: Is it possible to hook into the native Apple Watch hand gestures to control playback in the Spotify Apple Watch app by clenching my fist and pinching my fingers together? It works well as an accessibility feature but it's cumbersome to turn on and off. I spent part of my lunch hour today trying to figure out why my phone kept randomly playing music before I realized I was accidentally triggering the hand gestures. If it was a feature that was baked into the Spotify watch app that would be awesome!

title: [Account] Quickly switch between saved Accounts
author: bgeuropefan
body: English: I just ask to be able to use several different accounts from the same device. Spanish: Tan solo pido poder usar varias cuentas diferentes desde un mismo dispositivo.

title: [Desktop][Other] Lyrics icon
author: andersahlblom
body: The icon representing lyrics isnt doing the trick for me. It looks like a mic. Maybe this is just a musician thing - because the mic records everything for us, not only the lyrics. The mic record audiable stuff and the reason I need the lyrics tab is because I can make out the lyrics from the audiable content. Meaning the icon is representing the opposite of what I am looking for. I want a icon that represents text, for example "ABC" or alternatives.

title: [Community] Word by Word Lyrics
author: coasts
body: Hi, I'm sure most of you frequently look at the lyrics of the song that you are listening to for a better experience or to sing along. And for this reason, I believe that Spotify should implement word by word lyrics. Here is an example I have made of what I think Spotify's take on this would look like.Before: After:

title: [Podcasts] Subtitles for Podcasts
author: arebecaIuana
body: Thanks for the "karaoke" feature that allows us to follow the lyrics of the songs. It's great for anyone learning a new language or who needs to find a specific part of a song's lyrics, and especially for deaf people who, different from what is generally expected, also like to enjoy music on Spotify and this feature makes the experience more accessible.However, a similar feature has not yet been implemented in podcasts, which is a shame as there are many creators producing extremely relevant content on the platform, but, for lack of an accessibility feature, this content doesn’t reach as many people as possible and many creators choose to make their content available on platforms that respect the diversity of their audience.By making some updates to the karaoke feature that already exists on the platform we can have a Spotify more accessible to everyone. The ideal is a tool that generates an automatic description of the spoken content, as present in other online platforms, but also allows edits to be made by the content creator itself.And then it should be automatically synchronized with the audio and available in the desktop and mobile version as well.This update will bring more people to Spotify, as many people consume podcast media looking to learn a new language and would like to be able to check words they don't understand well, in addition, browsing the synchronized caption of the content allows you to find which part of a particular episode has the information that the person is looking for.Most importantly, it will highlight the issue of accessibility for people with disabilities and initiate a dialogue with the disabled people community, because deficiencies are part of human diversity and must be respected.

title: [Mobile][Browse] Multiple playback queues
author: jtjr
body: With Spotify’s push into podcasts I am routinely switching between music and podcasts. This means constantly losing my place in a given playlist or having to navigate back to podcast episode I was mid way through. Having the option to have multiple players, with their own queue and controls would eliminate this back and forth problem. Idea: long pressing a song, album or podcast should allow the user to “open in new player+”. This would pause the current player and begin playing the selected media in a seperate player. The user would now see two seperate players at the bottom of the screen. Anything the user queues will be added to the top player (which is the currently playing or last played). User can switch the play order by dragging the player position to the top or close a player by swiping to delete (basic iOS list functionality).

title: [All Platforms][Search] Search Filter for (Spotify Music & My Library)
author: Lovefire
body: INTRO:I truly believe this idea is essential to Spotify Service and User Experinence. As some who frequently will search for a specifc title of a song and find the best song in the search results with that title Spotify lists the top 1000 songs ... and 90% of all met search are clutter with rap garbage. pushing out all the potential great songs I never get to listen to. bc they didn't make it in the top 1000. IDEA:I have designed a, Spotify Search Filter, that will let you set parameter for your search when searching for music, you can also turn on the "playlist" switch and it will only search through your playlists to find a song (helps you see if you already have it and also will show you how many playlists have that song!), there are also other very helpful search parameters. See the attached photos for more details on the idea. Show your support with some likes and because likes are not enough to make an idea happen. Feel free to share this idea on social media, make it go viral if you really love it! the only way to make things happen in this world is pressure.. 😉

title: [All Platforms] In "liked songs of artist" add also liked songs where the artist collaborated
author: It14
body: Hi, I detected that if a song has more than one author, it only appears in the "liked songs of the artist" of the first author. For example, the song "De charco en Charco" has two authors, "Samuraï" and "Belén Aguilera". If I go to the the profile of "Belén Aguilera" (the second author) and I click in my liked songs of that author, the song "De Charco en Charco" does not appear there, As only appears in the first author likes songs. It should appear in the "liked songs by author" of all the authors who colaborate in the song.

title: [Mobile][Other] Remove or manage “Your top podcasts” from mobile home screen
author: nicolesharris
body: On the mobile app Home screen, “Your top podcasts” isn’t reflecting my most frequently used podcasts. It contains podcasts that I haven’t listened to recently, and yet it omits at least one of the podcasts to which I have listened recently. How is Spotify defining “Top” podcasts? Regardless of this definition, I want to manage which podcasts are displayed on my home screen. Several users have provided feedback on this — and in particular, some users have unwittingly shared explicit podcasts with young children or family members. These people cannot dismiss/forget these podcasts from their home screen. Inappropriate and embarrassing. Allow Spotify users to manage which podcasts appear on “Your top podcasts.”

title: [Playlists] resume playlist where you were up to
author: ollynomnom
body: Imagine a playlist of 1000s of songs your friend has shared with you. You want to listen to it in order, you get to about track 67 and go to the gym. You put your gym playlist on shuffle then after are driving home and want to continue listening to your friends playlist where you got up to. At the moment there is no "continue where you preciously were up to option". I think this would be a nice feature so you dont have to take mental note where you were up to in a playlist.

title: [Android][Playlists] Automotive sort option playlist
author: Jan_Westerman
body: In the Spotify app in the Android Automative software (not to be confused with Android auto app, that's different!), there is no way to choose the sort order of music in a playlist. For example, I have a playlist where I add new music every week or day. In my mobile/laptop/tablet Spotify app I can sort the newly added music at the top. In my Volvo XC40 P8 with the Android Automotive software and the included Spotify app there is no option for this. Music in the playlist is always sorted as old -> new. That's not how many users use it and is very annoying.Please add a sort option in the Spotify app for users to choose.Thanks!

title: [Android][Other] Block Song symbol on lockscreen and android auto
author: Timbo6sic6
body: Bring back the block symbol on lockscreen and in android auto. This is the most important function to get a good music list of the week. Instead you have the heart symbol and the shuffle mode... Please change this back, as it was a few weeks ago. I was so happy to block the song just by tapping the screen and block it. Or while driving, just to tap the block, instead of letting someone use my phone, to get rid of the track... Please!

title: [Browse] Users can save a list of live events found on Spotify
author: novasaint
body: Currently, there's a way for users to view live events happening in a particular area. It helps users discover whether their favourite artist is playing in town and easily keep track of the shows. It would be nice to have the ability to bookmark/save events users are interested in. Like the "Your Episodes" tab on the sidebar, they could be shown back to the users in a list form. Thank you for taking the time to build the awesome app, and making music accessible to all!

title: [Following] Shuffle Songs from followed Artists
author: guimenga
body: This feature has already been suggested a few times since 2014 (maybe even before that)! It's a feature on iTunes since when Britney Spears was a hit (the first time)!Winamp did it way before that (remember Winamp!?). It's 2018… Almost 19 and we're still unable to play songs from every artist we follow in shuffle. I don't want to (and can't even) save every song from every artist on a playlist. Who'd do that?! It seems like such a small thing to implement that not doing it seems almost lazy.I KNOW you aren't lazy. Pleaaaaaase don't let me dooooown!Thanks 🙂

title: [Partnership] Spotify for KaiOS
author: Monochromeses
body: With the Nokia 8810 being released in a couple of months, it would be excellent to have spotify running on this device. Furthermore, KaiOS is currently running on roughly 30million devices worldwide and growing.

title: [Playlists] Turn Off/Remove/Opt Out of "Your Episodes"
author: user-removed
body: Currently, downloaded podcasts are automatically added to the "your episodes" playlist (whether you want them there or not). They are not automatically removed when you un-download them. Additionally, is a pain to remove each episode from the playlist, you have to perform at least three steps. This feature, as it currently exists, serves little more purpose than to be a duplicate of the "downloads" tab. In sum, users should be able to choose whether or not they utilize the "your episodes" playlist feature and have greater control over how it functions.

title: [Desktop][Other] Option to maximize album cover in fullscreen
author: DanTheMan6
body: I suspect this was an oversight in the latest update, but the album cover is now tiny in full-screen mode, making room for the background on the artist's profile instead. There seems to be no way to maximize the album cover, which I'd rather be looking at. I'd like that option back!

title: [Other] Lyrics support for Apple TV app
author: themonarc
body: Lyrics have been a great addition to Spotify apps across several of my devices, but on the latest Spotify app for my Apple TV 4K, the feature doesn’t seem to be available. Roku and Xbox already appear to have support, so it would be great to have this feature on Apple’s streaming platform as well.

title: [Desktop][Developer] MacOS Monterey Spatial Audio Support for Spotify
author: user-removed
body: Briefly,Implement Spatial Audio feature on macos platform like iOS. Apple provides a simulated Spatial Audio feature in macOS Monterey for apps that add their plugin. Doing so enables Spotify for Mac listeners to take advantage of new Spatial Audio features on AirPod Pros and other supported headphones and requires little effort from development. You've closed like this idea before. However, we recommend that you read carefully, this is a different platform not iOS, this is MAC OS.

title: [Web Player][Other] Option to disable pop-up for opening song in desktop app
author: Dingus_Hammer
body: I don't have admin privileges over my computer at work, so I can't install the desktop app on there. This leaves the browser client as my only option, but constantly getting the pop-up to open the desktop app each time I click on a song link is getting very annoying. The option to disable the pop-up entirely (either within account settings or on the pop-up itself) would be greatly appreciated.

title: Word-Meaning
author: Ratnanjali123
body: Hey! I am a software engineer, I was wondering how easy it would be if I can search for the meanings of words in the lyrics of songs. Sometimes there are some words that we don't use commonly and they appear by some writers in the songs. right at the time, If I could click on the word and get the meaning of such words would make the music more pleasurable. I hope one who is addictive to songs, listen some particular songs because they like the meaning and they relate to it.

title: [Desktop][Podcasts] Sort by Unplayed/Recently Updated
author: chublord
body: Currently, the only way to listen to unplayed podcasts on desktop is to open a phone and check the feed there, or check every podcast individually for new content. That's 100% unacceptable, and has been for years. Give us a podcast view that we can sort / filter by unplayed episodes or recent uploads. If you want to be the industry leader in streaming, you can't ignore table-stakes functionality because of "100 kudos" horsesh*t.

title: [Your Library] 'Listen later' Button
author: Tags20
body: Occasionally, I hear about a new album that seems interesting, but I'm at work or in a lecture and can't listen to it immediately. Ideally I'd like to be able to hit a button to mark that album and later, when I get the time, I can sit down and listen to all the things I've saved.

title: [iOS][Discover] Restore Touch Preview on iOS App
author: user-removed
body: Touch preview removal on last iOS vers. update looks like it hasn't been a great idea. You are on time to restore it, one of the best Spotify features.

title: [Amazon Echo] Play multiple Speakers at the same Time
author: xoundbox
body: I recently got six(6) of the 2nd gen Amazon Echo Dots and placed them everywhere in my home. And I realized the policy of Spotify that is limiting to only one device to play music at the same time bothers me a lot when I set Spotify as a default music libary. For example, if one of my family members asks one of Echo Dots in his/her room to play music A, then music B on another Echo Dot I'm listening to stops playing. I know there is Spotify Family Plan but my kids can't join that because they are just young and they don't have any email account yet. And also I don't want to create an account for them yet. I believe Spotify could make possible to play the same music over multiple Echo Dots under the same network at the same time somehow even while it's not possible to play music on other multiple devices. Maybe by verifying some factors like if it's for Amazon Echo Dots under the same network under the same account.

title: [Discord] Display Podcasts
author: Scientia669
body: Spotify activity is displayed on Discord. However, when you listen to podcasts instead of music, it doesn't. I think it should.

title: [Podcasts] Import for Podcasts (OPML)
author: caiowilson
body: I'm an avid podcast listener.I currently use PocketCasts and would love to use Spotify for music and podcasts.Spotify could (potentially easily) allow one to import csv opml etc, so everyone could easily transfer all their podcast subscriptions to a superior platform.

title: [Social] Share 'Top artists and songs this month' on public profile.
author: Ivr
body: I appreciate that Spotify cares about my privacy and doesn't divulge my listening behaviour without my consent. But, it would be fun if we could. Of course this information is private, and should be private by default. But I would love it if there was an option that allows me to show my monthly top artists and top tracks on my profile for everyone to see, or for just my friends to see. The current option: Is fairly limited. It only shows the absolute recent artists. It doesn't show the monthly top listening charts, which would be way more fun.I get that for some people this can be sensitive information. Especially podcast content. That's why this option should probably come with a clear warning about what making this information public. But other than that. It seems like a great way to share in music tastes, see what my friends like and start conversations about it. It would make Spotify a more social experience for those who chose to be more open about their music taste.

title: [All Platforms] Announce Song Name and Artist
author: garlicfreeman
body: Sometimes am listening to Spotify and I want to know what I am listening to, but I cannot check what it is. There should be a setting that when you enable it, the computer reads the artist, album, and song name to you.

title: [All Platforms][Other] Customizable sleep timer
author: NazKhan
body: Spotify has the option of putting on a sleep timer while listening to podcasts. I love this feature and use it often. The time increments go from five minutes, 10 minutes, 15 minutes, 30 minutes, 45 minutes to an hour. It would be nice to also have a customizable timer, much like audible does for their audiobooks. The 15 minute increments are a little long and it would be nice to sometimes put on a timer for 25 minutes or 30 minutes, etc. You could also put the option 'until the end of the playlist'.

title: Be quicker to inform of touring artists
author: Lo-flying
body: I love the recommendation email I got that an artist I follow is touring near me. The problem is that the show was already sold out by the time I got the email from Spotify. It would be great if Spotify could be quicker off the mark. Thanks

title: [Playlists] Friends top songs of 2021
author: bangbang8
body: Previous years you were able to share a link to other people with your Spotify Wrapped playlist. This year, when you click on the link it just takes you to your own Top Songs. Please can this feature be added in to allow sharing and the social side to return.

title: [Car Thing][Developer] SDK for Spotify Car Thing
author: manish181992
body: Hi Team, Car thing is very nice piece of hardware, specially the controls. I am sad to see it going away. I want to ask the team to release an SDK for it, so the homebrew developers can keep it alive for longer. Please consider it before killing the device support. Thanks

title: [Podcasts] Search / Filter Podcasts by Language
author: Espro020
body: Would like to see the possibility to filter podcasts on language. This makes it easier to spot (in my case) non-English podcasts.

title: [Language] Belarusian language
author: WolfMeister
body: Dear Spotify, A lot of Belarusian customers would like to use Spotify in Belarusian. Nowadays, the Belarusian language has around 7 million speakers and it's an official language in Belarus and some parts of Poland. Also, Belarusian is recognized as a minority language in Ukraine and Czech Republic.Please, translate your mobile, desktop and web to Belarusian? There are similar requests on Google Play / App Store in the reviews sections. Google Play Reviews Дзякуй! P.S. Previous idea was closed by @Dian without proper review. He mentioned, that the first idea did not meet requirements. But there is a similar idea about Catalan language.

title: [Android][Other] Swipe left to like/unlike songs
author: Luan
body: On iOS, this feature is already available, but on Android, we cannot like or unlike songs just by swiping them to left. This would be similar to the feature that allows us to swipe to queue a song, which is already available both on iOS and Android.

title: [Mobile] Ascending/Descending order options in LIKED SONGS
author: lexypal
body: I wish that the mobile app had the ability to flip the sorting function the same way it can on the desktop version. For example, I can sort my songs by title A-Z and then flip them so they're Z-A. Or I can sort by date added and then see the oldest songs added or the newest songs added at the top. Why can't I do that on the mobile app too?

title: [Queue] Playlist from current Queue
author: cdizz
body: I like the new queue- it would be cool if you could take what's in it and save it as a playlist. I've got a pretty awesome queue lined up and i'd like to capture it!

title: [Mobile][Playlists] Show the search bar on enhanced playlists
author: Jaylenm609
body: When you “enhance” a playlist, you no longer have the search bar to look for a specific song. This can be kinda annoying, especially with a big playlist with a lot of “enhanced” songs thrown in there

title: [Android Auto] Show featured artists on the Now Playing screen in Android Auto
author: GrevenRache
body: When playing songs on Android Auto, only the primary artist is displayed. You have to back out to the album/playlist to see any featured artists, which is especially frustrating when listening to curated playlists that introduce new content (e.g. Discover Weekly and Release Radar). Automotive apps in particular should give as much relevant information as possible with the least possible interaction to reduce distraction while driving. Attached are photos of: the Android app showing all artists; the Android Auto app showing only the primary artist on the Now Playing screen; and the Android Auto app showing all artists on the album screen.

title: [Desktop][Search] Move "search in playlist" to the top when scrolling
author: Lester1980
body: If you have a big playlist and want to search whilst you are in a specific place in a playlist you have to lose your place and scroll all the way to the top to search. Would it be possible for this search box to appear at the top so it's always there?

title: [Profile] Reset Taste Profile / History
author: bartjehoel
body: Please allow for a reset option, so you can start all over again with a clean sheet. For now, you have to start over with an entirely new account to do just that. And for that you need to contact Customer Support. Not very convenient.

title: Public Blend Playlists
author: samreckas
body: I recently made a Blend Playlist with my mate and attempted to share it to my Instagram but unfortunately no one was able to access it. I think the blend playlists are an epic idea - but it would be so amazing to be able to share them on socials.

title: [Your Library] Bring back 'hold to preview song' button
author: rossmillen21
body: A few years ago Spotify had a feature that allowed you to hold down on a song and it would give a 10-15 second sample of the song. I used to discover so many new/different artists as it gave me a chance to preview a song before committing to listening to the full thing. It was later removed (I think in 2016?) and I enquired at the time and they said it was so they could implement another feature in the app using the hold down feature. We're in 2021 now, five years later and no such feature has been introduced. Can we please have the hold to preview feature back? It was such a good niche feature, and it gave a one up on apple music.

title: Bring Back the Offline Devices List page
author: bobby0083
body: Bring back the offline devices list on the account page. it makes it easier to see what d

title: [All Platforms][Discover] Setting to prefer original (explicit) content over clean alternatives
author: muldrr
body: IssueWhile listening to music, especially when listening to through Autoplay after an album, through Discover, Daily Mixes or automatically generated playlists, Spotify often plays the "clean" edits of songs that have their original version tagged as explicit.The option "Allow playback of explicit-rated content" is there for people who don't want explicit content, but the behavior of this option is not ideal for people who have it enabled.If an explicit version of a song exists, I do not want to hear the censored, chopped up version with often mangled lyrics. I want to hear the original song as the artist intended it. In my opinion the clean version is nearly always inferior to the original.Currently it seems like the use-case of people who want to hide explicit music is valued higher than the use-case for people who want to listen to the original. I would argue that we should be treated at least equally. ExampleWhat got me here today was while listening to "Ten thousand hours" by Macklemore & Ryan Lewis, and hearing "Make sure the soundman doesn't block-block the drums" and hearing frequent "Shht"'s really breaks the flow of the track.What especially triggered me, is that it showed that I had "hearted"/liked the song. I did like the original version, and it occurs in multiple playlists of mine. The clean version does not.Note that this is not a complaint about this song in particular, it is just an example that occurred today. Proposed solutionIf the "Allow playback of explicit-rated content" option is ticked, the "clean" content is very likely of no value to the user, and should never be favored over the original version.If you do not want to force this behavior to the entire userbase, or change existing behavior for existing users, then an option could be to add an extra opt-in setting to "Block playback of clean edits when original is available" or something similar. So basically the exact opposite of the currently already implemented "Allow playback of explicit-rated content" is desired: never allow clean edits.Your team might well come up with a different, perhaps better solution, but the end goal would be to never have to listen to a "clean" version again when the original is available. Previous submissions and discussionsMany ideas have been submitted before, they are however all closed, marked as duplicate, marked as "unclear" or found to have not enough votes.This new submission is an attempt to combine all previous efforts and hopefully get some traction.While not all of the options discussed below are exactly the same, they are all about this topic and they all suggest some way of playing the original over the clean edit.If you see all the previous topics in the table below (there are probably others that I might have missed), it is clear that this is a frequently brought up topic in the community.Hopefully listing them here helps people find this feature request. title: [Browse] Allow to change Country Origin Suggestions
author: dmftaras
body: Hi there, I think many users get annoyed by those "local" recommendations that are based on the country that is chosen by their payment method.E.g. I'm living in Europe, where English language is not local language, and I'm getting recommendations for the local songs, which I don't like, and I'd prefer English music over that, is there any chance I could change my country of recommendations to US or Canada? Thanks

title: [Discover] New Releases Section for Followed Artists INSTEAD of Release Radar Playlist
author: d-roam
body: This is a follow-up to this idea: New Releases Section for Followed Artists by @MattSuda. While the original idea currently has over 1,300 votes, Spotify's answer was that the Release Radar playlist meets the need presented. I don't think this is true, and I have doubts that the +1,000 people who voted do, either. So this new idea is an attempt to gauge the level of support for a true New Releases from Followed Artists section in spite of the existence of the new Release Radar playlist. We want a feed that:Shows new releases ONLY from the artists we follow, and shows ALL new releases from the artists we followShows releases neatly in chronological order, with clear headings showing the full release date (day, month, and year)Neatly presents new releases in the form they were released (i.e., EP's and Albums are shown as such rather than as a list of all songs within them -- or make this a toggle option)Goes back in time as far as possible (preferably all time, to show all releases from our Followed Artists in chronological order)Clearly indicates which releases are new to us since our last visitHas a number badge on the button for the section that tells us if there are new releases since our last visit, and how manyNot crucial but nice to have: Can be filtered by time frame, artist, release type (album, EP, single), country, genre, etc.

title: [Desktop][Other] Update the Spotify app icon for macOS Big Sur
author: Lyro1
body: As a lot of new macOS Big Sur users noticed, the general system UI changed, and an important aspect is the various app icons. All the Apple apps icons have been updated to match the new rounded square type icons that seems to be the new trend, and several third-party apps already did it. The amazing Spotify Community already shared multiple ideas of really stunning logos that look pretty sick :- u/CyDave- Anmol Govinda Rao It would be great if Spotify updated its logo to match the general macOS Big Sur design

title: [Your Library] Better way to get rid of songs across playlists and find where are they added.
author: Amayy
body: So, right now if I want to remove a song from a playlist I have to into the playlist and then either search or scroll to delete it from the playlist. If I want to get rid of a song from all my playlists and liked songs. I have to remove it from liked songs and then remove it from every playlist individually. Now in Apple Music, it is good because we have a library option where we can just delete the track from the library and it is removed from every other playlist as well. I hate Apple Music's library management but this one thing is extremely useful.So, I think we could use an option in the context menu which lets us delete a track from everywhere it is added.

title: [Your Library] [Filter] Add an option to sort/view music by BMP
author: h_o_l_o
body: Hello!A useful feature for the people that go out running would be an option to view and sort/search music based on beats per minute (BMP), either in "My Music" or overall in Spotify.I am aware that there are different public Playlists based on bpm, but i'm still feeling a lack of possibility to view/sort music that i personally prefer by bmp.What do you guys think?Thanks!

title: [All Platforms][Your Music] View how many times we streamed a specific Song/Artist/Album
author: WindowsAura
body: I am aware of the existance of applications like Last.fm. However I found it annoying that I couldn't really import old scrobbles of songs pre-last.fm. There are also some sites that let you manually scrobble but heres where the problem lies. We cant really see how many times we've streamed a song. We only know our top songs which go a maximum to a year back. It would be really nice to also be able to see alltime most streamed song. It could be somewhere on the spotify website and log every song even if theres only 1 play from it.

title: [All Platforms] Show release's year instead of remastered version's year
author: vostokvladi
body: When I listen to a song, Spotify shows me the "Remastered Version" year, but this information is not interesting at all.It would be better to place the actual release year of the song.For example, listening the remastered version of "The Wall" from Pink Floyd, it shows 2011 as year, and not 1979.And I would add the release year to every song generally.Do you agree it would be much better, or am I the only one who wants to know the actual release year of a song I am listening to? 🙂Edit 21.02.2020: I added a screenshot with my proposal. The year of the song beside name's group and not in song's title.

title: [Playlists] Expand "Discovered On" User-Generated Playlists on Artist Profiles to Show On Mobile
author: outtallectuals
body: BackgroundEarlier this year with Spotify's UI change, user-generated playlists (UGP) were removed from artist profiles, before subsequently returning on desktop (with some expansion to now show 50 playlists when pressing 'See All'). Despite the initial scare, it was nice to see that Discovered On made *some* come-back, but it needs more. It's currently unfair that Spotify only shows its own playlists on Mobile, completely removing visibility on UGP.In fact, with Spotify's recent streamlining of Web/Mobile/Desktop App UIs to all look and function similarly, this new addition shouldn't be difficult at all. If anything, I imagine Spotify is actively omitting Discovered On from artist profiles on mobile now (You can see this in the A/B difference attached, between the Mobile & Narrow Desktop App window view, which are practically the same, except the omission of Discovered On).I'm requesting for Discovered On to show on Mobile as it does on Desktop, so that:- Listeners can tap into the huge world of user-curated playlists to find similar artists. - Independent curators (labels, bloggers, influencers, etc.) can still have visibility for their playlists, and not drown in an overly monopolized Spotify environment.- Artists can also obviously enjoy getting more discovery and visibility through a largely available yet untapped resource, especially artists who DEPEND on third party curators, i.e. those not picked up by Spotify algorithms and editorials which are arguably most artists on the platform.How To Achieve This:It's very simple. Below the Featuring, Fans Also Like, Appears On & Artist Playlists widget/tabs, just show Discovered On tab as is shown on Desktop. Simple.Thank you!

title: [Mobile] Create & manage Playlist Folders
author: tjb
body: It would be nice to be able to better organize playlists in folders on the mobile apps. Or at the very least, specify which folder a playlist should go in when it is first created. Right now, in iOS, any playlists that I create are just added to the main list, without giving the option to put them in a folder, and it is not possible to move playlists to/from folders. I'm assuming this will be the same on Android when it is implemented.

title: Samsung Soundbars fully support Alexa with Spotify
author: Jabbaxx
body: Hello, I am an otherwise happy owner of an Samsung HW-Q900A soundbar (with Dolby Atmos). There are many owners that are not happy about the missing functionality of playing Spotify with the in the soundbar built-in Alexa. Alexa just says that Spotify is not supported on this device when you ask Alexa to play something on spotify. Amazon Music with Alexa works with a Amazon Music unlimited subscription or Amazon prime. There are really many users that are frustrated about this. Many more are not reporting it as they can see others have failed getting it working. See here for some examples:https://eu.community.samsung.com/t5/audio-video/soundbar-q800t-gt-control-spotify-with-alexa/td-p/19...German: https://eu.community.samsung.com/t5/audio-video/samsung-soundbar-hw-q950t-alexa-spotify-problem/td-p...I would really appreciate if Spotify could get this working.Kind regards Christian

title: [Playlists] Enhanced playlist - sound notification when Enhanced song is played
author: jay_lev
body: When I'm working, I'm obviously not focused on the music I'm listening to. So proposed Enhanced content is kind of a waste.So I'm would suggest that an optional small (!) short (!) sound like a very short beep be played before any Enhanced content. Also, a kind of enrichment "frequency" could be introduced telling one out of many songs would be Enhanced content. Both could be either configuration in the playlist next to the Enhance button, or in the preferences (or both, the preferences setting the default values in the playlists). So, even if focused on my work, I could be "awakened" to suggested content.

title: Canvas for Africa bound listeners (East, West,North, South)
author: KM95
body: Hi. I am located in Kenya and I noticed my app has no canvas enabled and i follow artists who have enabled canvas in their music. I just want everyone who uses spotify in Africa to be able to have the option Canvases enabled. That's all. Thanks 😊

title: [All Platforms] Setting for max Cache Size Allowance
author: Jellybadger
body: The android version of Spotify currently doesn't have a setting for how much disk space the cache is allowed to take up, so it just keeps getting larger and larger until the entire drive is full. A music streaming app should not need several gigabytes of drive space. Give us the option to cap this - getting real tired of getting told I'm out of disk space and having to manually wipe it.

title: [All Platforms][Other] Romanized Lyrics for Songs Not In Latin Alphabet
author: amknana12
body: Recently, Spotify (at least in my iOS app) has added a very helpful feature which is lyrics. It finally collaborated with Musixmatch (thanks God why haven't you done this sooner). Problem is, I am an Indonesian listener who is familiar with Latin alphabet. I loved many Asian songs, which we know, are not written in language using those Latin alphabets, namely K-Pop, J-Pop, or you name it. Those songs' lyrics are still shown in their original alphabet (K-Pop in hangeul, J-Pop in kanji and hiragana, etc). Usually, foreign listeners are able to sing-a-long by looking at the romanization version. Now I know that Musixmatch indeed does not have that romanization lyrics, but Genius does and I know Spotify has partnership too with Genius, I guess? So, why not give a choice for listeners to choose between Genius or Musixmatch? TL;DR:1. We want romanized lyrics to Asian songs or any songs not using Latin alphabet2. Give options for Spotify listeners to choose which version to show3. If Spotify can no longer show Genius' service, push Musixmatch so that they make romanized lyrics available. Sincerely,Global Spotify member. [UPDATE]A comment below notified me that Musixmatch has provided options for translations and indeed they are now shown in Spotity. I see this as a nice improvement! However, what we wanted is a romanized version of the original language so we can do sing-along 😞 Please make this happen!

title: [Community] User status indicator
author: Echo_The_Cute_Wolf
body: for the community can there be an online statistics to see if the people you follow if they are online. like if one of the followers you follow and they follow back it will put a green dot meaning their online and a red dot meaning their offline. "If you think this is post is cool consider liking it and follow me too! Thanks...! i post 1 topic and 3 social and random posts!" Note: I'm not a Spotify employee.

title: [All Platforms] Allow “hide song” function to sync across ALL devices and ALL playlists
author: HumbleRoJo
body: I often use my iPad, via mobile hotspot, as a “remote control” for the Spotify app running on my iPhone (which has the data plan). This allows me to switch tracks, like music, etc. while working on the iPad without having to use my limited mobile hotspot data. However, “hiding” a track from a list (daily mix, radio etc.) does not transfer from the iPad’s playlist to the current playlist running on the iPhone. Therefore, ”hide song” also does not force a skip to the next track. Similarly, hidden tracks on the iPhone are not displayed as such on the iPad. This makes curating lists of music using multiple devices frustrating at best. It’s important to note that “liking” a track does in fact immediately sync to the other devices and therefore hiding a track should also be possible. Thank You. Add on: Also, please fix “hide song” so that it syncs to all playlists throughout my account. If I don’t want to hear a song, I NEVER want to hear it again. This alone makes listening to multiple Daily Mixes unbearably annoying at times.

title: [Smart TV] Screensaver on Smart-TV
author: Myrilla
body: Hi there!It would be nice if there was a screensaver available in your app. This seems to be easy improvement and it's been asked multiple times over the years. It appears that community is ignored by the Spotify team despite all the money you make on your users. It's a problem for me not only because of screen burn out on the TV but also pictures on the screen are unneccessary distraction especially for kids while I just would like to listen to the music.

This is vital for a podcasts success because the comment section is where a podcasts community can connect with each other, which gives the podcast a little bit of flavor If Spotify can add a comment section to its podcasts page, then it will most definitely kill YouTube podcasting and give you guys most of the market share 😉 and i know you guys love market share

title: [Android] Support USB Audio directly - bypassing the Android Driver
author: ZorkII
body: USB DAC/amps are less impressive on Android Spotify because the standard Android driver is up-sampling. The Dragonfly Red runs at 44.1kHz with Spotify on my PC but on Android it up-samples to 96kHz causing glitching. Other DACs have similar issues. The proposal is for Spotify to access USB DACs directly, bypassing the Android driver. Audiophile music players already take this approach, e.g. USB Audio Player PRO (UAPP) and Neutron. Tidal works with UAPP. This idea is a version of "Support USB Audio through the USB Audio Player PRO driver" without the 3rd party partnership. It was written in response to @meahtenoha's review. Both ideas originate from the USB audio out OTG support thread. External USB headphone DAC/amps for Android phones are becoming a thing. What Hi-Fi has a Best DACs page that mainly lists portable audiophile kit. I would prefer to carry a phone and a DAC rather than a phone and a portable music player because it is more fun to have access to the whole Spotify catalogue.

Considering JRE's migration to Spotify next week, it will be crucial to all these users to be able to display the video content of the podcast on PlayStation as well..

title: [Mobile] Include album artwork in queue
author: Nick_Dansie
body: Whenever I open the queue I am always disappointed that it is just a jumble of words. I would like if the artwork was included because you can find songs much faster. All Spotify would have to do is make the selection circle become the artwork for the song. The artwork is included in the queue for desktop, why can't it be on mobile?

title: [Android Automotive][Radio] Offline Mode
author: Steini984
body: Isn't it annoying when you are driving around in your new car, playing music from Spotify and it suddenly just stops? You are might driving over mountain roads with no internet connection and no radio connection and you are forced to listen to the awkward silence, knowing that you will not get internet connection in at least an hour. My question is then why doesn't Spotify in Android Automotive (in cars like Polestar 2) have an offline function, just like on the android and iOS phones? I would suggest an idea of implementing offline mode to be able to download music playlists so you don't need to listen to the awkward silence when you have no internet connection to listen to your music. I hope I'm not the only one thinking about this, and I hope there can be a solution for the problem.

title: Collaborative Album Library
author: Vaoan
body: Hello,me and my friends like to share our music between ourselves so we’ve loved the Collaborative Playlists feature and I think this idea could be expanded upon. I myself am a person that prefers listening to albums rather than particular songs - the album is an artwork, songs are just pieces, parts of the whole creation. It’d be amazing if you could have a Collaborative Playlist but with albums instead of songs - a shared album library if you will. Adding full albums to playlists is not the same as even with the correct order you have to scroll through the songs - how much easier would it be to scroll through albums themselves in the playlist and selecting the one your friend sent you that you feel like right now! Thank you for taking your time and reading through my proposal. Enjoy your day! Antoni

title: [Mobile][Friend Feed] Friends Activity on Mobile

I'm interested in seeing other people's taste and more than likely, loving the song a lot. Also, in the process, seeing if that user is online listening, or how long ago they were listening. I would REALLY like to see that on a, hopefully, close by App Update.

title: [All Platforms][Playlists] bring Canvas to other platforms (Desktop, Tablet, TV, consoles)
author: Beefitty
body: I, for one, actually like the Canvasing ideas on songs. To be honest, I wish there was more as I have my phone on a charging dock on my desk next to my monitor (audio bluetoothed to my stereo) and I can't help but think that the idea of the canvas should be expanded to tablets and the desktop app. I think its a nice surprise, even if its only a few seconds on a loop for the length of the song. I'm sure over time you'll add more to iconic songs of the past as you also keep adding them to newly released tracks.I see there are plenty of other users out there that don't particularly care for the option. That's fine; it's not for everybody. I still think it should be expanded upon. When I'm using airplay at home to listen to music, it always gets my attention when the canvases pop up, but this doesn't happen when I have my iPad on airplay, just iPhone. The canvas seems like a more lively visual compared to just a plain 'Now Playing' screen. Just something to consider. spotifygif.mp4

title: [Friend Feed] dedicate a song to someone

title: [All Platforms][Social] Allow us to change our username (at least once)
author: HeroRobertBrine
body: Ok I hope to God that you guys don’t shoot down my idea this time, I already feel as if I have no voice or say in anything that Spotify does. And speaking of having no voice or say, I’ve been a Spotify user for years now. And my username was always the same as my display name. However, the day I change my display name, my username was changed to a bunch of random letters and numbers, and I have to type in my email instead. I learned quickly that Spotify doesn’t allow users to change their usernames for identification purposes, and I understand that. But I already had a username and they changed it to a bunch of random letters and numbers, so why can’t I change it? This frustrates me so much and if this suggestion gets shot down, like my last one 🙄😑😔, I’m canceling my subscription. Thank you. 😕 (also I chose community for platform bc I can’t figure out which platform label I should label this is).
