title: [Desktop][Other] Full-size album artwork
author: HellishAbyss
body: Musicians put in a lot of effort to their album artwork, so it's a shame that on our desktop devices with nice screens we can't see then in higher resolution than a handful of hundred pixels square. See attachement for a proposed screen – click on a piece of album art while in album view (currently this does nothing) and see it expanded to the size of the spotify window.

title: [Playlists][All Platforms] Quick Add/Remove for Enhanced Songs in Now Playing Bar.
author: coendvrs
body: Adding or removing enhanced songs can be a small hassle, either you scroll to the currently playing song to press the buttons or turn the enhanced feature on and off again after adding the song to the playlist.I propose adding a "+" and "-" button in the 'Now Playing' bar for quick addition or removal of songs added through the enhanced feature. This is similar to the current "+" and "-" buttons in playlists. It would provide a more seamless user experience when interacting with enhanced songs while they are currently playing. It would basically have the same functionality as the current buttons, but available for the current playing song.I have quickly made a concept of how I have this is mind and attached it.

title: [Mobile][Playlists] "+/-" buttons on Enhanced playlist need to be on the Now Playing screen
author: RoonZ
body: In an enhanced playlists, the now playing bar NEEDS the "+/-" feature to add/subtract songs from that position in the enhanced playlist. This would improve the suggestion algorithm and create pockets of inspired micro-radios within a playlist around the suggested song around the song it was similar to. At the moment, if you like a song in the enhanced playlist you are FORCED to scroll through the entire playlist until you find the track just to press the "+/-" button. Pressing the "add to playlist" option adds the song to the last position in the playlist and would ruin the flow of the playlist and the suggestion algorithm. Fix this, you're effectively ruining the usability of the enhanced feature without this.

title: [iOS][Playlists] Sort Playlists by Enhanced Recommendations
author: mjake03
body: I would like to sort playlists by enhanced shuffle song recommendations, such that all recommended songs appear at the top of the list. I'm relatively new to Spotify, and still building out my playlists. I'd like to be able to see all the recommended songs in one place such that I can go through them and determine if I want to add them to the playlist or not. Currently, the recommended songs are scattered throughout the playlist, making it somewhat tedious to hunt them down. Thanks, Mark

title: [All Platforms] Song Recycle Bin - Deleted songs recovery
author: ezegazzola
body: You may accidentally erase a precious song on your playlist. Whilst spotify has an option to recover an accidentally deleted playlist, you can't recover a specific song. Whenever you make this kinds of mistakes unless you know the specific song you erased obviously. Vote if you want a "Deleted songs Recycle Bin" or so, a place where you can search through a history of deleted songs and restore them to where they were before deleting them

title: Remove TVs we are not in range with
author: user-removed
body: You need to add back the option to remove devices that we are not in range with. You have ruined my Sunday morning with your unuser-friendliness. I logged into my Spotify at an Airbnb tv and am no where near the Airbnb so it doesn’t show as a device to remove from my account under my device list. Then when I go to the log out of everywhere option which I had to chat with a representative for an hour for him to provide to me after trying to verify my account with weird questions like send me a screenshot of your Spotify bill. I go to the app section to see that the log out of everywhere option doesn’t pertain to TVs!!!! Then I go to the “Manage apps area” and try to remove the tv from there but suuuuuprise!! ITS NOT ON THERE EITHER! Three avenues I went through three and none of them had the simple ability to remove a tv. Every streaming service has this option! Fix this immediately, it is inconvenient and a hassle for your users.

title: [Desktop][Playlists] Have both "make collaborative" and "invite collaborator" features
author: danicajenner
body: Myself and many other Spotify users were evidently upset last month when Spotify changed their collaborative feature. While some users may prefer the newer option of inviting select people, others of us loved the old feature and are finding this change to negatively impact our Spotify experience. After all - if it's not broken, don't fix it, right?We liked being able to set and forget - allowing whoever may be following or stumbling across our account to add/change our playlists. That's why we had them public! SO instead of removing the feature to collaborate and only allowing us to invite, why not incorporate BOTH features? A "make collaborative" and an "invite collaborators" feature. To satisfy both parties - please bring back the Make Collaborative feature!!!

title: [iOS][Connect] Safety issue: restore last screen when starting up
author: JakeTorim
body: Typical scenario when I get in my car and drive off: T+15 seconds: Pull out of parking space T+20 seconds: Enter traffic T+35 seconds: Spotify app connects to iPhone via CarPlay T+40 seconds: Music starts playing. I want to know what's playing, but I can't tell because Spotify always reverts to the information-free "Good morning" screen that nobody but your own marketing department asked for T+45 seconds: I think to myself, "Self, you really shouldn't grope around trying to get back to the player screen while driving. It's not safe." T+55 seconds: "Aw, I'll bet I can get away it, just this once." T+60 seconds: I grope around trying to hit the amazingly-tiny button at upper right to return to the player screen T+65 seconds: Nope, I'm still not quite able to hit that button. Must be the coffee. T+70 seconds: Somebody honks at me. I ignore them, because I'm now psychologically committed to pressing that darned button. Poke, poke, poke some more T+75 seconds: Ah, there it is. Back to the player screen, with album art, song title, and transport controls finally accessible, JUST THE WAY I LEFT THEM WHEN I PARKED THE CAR Seriously. Please give some thought to human factors and traffic safety when making terrible usability decisions like this one. Restore the user interface to the state it was last in when the driver shut the car off... like an 8-track player from 1975 would do.

title: [Your Library] Adding "Recommended songs" to different playlists
author: Angelina_88
body: I think that Spotify should have an option, that while you're adding songs to a playlist, you are also able to add a song that is recommended to another playlist. When you're making a playlist- Spotify lists a bunch of songs as recommendations for the playlist and you can just click the little + symbol to add it, but there's no way to add one of those recommendations to a different playlist, which would be quite convenient.

title: [Playlists] A blend playlist that lets you invite more than 10 people
author: Gemini_Breaker
body: What if you want the most chaotic music playlist, what if you want the most diverse playlist, and what if you want such a variety that Spotify can't match it's randomness. I just tried to create a blended playlist with everyone I know as a social experiment/ a genuine look at people's music mashing together into something chaotic. My biggest beef is that the blended playlist doesn't give you any indication that 10 people is its max until you invite an 11th person. Listen, I know I am the only one that is overly passionate about this but think of the possibilities! You could group a whole class together on one playlist to branch yourself out of your music slump, or a whole family so that people can see what their family members are listening to. I think that this is a created space that could really be explored more, Thank you and I hope you can kind of see how great this would be.

title: [Control4][Partnership] Control4 Native Integration
author: ShoreSoundCinema
body: I am writing this post to request that Spotify allow native integration from control platforms such as Control4, Savant, Creston and Josh.ai without the needs of our clients to use Spotify Connect. To the best of my knowledge, Sonos is the only 3rd party vendor to have direct access to the API from within their platform. With platforms such as Control4, the end user has too many steps and potential points of failure, prior to achieving a successful Spotify stream. Our clients in the CI (custom integration) market space, are high net worth individuals, that typically own more than one home. Spotify connect is a terrible way to bring your product to our client base. We are a Control4 dealer and we have native integration to Pandora, Sirius/XM, Tidal, Deezer, Qobuz and more. We defer to these streaming services over Spotify for ease of use and the client does not want to go through all of the additional steps and leave the Control4 App to manage their Spotify service. It is about time that Spotify allows direct access to their services direct from the above referenced Control Platforms. Thank you for your time and consideration.

title: [Mobile][Playlists] Show song length in Spotify Kids app
author: LadyJazz
body: Currently, the Spotify Kids app doesn't show the length of songs when viewing song lists for Spotify-curated recommended playlists, and shared playlists from the Family account. Only the name/artist/album art are shown. When listening to a song, there is a progress bar, but it doesn't display how many minutes:seconds the listener is into the song, or how long is left in the song.The main Spotify app (IoS) shows how long you're into the song, and allows you to toggle back and forth between song length and how long is left.For my number-focussed child, and for children that are building their understanding of counting, and developing their sense of time, this is a key feature that is missing from the Spotify Kids app. I'd like to suggest to the developers it be added as a feature. It could be optional based on the kid's profile.

title: [Discover] Find public Playlists that contain Song/Artist
author: ryeguy_24
body: My theory (not rocket science): If someone else's playlist includes a song or artists that I like, there is a good change that I will enjoy the rest of their playlist. Currently, you can only search for public playlists via playlist name. Considering that most people do not name their playlists to accurately reflect the type of music it contains, I believe that the current search functionality is quite limited. Spotify should have functionality to search for public playlists that contain a song/artist. I think would be immensly helpful for music discovery. Best of luck, Ryan P.S. - Down the line, it would be interesting to see "similarity scores" between two playlists. Could be quite interesting for finding new music.

title: [Community][Social] Discord for Spotify Community
author: Timbur2102
body: Many People use Discord everyday, also Many People use Spotify everyday. So Why not creating a community of Spotify on discord? there is already the "Spotify Hangout" Discord server, that fits to the guidelines. So a Partnership with that Discord would create an easy way of having an Discord Server for Spotify.

title: [All Platforms][Playlists] Prevent the enhance function from adding duplicates
author: bobotash
body: The enhance function will add songs already in your playlist. These are not different versions like (acoustic or radio edit). These are also not the same song from 2 different albums. The enhance function will suggest exact copies of a song. This is problematic since 1. users don't want duplicates in their playlists, 2. the feature is intended to find new music.

title: [Mobile][Other] Mute device's songs while playing music
author: abbygrace1115
body: Is there a way to add an optional setting that mutes noise from all other apps? (Barring emergency notifications, of course.) Similar to the CarPlay mode, but if, for example, you’re in charge of the Bluetooth speaker in the car, but still want to play games, and don’t want the inevitable ads to bother the other passengers/driver, you could turn on Public Play and it would only allow emergency notification noises through. It could also work for bedtime/wind down purposes.

title: [All Platforms][Playlists] Move track to top or bottom in playlist with 1 click
author: Thies19
body: My idea is when you right-click on a track in your playlist, there is an option that says "move track to top" or "Move track to bottom" now I have to drag the track to the top myself and with over 1500 tracks in my playlist it takes some time to do, because when you pre-save a track it comes to the top of your playlist and when you add a track by yourself in comes to the bottom. Make a feature that you can move tracks to the top or bottom of your playlist with 1 -click.

title: [Mobile][Your Library] Have a Follow hierarchy based on your top 2-3 favourite artists
author: stevenaedwards1
body: I've just come across a new artist (thanks Spotify). I've clicked Follow so the artist is added to my list of liked artists but then i had a thought, how cool would it be if you could have a hierarchy of artists that you follow. For example, i could have 2-3 absolute favourite artists which should stand out from the list; this should also have an affect on the individual song likes i've done as well as album listings. OK i could also put these absolute fave artists into a playlist but that then becomes static; this would allow future content added by these TOP artists to stand out. Finally and this is more important, you would have another metric to add to your repertoire - labels/artists would see how many users TOP list they make. Comprende? Good idea?

title: [iOS][Discover] Add only liked songs from Discover Weekly
author: rishab2002
body: Could you add a feature to add only the liked songs from Discover Weekly? I use Discover Weekly weekly to find new songs, and I use the minus and like features as intended. But when I add these songs to my playlist, it's a hassle to command shift and individually click each one since likes can't order them. Or I have to go to my liked songs and add them. I think it would be a much smoother way to use Discover weekly and increase its convenience of Discover weekly.

title: [Mobile][Playlists] Dont Play this Artist factors into Suggestions
author: Kmg8043
body: I spend 98% of my time these days blocking artists I have no interest in. Literally 98% of what you suggest in Release Radar or Discovery Weekly or Daily Mix. This is not what an end user should have to experience in such a high percentage. The formula should be improved so that artists that are "similar" to the ones I am blocking, also do not get suggested. In example, if I am blocking 100% of foreign artists or a certain genre....the formula should be smart enough to pick up on that. After all, it is data, and should be easily mineable. You probably walk past someone every day that has the basic skillset to analyze data sets. SPOTIFY EMPLOYEE....DO NOT TELL ME this idea is already out there. Last time you linked this to an idea where someone suggested adding a new button like Not Interested on Youtube. I AM NOT ASKING for a new button....this already exists....it is a feature you have that hides artists. I am simply asking you to give this merit in your formulas for suggestions on playlists like Discovery Weekly, Daily Mix, Release Radar. IF YOU ALLOW ME TO BLOCK ARTISTS....you should be smart enough to not suggest similar artists. Easy....anyone with basic mining skills can tell you how to do this

title: [Mobile] Option to disable podcast video on wifi
author: Deadpool465
body: Whenever I'm listening to a podcast that supports video and I open the spotify mobile app there's a stutter/freeze in the audio. Depending on what the video quality is set to, the stutter can range from about a second to over 5 seconds. It happens virtually every time I open the app on Wifi and it's very annoying and distracting, especially for a feature I would have disabled even if I didn't have this issue. I have the video set to disabled when using data, but the stutter exists on Wifi. I think that a feature should be added to disable video in podcasts entirely regardless of if the user is using Wifi or Mobile data. The user should have the choice if they wish to see any video on Spotify and not be constrained to only disabling it on mobile data.

title: turn off podcast video even on wifi
author: theolake
body: simple switch in addition to the data saving switch where i can turn off podacst video all together. simple and easy to add. the video seems to create many issues (whihc i imagine would be harder to fix) such as playing on my pc 15 miles away randomly and loosing my place. this only happens when the video is on and is infuriating as it could be fixed so simply.

title: [Your Library] Removing 10 or more songs from Liked should result in a warning prior to removing
author: shejan0
body: I accidently removed every track from my liked songs due to a delayed response of the "Remove songs from liked" pop up menu, and it did not warn me before doing this action, I have lost everything. While Spotify support was able to get most of it back, it is in the wrong order, and this could have been entirely avoided with a pop up warning. Especially when the delete operation was in upwards of 6000+ items.

title: Larger 'Tap Box' for Play button
author: infinitaylien
body: When a song is playing and you're looking at a playlist/album, the 'tap box' for the play/pause button in the bottom right corner should take up the entire right side from the 💚 over, on the current track 'bar'. It's very annoying when you try to tap the play/pause button and the song/album art opens up instead and takes you away from the playlist/album menu, and the music keeps playing. Visually the buttons should remain unchanged, but functionally the tap box should be a square and not just the size of the teeny tiny play/pause icons.

title: [Desktop][Other] Adding hungarian language in Spotify for hungarian natives living in Romania
author: ltamas
body: Romania is a multicultural country with 6.5% of hungarian speaking inhabitants.Actually the spotify can be used on Romanian language.https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hungarians_in_RomaniaPlease, make it possible to use/set the hungarian language in Spotify for hungarian natives living in Roumania.

title: [Android][Other] Stop Spotify to drain battery with metrics
author: Nosnahc
body: A while ago I came across this article.A solution provided by Duckduckgo to limit the leak of personal data via the applications on my phone.So I hasten to install it and notice only one thing... Spotify makes requests in loops, more than 4 per second! So I have two questions and a proposal:Why is Spotify hounding me so much even though I'm premium?How does this affect my battery? If the statement of this information is crucial for the use of the application (I suspect that it is to control who uses my premium account) why not limit these requests to save my battery?

title: [Playlists] Additive & Subtractive Playlists
author: neilforreal
body: Additive & Subtractive Playlists are an idea I had the other day. I was listening to my February playlist and realized that I like the songs I have on there, but if I want to play that playlist at night, there are some songs I'd like to leave out (I love the riff of Nefi + Girly, but it's not something I'd fall asleep to). Hence the idea of additive playlists and subtractive playlists. This will consist of one pair of two playlists. One will have the full array of songs -- the additive -- and one will have that array minus the ones you take out -- the subtractive. On the diagram below, 1 is the additive playlist and 2 is the subtractive (For my example, you could think of 1 as February and 2 as February Night). When I add a playlist to February, it goes into February Night as well. And when I add a song to February Night, it also goes into February (blue arrows). But when I remove a song from February, I don't want it anywhere; it's removed from both. If I remove a song from February Night, it's only removed from the one (red arrows). In execution, I could see the user right-clicking a playlist and selecting create subtractive playlist, producing a pair of playlists, additive and subtractive.

title: [Desktop][Your Library] Shuffle mode defaults
author: tanpis20
body: The shuffle mode should be reset to default for albums all the time, every time you start a new album. If you think it's a real pain for some user, it should at least be a custom option. For playlists, it's okay to retain whatever the previous setting was.

title: [All Platforms][Playlists] Generated playlists that exclude the songs you already have
author: 5emtio4yra
body: I really like the auto generated playlists based on a song or one of your playlists However, when the autogenerated playlist based on my playlist is 80% songs from that playlist i end up having to skip a lot, i would love a feature where it can generate a playlist based on the playlist, but i can choose to exclude songs already in the playlist So if i have yellow by coldplay on the playlist, i would prefer if it doesnt show up on the autogenerated playlist, but i would love similar songs so i can expand what i get to listen to

title: [Your Library] Search within all Playlists
author: onty07
body: Often, I'd like to find a song within one of my saved playlists. I have a few playlists with over a thousand songs and this becomes difficult. If I really want to listen to a certain song, I end up doing a general search, but then I have to go back to my playlist to continue listening there. I'd like to be able to search within a playlist and then continue listening from that playlist.

title: [All Platforms][Discover] Revisit daily mixes
author: Eonian
body: I was in busy making a playlist out of a daily mix that I really liked, but after 5 songs Spotify changed my daily mix, at 5:30 pm. Why would you do that? It's a daily mix that I want tot listen to the whole day, it's not a half daily mix! Please make an option to view former daily mixes so I can complete my playlist. Thanks in advance.

title: [Web Player][Discover] Improved Navigation to Lyrics
author: 21kaxl6eaifz6kyjusaw
body: I love how there are certain songs that have written lyrics! It can open up social listening/impromptu karaoke parties. I've noticed however (maybe this is only true when viewing from a computer in a web browser) that it can be difficult navigating to find said lyrics. Would it be possible to add 'Show Lyrics' as an option in the '...' dropdown menu, similar to the available 'Show Credits' option for those who have lyrics uploaded by creators?

title: [Mobile][Social] Share translated lyrics
author: midnightloona
body: When sharing lyrics to social media, it should be possible to share the translation of the lyrics as well. Say for example, you want to share a k-pop song's lyrics on Instagram, I think the original lyrics emphasized, with the translated lyrics below could work well (similar to how the translation screen displays them currently).

title: [Desktop] Support Notifications on Mac
author: reephamblues
body: I would appreciate it if Spotify on macOS could support desktop notifications (current song etc.) via Apple's Notification Center. This is basic functionality that's provided by almost every other Mac app I can think of. Spotify has offered it in the past, and indeed there's still a zombie preference setting ("Show dekstop notifications when the song changes"). I'm irritated at not having something as simple as notifications, and I feel insulted by a preference setting that doesn't work. I'm proposing this here because it seems to have been last raised as an Idea in 2012 and set to Not Right Now status in 2019. That was a long time ago. This Idea is therefore a follow-up to this more recent discussion on the subject. Mod MafeG invited us to raise the issue on the Idea Exchange, so that's what I've done.

title: [All Platforms][Playlists] Group Blends with more than 10 friends
author: _afonsomatos_
body: Please allow group blends with more than 10 people. Easy. Thank you.

title: [Your Library] Show ALL song downloaded for Offline use
author: Anto_ba
body: As I user, I want to find a playlist where I can see all my downloaded songs. Imagine I downloaded 10 albums and 5 playlists. To hear shuffled all these, I need to add one by one to the play queue. I would add another playlist similar to the one "Songs you like" but with downloaded songs.

title: [Playlists] Provide an option that takes user back to the current playing playlist
author: mogrtboy
body: I play a lot of music from playlists (my own and not), and I find myself having to search for the ones that aren't mine when I click away. Sometimes I want an easy way to just go back to the playlist without having to search for it. If it's a UI / space issue I believe you could create a carousel on the song artwork section to add the playlist or use a small icon near the the play lyrics section that will lead us back to the playlist. Would LOVE if this could be implemented.

title: [iOS][Developer] Separate slideable screens for each of the three media types
author: dhnelson
body: I propose that each media type (Music, Podcast & Shows, Audiobooks) have it's own screen and player bar. You could swipe left/right to get to the different screens. The reason this is needed is because often I listen to music while working, then I'll go have lunch or do an errand and want to listen to a podcast or audiobook. When I want to go back to my music after I've completely lost my place in the playlist or radio I was on. Also, the reverse is annoying. You can get back to the podcast you were listening to, but you have to click through a few screens. It would be amazing if you could just swipe once and you were switched back to the media you want at the place you left it.

title: [Desktop][Browse] Sorting albums tracks by the number of plays (i.e. streams)
author: gtrowen842
body: It would be helpful to sort tracks on an album (not playlist) by the number of plays/streams each track has (i.e. ascending/descending). Gives an idea which songs are the most popular on the album as opposed looking at the artists Top tracks from their entire discography on their main page.

title: [iOS][Other] Faster Queueing Via Firm Hold
author: OwenTheGroovy
body: As seen in the YouTube-based music app Musi (my example, I’m sure that there are others), there’s a feature that allows a firm/ non-moving hold of a finger on the title of any song to give a light click vibration and instantly add the song to the ‘end of the line’ in the user’s current queue. In contrast, the current way of queueing in Spotify requires two clicks and a second-long waiting period after queueing a song before they’re able to continue with their browsing. There is no current use of the ‘hold down action’; if the user holds down on a song it already disrupts their viewing ability, meaning that most should understand/ be comfortable/ used to not doing so. This means that the spot is open, an unused space for a better quality of a listening experience with Spotify. - Listed category is put as other since this could/ should be able to be done to any song, by search OR in a playlist (both)

title: [All Platforms][Your Library] Folders for organizing friends and artists
author: MuddyBee
body: Add an option to create folders for better organization of various artists and/or friends we are following.

title: [Desktop][Other] Add an "Add to Queue" shortcut for desktop
author: AdriftGlitter4
body: In the phone app, you can swipe right on a song to add it to the queue, but on desktop, you need to right-click and move the mouse all the way to the top of the options. If there was a button (perhaps next to the ♥) or motion, you could easily and quickly add a song to the queue.

title: [Mobile][Browse] Easter-Egg Games in Canvas
author: AmaniHiphop
body: Netflix has videogames on their platform. I was thinking, what if we had that on here? But not like a whole menu of videogames to play. That would take the focus away from the music. What I'm suggesting is alongside canvas's, give artists the opportunity to submit simple interactions or games that the listener can participate in in order to connect with the music and art more and enrich their experience. It allows the artist to immerse the listener even further into their song and fully bring out their vision. The games don't have to be like an entire mobile game or even a game at all. It could be a simple slide/button click to unlock/open up a second canvas or something like the Yeezy Gap Game: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-euzeXlHJVM (this is more of what I envision, but even more simpler, like pixelated or just easier to make). What do you guys think? I think this can benefit artist most of all because if a listener was able to physically interact with an song, they would be more likely to take interest in the artist and become a fan possibly and connect more with the artist/song.

title: [Mobile][Other] More Beta and Alpha data.
author: Nomosapien
body: People in the alpha or beta should be able to view what’s different in their own version of the app versus the live version of the app. Somewhere is settings preferably. I feel this is better for both sides. People know what to look for and common places to find bugs on both the side of the developer and the user. Everyone gets more information.

title: [Desktop][Playlists] Create playlist inside folder when folder selected (key shortcut)
author: strok_777
body: Back in 2017 it was possible to create a playlist inside a folder when creating it from the keyboard shortcut. Please, restore that basic feature again, how long users will have to be requesting every small feature that you removed?

title: [Desktop][Mobile][Discover] Radio based on rhythm\beat\instruments of current song
author: johnnyannis
body: Let's say there is a song that I love (say Stairway to Heaven as an example). If I want to start a radio playlist from that song, I get a station based on that song in general. What is however, there is a particular part of that song that I enjoy (let's say The Bridge). There should be a drill down option when creating a radio playlist that allows me to select the particular part of that song that I want to use for the radio suggestions. Some examples could include General (for the whole song), RPM, Key, Guitar, Drums, The Bridge, The Chorus, The Lyrical Content, The Harmony, The Melody, The Time Signature or even the ability to select a section of the song that you want to use for the suggestions. In this day and age of AI, development and innovation, this should be very easy to do. Please consider kudos and voting for this.

title: [Android][Developer] Change the lock screen player for Android 13.
author: emetius
body: The recent update for Android 13 has the play, skip and other buttons right above the play bar on the lock screen. This leads to me accidently clicking a different part of an podcast/song that I am listening to. It is very frustrating, and I am surprised it made it through any testing. Please make the space between the buttons and the play bar further apart.

title: [All Platforms][Friend Feed] Favorite profiles
author: andreaolaus
body: Hi! I have a idea! To favorite profiles, to for example find your bestfriend faster if you follow a lot of people. I think this idea is a good one if you follow a lot of people and you're looking for your bestfriends for example.

title: [Community][Playlists] A Spotify Blend Chat! - comments in blend
author: Green_Bean
body: Having many songs to share is awesome. But how about extending the experience through talking to each other about them? Feels like it would be nice. Or even a wall where you can send small messages!

title: [All Platforms] Music Videos
author: Camilla33
body: Idea: "[All Platforms] Music videos"Artists do record a video to go with their music. I really want to watch them on Spotify. At Apple Music I can choose between listening to the music, or watching their video.

title: [WearOS] Fast Forward / Rewind functions
author: dkleine
body: Dear Spotify-Team, I would like to request a feature for your Spotify App on Wear OS:FF/REW functions: Can you also please add “Fast Forward” ( >> ) and “Rewind” ( << ) functions to your Wear OS app? Right now, unfortunately there is none.I think it would be great if you could implement this function when holding the button for “Back” ( |< ) or “Next” ( >| ) song. This new alternative functionality for the “Back” ( |< ) and “Next” ( >| ) buttons then needs to be indicated in some way, maybe like this:|<<< >|>> Similar ideas have been suggested here, but for different mobile operating systems:Mobile-Fast-Forward-Rewind-Button (this is for mobile apps in general)Garmin-Developer-Support-fast-forward-in-Spotify-Garmin-app (this is specified for Garmin Watch OS)

title: [Your Music] Spotify Wrapped: Releases the Statistics weekly
author: denlm
body: can there please be a wrapped but it counts the statistics weekly instead? that way you can check it whenever you would like, meaning you would know how much music you have listened to so far. even in the corner next to the account name it could just have a button saying "year so far" then you dont have to go to the trouble of going to the website. My spotify: denrulz13

title: [Other] Add a tile/widget for Wear OS
author: dkleine
body: Dear Spotify-Team, I would like to request a feature for your Spotify App on Wear OS: Tile: Currently there is no tile provided by your WearOS app (see here: https://www.samsung.com/us/support/answer/ANS00034473/). This feature is helpful because for me as a user, this tile allows me to switch between apps on my smartwatch more easily. I am using a Samsung Galaxy Watch5 (One UI 4.5, Wear OS 3.5) and with the latest Spotify WearOS App version (8.8.4.518).

title: [iOS][Other] Spotify Interface Enhancement
author: VinayPrathapan
body: On the current Spotify interface (on the iOS), the Now Playing face template allows one to swipe up anywhere on the screen to scroll up to the live lyrics area. While this is nice, the gesture as implemented interferes with the playback position / seek interface for the song currently playing and it results in a jerky experience which is quite annoying. A simple re-designation of the region on the Now Playing screen which blocks out vertical touch responses on the horizontally-advancing playback position / seek interface will result in a significantly enhanced user experience that Spotify ought to exploit.

title: [Mobile][Connect] Option to hide the 'Group Session' feature
author: Silvertone2000
body: I want to disable this 'feature'

title: [Mobile][Browse] Add swiping actions on 'Recently Played' tab
author: Unknow3
body: On the mobile app I find it difficult to add songs to queue from the recently played tab on the mobile app. I think adding the swipe left to add to queue in the recently played tab should be essential as it is pretty much everywhere on the app besides there.

title: [Desktop][Other] Virtual Assistant
author: That_Kael
body: Often when I am listening to Spotify on my computer I have it minimized. I will be writing down some notes for work, then a song I haven't heard before comes on and I want to know its name without losing my flow. Or I will be playing a video game, then I want to swap what playlist I am listening to.The most convenient option, I feel, would be to add a voice-activated virtual assistant. Being sound based would make it on-theme for Spotify and would increase the accessibility for people with impaired vision. This is important as desktop Spotify has a very low contrast GUI, with no high contrast setting options.Other voice-activated virtual assistants (Bixby, Cortana, etc.). Can't be used to control Spotify and, if they can, will have decreased functionality.In conclusion, I believe that having voice-control in Spotify will not only increase usability, it will also increase accessibility for visually impaired.

title: [Mobile][Podcasts] Automatically queue podcasts when released
author: itsnotkevin
body: Have an option to automatically queue hourly news update podcasts so they play automatically when released while listening to music (or other content).

title: [Mobile][Playlists] Hide This Song prevents suggestions from using in future
author: Kmg8043
body: Hide This Song should be included in suggestion formulas. In example for Daily Mix, Release Radar, Discovery Weekly....you should be smart enough to know I like something the Band does if I didn't block the artist, but should also be smart enough to know that I do not want to continue to see this keep popping up on other playlists unblocked, or the same playlists blocked. You waste so much of our valuable time with this child level nonsense This idea is different that any of your other ones, don't try to act like this will be associated to some other post Spotify Employee. My idea is around suggestions, other ideas are around blanket removal of everywhere

title: [Mobile] Top 50 Charts for Kuwait
author: AuctusXV
body: Spotify has been available in Kuwait for more than 4 years. Saudi Arabia, UAE and Egypt have theirs and I'm pretty sure we have enough subscribers for it too!

title: [All Platforms][Discover] Filter suggested artists by monthly listeners amount
author: Kmg8043
body: We should be able to filter out bands with low monthly listeners if we are looking for established bands. This would help improve formulas for Discover Weekly, Daily Mix, and Release Radar. Adding a setting that lets you filter out bands with less than 10,000/50,000/100,000/500,000 listeners per month etc. Most of the bands I'm blocking in these playlists each week, would be covered by the lower ranges I list above

title: [Podcasts] Rate Individual Podcast Episodes
author: reads
body: Allowing followers to rate individual episodes would give podcasters useful insight to determine which episodes their followers most liked (as opposed to just most listened/shared) and it would also help new listeners find which episodes were most liked. There's currently no way to express sentiment for individual episodes but anyone who follows a particular podcast will encounter episodes they especially liked and those they especially did not--even if they have already positively rated the podcast itself.

title: [Android] Skip back before a chapter
author: hermick
body: When listening to audiobooks, I can skip back within a chapter but not before the start of the chapter. In other words, if I'm on Chapter 5, I can't skip back to the end of Chapter 4. Instead I have to bring up the app, bring up the chapter list, select the previous chapter then scroll to the end of the chapter. Skipping back 15 seconds (or whatever the interval is) should just let me skip back from any point in the book. If I'm five seconds into a chapter, take me ten seconds from the end of the previous chapter. In my experience, this is what other audiobook players do, and it means I can navigate easily using my Bluetooth headset or voice assistant. A less important but still useful feature would be having the option to automatically go back 30 seconds to one minute when I resume an audiobook (for instance, if I stopped listening for 20-30 minutes). This is something I usually do manually myself, to help me remember what is going on in the story. I'm happy to use Spotify instead of Audible if it can approach the same level of convenience. Thanks for listening.

title: Played before - symbol (premium)
author: Gab0l
body: Big playlists (Spotify's or community's) have their tracks reshuffled from time to time and that causes cluelessness about which tracks we already listened. They are so big that we don't remember the tracks names, especially considering we listen to playlists usually while concentrating on something else and not on the music itself. If we have a desire to use the playlists as a kind of pool from which we fish out our "favorites" or just want to listen to tracks that we haven't, yet then it's really inconvenient to just guess which is which (played or not). There could be an option to turn on some kind of indicator of a particular track being played before. It would be even better if there would be an option in the "playing order setting" to make the app choose only new tracks (not listened before, not necessarily new on their own).

title: Firestick Playback Speed Adjustment
author: JREFan1
body: The option to adjust playback speed is not available using the current Firestick app. There are too many lengthy podcasts available to limit us to 1x speed only. Please add the option to increase playback speed! Joe Rogan would approve.

title: [Mobile][Browse] Move the «Recently played» shortcut to the now playing or queue page
author: ssssaaaa
body: It's great to have the recently played list added to mobile, though it seems counter-intuitive for me that the «Recently played» shortcut is on the front page, and I don't know for how long it's been there before I recently discovered it out of curiousity. In the desktop app, the shortcut is found on the «queue» page, which makes sense: it's where I can see what I'm about to listen to, and would expect I can access what I've just listened to. Thank you for your consideration. Android app screenshots for reference.

title: [iOS][Other] Going back on queue
author: Adjoa
body: Something that has always frustrated me about the queue on Spotify is how you cannot go back to a song after it’s been played on the queue. Sometimes I just want to go back to a song I played on the queue but instead it plays the song or album that I started playing before I started my queue. I don’t want to have to make a playlist for when I just want to listen to a couple albums or a couple songs I know I like. I really hope this can change.

title: [iOS] Playlist folders to be displayed as a tree on IOS (like on PC)
author: Lesrouges
body: Hello! The folders on PC are great but not on IOS. Make folders displayed as a tree on IOS like on PC.Thanks.

title: [iOS][Other] Song Sharing
author: Nicholasd1
body: Hi! So, I have this very cool idea for the Spotify app. First, I believe that the mobile app should have the friends option and this would let you see what they’re listening to, like the desktop version, but this is the idea. So, the idea is song sharing, and it would work like this. So, say you can see a friend is active using the Spotify app, and you want to play them a song. This would interrupt their listening at that moment, and a notification would appear on their screen and it would say: (YOUR FRIENDS NAME) wants to play you a song! It could work as a surprise in any situation, and it could just let somebody know that you’re thinking of them. They can have the option to accept or decline it also. This is an idea I believe is very cool, and I wanted to share it with you guys.

title: [iOS][Developer] Put the Song release date on the main page.
author: mike20895
body: When you play a Song, it would be nice to have the release date on the main page where the Song name is, and where the Artist name is and it would be nice to see the release date there as well. Rather than having to go into the album by tapping the three dots and then having to go to "View Album" in order to see the release date. It would be a very nice addition to see it up Front when the Song is playing, especially when you are driving in your car. As it is now, you can see the Album Cover and the Artist's name and it should be followed by the Release Date below that. This would be a very nice upgrade!Very respectfully yours,Michael"Spotify Subscriber"

title: [All Platforms][Other] Make it possible a button to retry a failed charge
author: maniacneron
body: Hello, I am using a virtual credit card for Spotify payments. When you cannot receive payments you are sending an info mail about this and the only possible action I can take is to change my credit card info. I would love to retry payment after defining the required limit for my virtual credit card without changing any info. Since the limits are temporary on the virtual credit cards changing limits and waiting for you to retry is not enough. It would be great to have a retry payment action in the mail or in the account page.Thanks for your consideration.

title: Spotify on Standalone Apple Watch
author: SkiJ
body: Spotify is the only Apple Watch music app that does not allow usage on a standalone Apple Watch that is not paired to an iPhone. There are no such issues with Pandora and Apple Music. We have Spotify Premium - with a specific user account that would be used on this Apple Watch - and running latest version of Apple Watch OS 9 on an Apple Watch Series 5 with it’s own cell number/ plan on Verizon. We have tried to figure out with Spotify support, but there is no solution. For example, the below help article only works for an Apple Watch paired to an iPhone (on same phone number) vs. an independent Apple Watch with its own number.https://support.spotify.com/us/article/spotify-on-apple-watch/Thanks - this would be an essential Spotify upgrade for us - and we’re guessing many others

title: [iOS][Playlists] make a playlist named songs to blast
author: Kggjfygy
body: You should track which songs people turn the volume up for and make a playlist

author: Countrykillen
body: When sorting is used in a playlist.It would be neat to be able to quick jump to first track matching using first letter (or symbol) when pressing keybord. Example.Sorting on Artist is used.When pressing "J" on keybord - Jumps to and marks first artist starting with J (ex. Jamiroquai).Or...Sorting on Album is used.When pressing "T" on keybord - Jumps to and marks first album starting with T (ex. Take me to the alley (by Gregory Porter)). title: [Community] option to delete your own comments
author: thristan
body: What if I posted something in this forum and thought twice about it? I want to be able to remove comments I made that might offend others, in order to prevent fights.

title: [Android] Album artwork that functions as a shortcut to the album
author: n7giyq7f723irvy9jmgl
body: Album artworks - when clicked, they take you to album of the artist, instead of searching for it in the 3 dot menu.

author: user-removed
body: I have a hisense smart TV and would love to be able to play my Spotify music on it, but the hisense portal doesn't have the app available. However, other music streaming services are available on it. Is there a possibility the app could made available on this TV? title: [Android][Other] Default setting group session on speaker disabled
author: semagnussond
body: I think that the "group session on speaker" should be disabled by default. In my house I have about 15 different speakers and speaker groups, and we are about 8 people connected to the same WiFi and listening to Spotify. To prevent that another user takes over the speaker I'm currently listening to, I would need to enter all 8 peoples all different devices, enter the settings for that speaker, and disable group session on speaker. And than repeat that for all other speakers and speaker groups. In my case it adds up to changing a lot of settings! This behaviour cannot be expected. The default "group session on speaker" should really be disabled.

title: [Your Library] Download limit
author: cch10
body: I think removing the 10,000 download limit is necessary after the removal of the liked songs limit. If there's people that likes that amount of music is logical they would want to have it offline. On the other hand, I've seen this idea poster before and disregarded because of its similarity to older posts about the 3,333 download limit, which is absolutely not the case and shouldn't be considered a duplicate. I really hope this is taken into consideration.

title: [Playlists] Shuffle+ A new shuffling method
author: Haisom
body: Hello everyone! Ever wondered why everyone is still stuck on same old Shuffle? Whether is shuffling non heard songs properly or is just completely Random, it's still always the same. How about improving this tech a little bit? This idea was already posted once through this link: https://community.spotify.com/t5/Closed-Ideas/Music-Supreme-Shuffle-among-artists-albums-etc/idc-p/4...However, it didn't get enough kudos per year, but I'm ready to try again and be more engaging with the community that share same expectations from Spotify. Shuffle+ is all about listening all your favorite songs in the most diverse order you never thought would be possible. "How?" you may ask. Simple. Instead of being a random shuffle, or true shuffle, Shuffle+ would works as a filter check where you can choose what to Shuffle or not. Example 1: Imagine my standard Favorite playlist from Spotify is already ordered by Album. So every time you play it, it will always play the same songs in the very same order. From album to album, alphabetically. However, I'm feeling like listening to them on a different order, but still want to enjoy whole albums or artists separately instead of shuffling through musical genres. So, you would do this: [ ] Artist [x] Album [ ] Track [ ] Genre Then hit play! What would this do? Spotify would only Shuffle+ among albums until that artist's albums in your favorite playlist are over, then, it would play tracks in order from the next artist's albums with similar genre, because only album was checked . For this to work they would need to add a new Column on library just for Genres. If not, we would only be able to shuffle among artist, album and tracks, though, with random genres. Example 2: [x] Artist [ ] Album [x] Track [ ] Genre This would make Spotify play a artist's whole tracks in shuffle mode, independent of albums, meaning albums order would be random, but all his songs would be played, no matter what. Then, would go to the next Artist and repeat it to that artist, and so on. Example 3: [ ] Artist [x] Album [ ] Track [x] Genre This one would make Spotify Shuffle among Albums and Genres, don't minding Artist or Track order. Once one Album from one Genre finished, it would play the next Album in the next Genre. If Genre is not implemented by Spotify, then it would be like example 1. Example 4: [x] Artist [x] Album [x] Track [x] Genre This would work just like usual Shuffle. Example 5: [x] Artist [x] Album [ ] Track [ ] Genre This would play one artist album in proper tracks order, then Shuffle to another artist's album and repeat. REMINDER: Always remember that whenever Shuffle+ is active, only what is selected will shuffle. Unselected items should play in proper order. Now... How would that look like? Just like the 'Loop' option alternates among 'Loop All', 'Loop One', and 'Loop Off', the 'Shuffle' button could alternate the same among 'Shuffle', 'Shuffle+', and 'Shuffle Off'.The concept of the "check boxes" to select what would be included in shuffle could be done by touch/holding 'Shuffle' on media player button to open up the 'Shuffle+' menu, where the main/first option would be 'On/Off', then the second would have the "tags/checkboxes" to pick what you want to shuffle. Doing so would save that as you preset for Shuffle+, always using it whenever you're cycling among Shuffle option. This means if the user wants to change how his Shuffle+ shuffles through content, he would have to open that menu. Hope you all get the idea. If you don't, please say in the comments and I will try to make it clearer. PS: Not intended for Liked playlist only or Freemium users. Since this is a really complex shuffle method, would only apply to Premium and would apply to all available platforms if possible. Please! Comment bellow what are your thoughts, what could be improved, if you liked it or not. I will update the idea as we get more opinions about it so we can improve it together. HELP SHARING THE WORD! =D -----CHANGELOG----- *Update 08/23/2021 - Fixed example 3 as I got confused with the explanation. Before even though Genre was checked, it was not being shuffled in the example as it should be with anything that is checked on Shuffle+ filter - Added examples 4 and 5 - Fixed a few sintax errors *Update 07/18/2021 -Added a little capped observation that maybe wasn't so clear -Added changelog section to the bottom with all updates/edits so far *Update 06/14/2021 -Added 1 extra example with album and genre- -Added how it it would look and deepened on simplified toggle on/off- -Mixed both PSs together-

title: [All Platforms] DJ Version of Spotify
author: Radioedit
body: I'm a DJ. I want a DJ interface for Spotify, where I can play two tracks at once over the top of each other. It doesn't have to be anything complex -- just two tracks and a crossfader would do the job. But if you fancy adding things like waveforms, pitch-shifting, and other functionality, that would be lovely too.

title: [Music] Shuffle by Album
author: glassFractals
body: Simple enough concept: Shuffle by albums instead of by tracks, for those of us who prefer full-album listening. Should function at least within playlists and the play queue. Perhaps it could also work in radio mode.

title: [Mobile][Playlists] Remove Apple Watch 50 Song Limit
author: bryan_mccomb
body: I am so grateful that we finally can download Spotify playlists on the Apple Watch, but I was pretty disappointed to find out that there is a 50 song limit per playlist. I’m not sure if that is on purpose for formatting or storage concerns, but I would love to see that limit removed so that I can download full playlists to my Watch and listen to all my music without having to have my phone on me.

title: [Mobile][Playlists] 'Add to playlist' sort order should be custom
author: kentoshin
body: In the latest Spotify library redesign, when I try to add a song to a playlist, the modal that opens sorts my playlists in a seemingly random order. This is very annoying since I have a mix of many playlists/folders in a specific custom order, and now finding the correct playlist to add a song has become a pain. This has only become a problem in the latest update, and worked perfectly in previous Spotify versions. I think that the order of the playlists in the "Add to playlist" dialog should follow the same order as the main Playlists tab - that is, if I have my playlists sorted by custom, the dialog should be sorted the same way.

title: [Community][Podcasts] Music + Talk on voice assistants
author: Welinton
body: Hey guys.I noticed that Spotify does not support voice assistant devices like Alexa and Google Home in the Music + Talk format podcasts session.Sharing this session via voice devices greatly aids in the playback and experience of the Music + Talk format.Podcasts and Music + Talk work very well as a radio station and it would be nice to be able to listen on devices with better speakers and that offer better audio quality than cell phones or laptops.I highlight here that this podcast format is one of the best ever created and deserves more development and dissemination.Sorry for the bad English. I am a Brazilian podcast producer and Portuguese is my original language.Thanks for the space. Greetings!

title: [Community][Connect] SPOTIFY CHARTS IN ALGERIA🇩🇿

As Algerians, that have so many talented artists that put their music on the platform, and as BTS ARMY, that wants to support BTS by streaming their music, we are interested to know about the stats and the performance of those artists, we would like to request Spotify to provide SPOTIFY REGIONAL CHARTS for ALGERIA. We are waiting for Spotify Team's positive response about our idea, Thank You!

title: Search for Episodes Within a Podcast Show on DESKTOP
author: col3man
body: Allow users to search for an episode within a specific podcast show only, similar to searching for a song within a playlist on DESKTOP. Add a search bar near the top of the podcast page next to the "following" button and ... Similar to this case: https://community.spotify.com/t5/Implemented-Ideas/Search-Search-for-Episodes-Within-a-Podcast-Show/...

title: [Community][Social] Share Playlists Anonymously
author: H3addie
body: Hi Can we have a share anonymously option for playlists please.I have playlists I want to share on discord but my Spotify account has my IRL name on it meaning it shows when I share a playlist. Given that Spotify is attached to my FB account this makes it something of a risk for random people identifying my personal data and figure a Share Anonymously feature would be the simplest way to do this, either by just not showing usernames, profiles etc to people/preview fetches who follow the link, or using a boiler plate blank.Thanks

title: [Mobile] Voice Control
author: MHTON
body: Think it would be a great help to introduce a voice control for the app version.Doesn't really need to be anything too extravagant just commands like 'Skip Track' or 'Pause/Play' etc. Would be really useful on car journey's for instance!

title: [Desktop][Mobile] Name playlist during creation
author: strok_777
body: When creating a new list by default it's assigned a name to it like "Playlist X", why not allowing to set the name when creating it? It doesn´t make sense at all that you have to tap on the playlist and rename it (needing more clicks for a simple operation)

title: [Playlists] Reward playlists
author: Yozez
body: Add the ability for listeners to reward playlist creators for their fantastic job!There are several reasons why you guys should consider adding the ability for listeners to reward playlist creators:Encouragement for creativity: Allowing listeners to reward playlist creators incentivizes them to create unique and creative playlists, leading to a more diverse and engaging listening experience for users.Recognition for hard work: Many playlist creators put a lot of time and effort into curating their playlists, and allowing listeners to reward them for their work gives them the recognition they deserve.Increased engagement: By allowing listeners to reward playlist creators, Spotify can increase user engagement and loyalty, as users may be more likely to follow and support their favorite playlist creators.Increased revenue for Spotify: By implementing a system for listeners to reward playlist creators, Spotify can potentially generate additional revenue through transaction fees or a percentage of the rewards.Improved user experience: Allowing listeners to reward playlist creators can improve the overall user experience, giving users a sense of ownership and control over their listening experience.Hope you'll guys love this idea 🙂

title: [All Platforms] Spotify for Audiobooks
author: user-removed
body: It would be awesome if Spotify made a feature for audiobooks for every listening experience for those who like a listening feature for audiobooks

title: [iOS][Connect] Show Spotify Connect Device ID next to the name
author: ShalkeBG
body: Recently, I have purchased two exactly same models of DAB radios supporting Spotify connect. One is in my daughter's room and the second in my own room. When I want to connect to one of them, I can't make distinction as both have the same name in the list on my iPhone.I know there were a few similar ideas posted here on how to resolve this issue with custom renaming a list of devices, but it seems to be too complicated for development (I am a developer myself as well). My idea:As every Spotify device has to have a unique ID (probably in the form of a GUID), why don't you just display that ID (or just part of it) next to the displayed name (or below), so that we can clearly see which one are we connecting to? This should not be a difficult thing to do, as you already have that ID as the information in the application, otherwise how does the app knows which one to connect to. Surely it does not use the name of the device, right?

title: [Social] Party Mode with DJ that approves songs
author: Mr_Brightside23
body: A mode where there is one "DJ" who has ultimate control over the music being played while others can join the party and suggest songs they want to be played through the app. The "DJ" can decide if/when to play the suggested songs.

title: [All Platforms] [Podcast] Individual Autoplay Settings
author: poplopo
body: I think Podcasts should have different settings for autoplay than music. With music, the most desired way to listen is to proceed to the next song automatically without having to select one. But that's not the way podcasts are generally consumed - it is a more deliberate process. And particularly because the default sorting of a podcast is to display them with the most recent podcast first, it's quite a disruption to listen to a podcast all the way through and it begins to play the "next" episode - which also happens to be an older one that you've probably already listened to. There should be a setting that users can select to only play one podcast at a time. When the podcast is done, I want to manually select which episode of which podcast to listen to next, not have it chosen for me - and I would bet that's a pretty common listening pattern.

title: [Android][Playlists] Highlight the currently playing song on Android Auto
author: noi2giochiamo
body: On Android Auto (in my case Volvo XC60) the song actually played is marked with a small vertical blue line on the left side. In almost all Europe, the driver is on the left side of the car and the blue line , being on the left side, can be hided to the driver by the screen frame. The idea is to better identify the song that is playing (maybe with a colored highlighted frame all around the played song). This idea is far away from the carview one. It's impossible to see the blue line while driving

title: Submit suggestions to public playlists
author: jnichols1026
body: Speaking mainly about public playlists (but could be implemented in private playlists between friends too):A lot of playlists have themes, so if a user knows a song they thing fits that theme but isn't on the playlist already, the user could submit the song suggestion to the playlist's creator and then the creator could decide if they want it added to the playlist.This could (1) help expand people music repertoire by sharing music, (2) build community by having people basically build playlists together (even if they don't know the original creator personally), and (3) just build even better, themed playlists.Thanks for considering!

Dislike button helps people to directly manipulate their preferences. Please return this useful feature.

title: [Android] Bring back adding albums to homescreen
author: JustinWittenmei
body: Very useful feature and there was absolutely no reason to remove it. It was so convenient to add the album's I like the most to my phones homescreen in their own folder. As much as we are charged, taking away further customization options from us is inexcusable. There was no reason to remove it at all.

title: [Mobile][Your Library] Increase the limit of pins on Your Library
author: whatsthepoint
body: Wow. Spotify is a mess now. And one more thing to add to the list: you can only pin FOUR items (playlists, podcasts) in "Your Library". I'm trying to use the pins to organize my library so that I try and make this new design actually work for me, and then I quickly encounter the error message: "You're out of pins. You can only have 4 items pinned at once." FOUR??? Why only four? What sense does that make? I guess Spotify isn't making a product for people who like to listen to lots of music and podcasts, they're just making it for people who have a maximum of four playlists or podcasts that they listen to. If I had so few things I listened to, I wouldn't be paying for Spotify Premium. Pro Tip: you should fire anyone who was leading this new design overhaul. They clearly are trying to sabotage your company.

title: [Android][Developer] Android 13 Media Player
author: Jammie16
body: (This problem is solved on the latest beta version of Spotify for Android, thanks for all who replied and voted to this <3) Hi, currently the Android version of the app is running in SDK target of 31, because of that, the media player in Android 13 is not fully adapted to it, with the background image in low resolution and no redesign, if you guys update the app to the SDK target of 33 the app will run perfectly in the current version of Android, with the new design, (the problem of low res background is still occuring). Here are some screenshots: SDK 33 With themed play/pause buttonSDK 31 With no themed play/pause button

title: [Android Automotive][Other] Explicit Filter toggle for Android Automotive app
author: rairan
body: In the Spotify app for my Polestar 2 running Android Automotive, I would like to be able to easily toggle explicit filtering on/off as needed. I am a Premium Family subscriber and would like to have explicit filtering on when I have our kids in the car, and then off when it's just me or my wife and me. Seems this could be added to the Settings menu just like it on the smartphone app.

title: [All Platforms] Separate Queues for Podcasts and Music
author: jeffreyfhow
body: Hi there,Would like to propose this again as it looks like related tickets were closed and not addressed.Just want to share a concrete example on why this would be helpful... Throughout the day I'm listening to either music (while working) OR podcasts (while commuting). If I'm commuting to work, I'd like to queue up podcasts to listen to while commuting. This includes coming back to the same podcast queue when I'm commuting home from work (ie. same queue in the morning and evening). The problem is, I listen to music during the day while I'm working. So I need to clear my podcast queue and then queue everything up again after work. I think fixing this would increase user engagement on your apps. For example, having my podcasts on Apple podcasts is just more convenient now because I don't need to deal with this daily inconvenience. Every week, that's multiple hours of engagement per user (for a subset of podcast listeners) that you could be gaining back.I'm a huge fan of Spotify, so I'd love to be able to seamlessly use your app over Apple Podcasts for this use case. Thanks

title: [Your Library] Liked songs archive
author: Its_uriel
body: As time passes, our taste in music changes. If you’re like me, it might be too late to try to crest playlist (when you have 4,000+ liked songs). id like to suggest an archive of liked songs where it can be a total collection of all the songs I’ve ever liked as some songs/artists get removed from my likes as my taste changes over the years. I may not like some songs in my daily rotation but I’d like to have a cumulative list of all songs I ever liked. does that make sense?

title: In a shared playlist have the option to play one song of a different person every time
author: agedus
body: Have the option to turn on a setting in a shared playlist so it plays a different song from a different person every time.Example: We have a shared playlist with 6 people. person 1 has added 60 songs, and the rest have only added 10 each. If we now play the list we listen mostly to person 1 their music. If there was a feature that allowed you to play a song of each person every time and when those persons don't have any more songs it skips them.So: in random order. person 1 -> person 3 -> person 4 -> person 2 -> person 6 -> person 5. and them repeat and repeat.Ac:. Auto-generate an order of persons when you start playing the list with the setting o. When one person does not have any more songs skip to the next person Hope this is helpful and thx in advanced

title: [Alexa][Connect] Prevent NSFW images from displaying on the Alexa Homescreen
author: Q15
body: I have multiple Alexa's which are connected to Spotify. The Alexa home screen will rotate different Spotify tunes by showing their cover image and song title. The problem is there are many cover images that are too explicit to be just rotating around on screens, especially when they are not being played. Until Spotify prevent explicit / sensitive images from being displayed on Alexa's homescreen then I have disabled Spotify from being able to display songs on the homescreen screensavers This means Alexa will still show Amazon Music songs recommendations on the screensaver (competition) For example, this image and many others like that show up multiple times a day on my Alexa screensavers If I was to upload / embed that image into this post then it would result in this post being flagged as sensitive / NSFW

title: [Search] Japanese Lyrics should have Yomigana
author: musiclover789
body: I can't read kanji very well and it would be helpful if there was simply yomigana

title: [Discover Weekly] View previous Discover Weekly Playlists
author: user-removed
body: The discover weekly feature is excellent, however I was disappointed yesterday to notice that last weeks playlist had disappeared. It would be great to be able to view previous discover weekly playlists. Thanks

title: [Desktop][Social] Send song recommendations to friends on desktop (with concept photos)
author: Crisp8
body: Add a feature that allows you to send a song to friends on the desktop app (please look at attachments for concept ideas)Reasons:1. if you want to share a song from desktop options are limited if you haven't downloaded social media, and emailing a song link can be clunky and awkward 2. being in app would streamline the sharing experience, often having to leave the app can be distracting (particularly on social media) and annoying 3. I often use spotify to look for new music so having a list of songs personally recommended by people I know all in one spot would, firstly make finding new music easier and be more convenient then scrolling through messages to find song recommendations.As good as the spotify algorithm is, often the best music recommendations come from friends that know you and your music taste. This feature would enable that.below are some ideas of what it could look like Concept photos (photoshopped):

title: [Community][Podcasts] Reset podcast played status/progress
author: dadj8cjq-5_xq
body: There should be an easy way to reset the played status or progress in a podcast. Something as simple as following and unfollowing should reset the played status (perhaps offer a warning that all progress would be lost). Secondarily, I use Spotify every day, as a paying member, and I have just now--after years-- gone on to this Community and discovered that this issue was closed due to "lack of votes". This seems ineffective. I wonder what percentage of Spotify users even know an issue is open for votes.

title: [Desktop] Keyboard Hotkey to queue Track(s)
author: skarnl
body: I often browse my playlist and would love to be able to just quickly press something like the Q key to add the selected song(s) to the queue. Now I have to use my mouse again and it gets pretty annoying to quickly add songs to the playqueue. Would love to have it more work like it did in programs like WinAmp. There you could just press Q to add the song to the queue, select multiple songs and in the playlist queue you could easily rearrange the songs. Now in Spotify it's a little harder to perform these things.

title: [Musixmatch][Search] Different-sounding tracks must have different ISRC codes
author: thristan
body: I encountered multiple versions of a track sharing a lyric page in Musixmatch because they have a common ISRC code due to the song arrangement being alike for all versions. My concern is live recordings, and in each version, the crowd applause has different lengths and can even be completely absent in one version. Therefore the song and vocals start at different points, which makes me consider the tracks to sound different. It can be true if the audio begins four seconds later in one track than in a similar version. In this case, I'd ask the head honcho of Musixmatch to split the connection and create separate lyric pages for other versions of the track. He tends to turn down the request if the lyrics are the same, even if the vocals begin at different points in different versions. What I'm asking is that if you know that tracks coming from different albums have different starting points for the song, each version will have a unique ISRC code so I won't worry about making different split requests. This will be greatly appreciated.

title: [Podcasts] Group Session Feature: Podcast listen along
author: jdrmag
body: Extend the listen along feature to work with podcasts. It feels strange that you can't listen along to a podcast and it would be nice to listen together with my friends who also enjoy the same show.

title: [Playlists] Like same song multiple times
author: airguillaume
body: Hi there 🙂 It would be very nice to be able to like the same song multiple times and be able to sort liked songs by interest (means count of likes on the song) Sometimes when I listen to random stuff, I'm like "oh this one is cool" and I forgot that I already liked it. But, I'd like to re-like it to make it more "visible" inside the songs I liked...

title: [Alexa] Multiple Spotify Accounts for Amazon Echo
author: rskyles
body: My wife and I have our own Spotify accounts. On Amazon Echo, you can create your own profile. It would be great to link your own Spotify account to your own Amazon Echo account. Thanks!

title: [All Platforms] Shuffle algorithm that favours "unpopular" songs
author: fraktalisman
body: As a paying Spotify premium customer, I need a shuffle algorithm different from the current, non-random shuffle that seems to favor "popular" songs, as has been pointed out by other customers who experimented with what is actually happening (see links to other posts below).Currently there are only two possible ways to listen to music in playlists, either in the listed order, or shuffled by an algorithm that makes listeners miss out on about 20% to 30% of the songs in the list, favoring the ones that we already listened to hundreds or thousands of times.I want to be able to choose another algorithm that does exactly the opposite: play songs in a pseudo-random order but leaving out the ones that already have been played frequently, and instead focusing on songs seldom listened to, in order to make me rediscover new songs and inspirations! This is even more important when listening to playlists made by other people, to help me discover new music.The new algorithm could be called something like "serendipity shuffle" or "discover mode". This could be an option to activate in the user's settings, so the existing popularity shuffle would stay the default option.In case a serendipity shuffle is too hard for you to implement, a simple randomized shuffle function would also be much better than the current one. This has already been pointed out in other posts in this forum.See other posts in this community:https://community.spotify.com/t5/Ongoing-Issues/Shuffle-Is-Only-Going-Through-A-Handful-Of-Songs/idc...https://community.spotify.com/t5/Ongoing-Issues/Please-stop-marking-shuffle-complaints-as-quot-not-a...

title: [Wear OS] Enable shuffle and replay for downloaded songs
author: Takeout
body: There is currently no option to shuffle or replay songs for downloaded music on the Wear OS Spotify app.

title: [iOS][Other] Clear now playing bar after end of a song/playlist
author: whysoserious79
body: The bottom “now playing bar” stays after a song/playlist ends, is useless when there is nothing playing, please give us the option to remove it or remove it automatically if nothing is playing, I remember before we can remove it by logging out and logging in again but not anymore.

title: [Mobile] Rearrange Playlists on Mobile
author: 3_8m-osv0pucw
body: Please include an option for users to manually rearrange playlists on mobile. See attached picture for more details.

title: A music interpretation and storytelling function
author: wwalker0228
body: A music interpretation function where artists and listeners can give a brief interpretation and what that song means to them. This idea can be expanded in playlist form where people can actually create a story being told through music and their interpretations.

title: [Mobile][Your Library] Increase quality of playlist images.
author: nicopellatiro
body: Something I've noticed from making my own playlist covers is seeing how Spotify compresses them. Oftentimes, it crunches the quality a bit too much, in my opinion, resulting in a blurry icon. Side by side next to Apple Music, it's clear to see the difference especially with the small font text to the bottom left. It'd be nice if Spotify compressed the images to a lesser degree, so more detail could be enjoyed in our playlist covers (something akin to Apple Music).

title: [Other] azlyrics
author: Gracecasey89
body: I couldn't submit a suggestion so I'm putting this here. Musixmatch.com doesn't have accurate song lyrics, a better website Spotify should use is www.azlyrics.com. They check and fix their lyrics much more consistently.

title: [WebOS][App Install] Remove LG account requirement for WebOS app.
author: SpeedWalid
body: To install Spotify on LG's WebOS, you need to sign into your LG account. This is a pain for people who don't want to create another (mostly) useless account. This does not seem to be a hard requirement since you don't need it to install apps such as Disney+ or Youtube. It'd be great if Spotify could work with LG to remove that requirement!

title: [All Platforms] I want complete history of all songs
author: jonathanfritsch
body: I want to be able to view all songs I have listened to. I will remember some song I was listening to a few months ago and can't remember the name. I want to be able to see EVERY SONG I HAVE EVER PLAYED. Also being able to delete songs from history that I didn't like which creates suggestions for songs I don't like would be nice. I WANT TO SEE EVERY SONG I HAVE EVER PLAYED. DON'T TELL ME THAT YOU HAVE A HISTORY FEATURE ALREADY. IT'S NOT TRUE. THANK YOU!!!

title: [Radio] Queue Radio - Enhance current queue like playlist radio
author: Yozez
body: Add the ability for listeners to enhance their current queue based on the last songs in the queue, the same as playlist radio feature.four reasons why you guys should create the "Queue Radio" feature:Enhancing discoverability: By adding a "Queue Radio" feature that automatically enhances the current playing queue with songs that are similar, Spotify can help its users discover new music that they might not have found otherwise.Personalization: By allowing users to customize the "Queue Radio" feature based on their listening habits and preferences, Spotify can provide a more personalized listening experience.Greater flexibility: With a "Queue Radio" feature, Spotify users will have more control over their listening experience by being able to seamlessly transition between different songs and genres without having to manually create new playlists.Increased engagement: By providing a more engaging listening experience, users will be more likely to spend more time listening to music on Spotify and engage more frequently with the app.hope you'll guys love this idea 🙂

title: [Discover] Play random Songs from complete Spotify Catalogue
author: PHISCHY
