body: The idea is especially for people who love music, without focusing on a special genre. An "Ultimate Shuffle Button" will pick random songs from all songs available on Spotify. You can explore songs, you might never get in touch with and learn new music - or just skip if you don't like it. This function helps you to just try out something new and find out about varieties in music. Edit: All Audiobooks should be excluded from this function!

title: [Mobile][Playlists] Bring back number of songs in a playlist
author: Bittencourt
body: The old mobile interface used to show the number of songs in the playlists section. The updated version has removed this feature, which I find quite useful.

title: [Daily Mix] Customization: Create / Remove / Add / Merge Mixes
author: user-removed
body: Daily Mixes is one of the best additions to Spotify yet, but as all new features it has room for a lot of improvement, especially when it comes to customizing your mixes. Right now mixes are enterily dependent on algorithms, however I think users should have a degree of personal input on how mixes are built. For example, it would be great if users could select a couple of songs and then have Spotify create a mix based on those songs. It would also be great if users could remove a mix and replace it with another, or merge different mixes into one. For example, Spotify created two different EDM mixes for me, one based on house music, and another based on tech house tracks. I find that a little redundant and I would like to merge both mixes into one. There's also another mix which is a weird combination of ambient, IDM, downtempo and indie rock tracks (?). I would like to split that mix in two, one for indie rock and another for IDM, downtempo and ambient music. And then there's a pop/R&B mix which I'd like to replace entirely with a jazz music mix, since I don't listen to that much mainstream pop and R&B music in the first place. Expanding the number of daily mixes to 8 would be great as well, since 6 mixes doesn't quite cover the variety of music I tend to listen to. Finally, being able to add back to mixes songs or artists that you banned on accident is a must.

title: View all audiobooks by a particular author or narrator
author: mang0s
body: Audiobooks are one of the biggest growing media sectors on the market at the moment - and it's fantastic to see Spotify partner with Findaway Voices to bring audiobooks to the platform, as well as providing a mainstream alternative to Audible.However, there are some lacking features; many audiobook listeners choose to follow a series of books, or books by a particular author or by a favourite narrator. However we cannot search books on Spotify by author or narrator at the moment. It would be fantastic if an 'author page' and a 'narrator page' were added, similar to how an 'artist' page lists all their albums. That way those of us who have favourites would be able to easily find and follow the work of those we like most.

title: [Desktop][Podcasts] Mark as Played
author: user567234
body: The feature to Mark as Played that's available in Mobile should absolutely be available in the desktop app also. Why is there a feature disparity between platforms?

title: A more accessible Share button
author: prakritiM
body: https://dribbble.com/shots/20294240-Spotify-Share-feature Advantages-1. Quick sharing.2. Up to industry standard

title: [Wrapped] Discover yearly - new music released over the last year
author: Yohankiwi
body: As we reach the end of the year and all the best albums / songs of the year are coming out, it would be great to have an additional custom playlist added by Spotify at the end of each year that works like the discover weekly playlist but that only includes new music released over the last 12 months. It could help people discover new music they may have missed that was released over the course of, for example, 2022. It would make a great complement to the "202x wrapped" feature that also gets released at the end of each year.

title: [Desktop][Developer] Spotify for Windows on Arm (Win32) Desktop app badly needed
author: bradavon
body: Can you tell me when Spotify will be released for Windows on ARM and where on your Roadmap it is? Windows on ARM PCs have been out a few years now and whilst the 32-Bit Windows App works, due to software emulation not optimally. Apple announced on the 22nd of June Macs are moving to ARM starting the end of the year and they expect the transition away from Intel to ARM to take 2 years. Both Microsoft and Adobe are working on ARM compatibility. Currently on my Microsoft Surface Pro X I have to use the 32-Bit download which lags. A new idea was posted for this last year but it's been closed as it didn't get enough Likes but it didn't get enough Likes as it's been closed 😕 - https://community.spotify.com/t5/Closed-Ideas/Desktop-Compile-Spotify-for-ARM64-windows/idi-p/478113... Thanks

title: [Android][Other] Configure button when listening to audiobooks in Google maps
author: Retals
body: When using Google maps there are shortcut buttons to pause and skip forward 15 seconds. It would be useful change the skip forward to rewind backwards as that is the more common thing to do, even better would be to let users configure that button. At the moment users have to open up the full menu to rewind which requires more button presses and taking eyes off the road

title: [iOS][Developer] Dynamic Island: Like button
author: jstorm482
body: It would be beneficial to have the heart button to be able to like songs from the Dynamic Island feature. In the same way a heart appears next to the song title when Spotify is open, it would be nice to have that heart appear when Dynamic Island is expanded. This could also be beneficial on the music controls that appear when the iPhone is locked.

title: [Desktop] Popout player
author: angryhufflepuff
body: I have seen this idea posted several times over the years and they are all marked closed. I personally find it really frustrating that people have clearly been asking for this and over and over been denied, especially because it seems like a rather simple feature. Anyway, on the web player on Chromebook, there is an excellent popout player that remains on top of other tabs and windows you open, has the album/song art and has simple controls like pause, play, skip, and rewind that show when you hover over it. You can also move it around your screen so you position it where is easiest for you. It's crazy to me that this feature hasn't been implemented already for the desktop application, or if it has then the fact that it's been removed. It's super annoying to have to stop what I'm in the middle of to open the Spotify window just to see what is playing, or to skip or save a song. Something with just the basics of these features would make a huge difference and make usability so much easier.

title: [Desktop][Spotify for Artists] View most played parts of songs in Spotify for Artists
author: popmachinerecords
body: I would love granular feedback like knowing the most skipped to part of songs visible to artists to make better music for fans, this feature is available on Youtube videos for a good example. There are a few songs I skip to a certain part in for my own listening that I want the artists to know about and thought this may be a successful “Spotify for Artists” feature! Thank you!

title: [Mobile][Search] Save My Search feature.
author: AleeGee
body: I've noticed my searches have resulted in music I've never heard before, and upon listening, I'm very happy with it.. Some really great music comes up on a search , with a few keywords, or (agh) a typo, which you might not reproduce, ever. It is for this reason, I would like a Save My Search feature. We could go into settings and toggle it. For example, today I searched for "Songs with sensuality", and everything was to my liking. One playlist I saved and shared, it was so good. I went to do another search, typed in "sensual songs" and I wanted to look at all the results, but I lost the page. I did another search, typed in "sings" instead of "songs" and I got different results. A typo changes everything, and you might not even be aware you made one. Save My Search What do you think??

title: [Desktop][Wrapped] Allow us to see Wrapped on PC.
author: WoodrowWilson
body: We used to be able to see it on PC. Why would you take it away? EDIT: 1 year later, wrapped is out and once again is not available on pc. We are forced to use the mobile version (that if the app doesn't crash when you open wrapped).

title: [Developer] Web API playback queue route
author: flash110
body: The Web API is lacking a public endpoint to fetch an authenticated users current queue. The addition of this would expand the creative possibilities developers would have at their disposal, without it a big chunk of what the Web API was designed to provide is simply not there.

title: [Connect] Crossfade on Spotify Connect
author: nicoboucher73
body: Please add Crossfade option while using Spotify Connect!!! Why not have this option while using Connect??? Think of it, you use CONNECT when you want to send Spotify music to your sound system(i.e: CONNECT compatible Audio amplifier/receiver) when you're having a party. Wouldn't you want continuous playback in this kind of use?? I really do not understand why I would not be able to use this feature because I'm using the your streaming service with a compatible device which is partner with Spotify!!! PLEASE MAKE THIS HAPPEN!!! PLEASE!

title: [Community] Remove the name "Remastered" from album and track titles by creating a stamp
author: user-removed
body: Many album and track titles come with "Remastered". Is something too boring in both the album titles and the tracks: "Remastered". I took a print and marked it in red. Spotify should create a "Remastered" label and remove this from album and track titles. Observation:There is another highly voted suggestion similar to mine that already has 500 votes. Link: https://community.spotify.com/t5/Live-Ideas/Your-Library-Edit-track-metadata/idi-p/5196177/page/3#co... The two suggestions are similar and together they count over 800 votes and are suggesting the same thing: that the album and track titles are correct and in accordance with the standard norm. What will the team do?

title: [Music] Personal Rating of Music
author: Hideaki
body: It would be awesome if it was possible to give a personal rating to your songs and albums (and artists), and then sort them after it in your playlists. Hope to see it in the future, it shouldn't even be that hard. Thank you!

title: [Web Player] Friend Activity on web player
author: hathor
body: Bring the Friend Activity feature where you can see what your Spotify friends have been listening to the past couple of hours from the desktop app to the web player.Also put it in a reserved area or button so that I don't have to make the window suuuuuuper wider just to see the feed on the side. This has been requested before but I still think there is enough interest for this to get more than 100 kudos. That's how the Friend Activity pane looks on the desktop client:The web client does miss this Friend Activity view:

title: [Desktop][Playlists] Total Time of the Liked Songs
author: GoodIdea23
body: Add the total time of the playlist next to liked songs

title: [Desktop] IPv6 support for the desktop client
author: Furry13
body: Resubmitting the same idea as:https://community.spotify.com/t5/Closed-Ideas/Desktop-Support-IPv6-end-to-end/idi-p/1240314https://community.spotify.com/t5/Closed-Ideas/Desktop-Desktop-client-IPv6-support/idi-p/1667179https://community.spotify.com/t5/Closed-Ideas/Other-IPv6-Support/idi-p/4469460submitted previously by @sdstrowes It would be highly desirable to make sure that the desktop client can work on Ipv6-only networks as they are becoming operation reality (a number of large entrerprise networks like Cisco and Microsoft have piloted IPv6-only corporate networks). As it's been mentioned in the previosuly posted incarnations of this idea, the mobile client works just fine and Fastly supports IPv6.Thanks!

title: [Music] Warning when a Track is removed from Spotify
author: JoacoRacing29
body: I use Spotify to store the music i like - saving them on Playlists. Spotify adds music continuosly but also deletes other, by licence problems or whatever. But you Spotify must warn me in that circumstances, so I can get that music from another source. It s not acceptable that you quit music from your servers and from my playlist without any kind of warning. It s a disrepect to the user of your service. Please solve this problem as soon as it s possible.

title: [All Platforms][Playlists][Premium] Preview song samples when adding songs to playlists
author: yourfriendtim780
body: Bring the ability to preview songs when adding them to a playlist back, it makes it extremely hard to find new music to add to a playlist cause you no longer know what it sounds like without listening to it separately from the add songs list. The feature made it supremely satisfying to make a new playlist and removing this feature ruins the likeability of the app for both me and many other listeners. It's a extreme mistake and I'd highly recommend to add it back not only for ease of UI but for general expansion of music exploration.

title: [Plex][Social] Integrate Spotify into Plex
author: Spicerackk
body: Now that Plex has taken on TIDAL as a music streaming partner, it only seems fitting that the best and most popular music streaming platform follow suit, and get onto Plex! It's just another massive platform for Spotify to partner with, and it will get your subscription model into the hands of true media managers who use Plex to collate all of their media in one place!This needs to happen, please get it going!!

title: [Android][Connect] Bring back support for removed BMW Connected Drive Integration
author: kay0002
body: Share this with everyone you know and ask them to vote! Spotify Integration with BMW Idrive 6 has always been sporadic and not all advertised features work. The latest Spotify versions 8.5.68.904 and 8.5.6.9.934 have bugs and the App does not appear in IDrive at all. The pervious version of Spotify was somewhat unreliable as I had to occasionally repair my phone with the car. I can no longer see the Spotify App in my BMW media list. I can only listen to spotify from the bmw bluetooth audio option. I've tried pairing an iPhone and the app appears on iDrive. For my android issue I deleted the App data and cache of both Bmw ConnectedDrive and Spotify app. I also unpaird the bluetooth connection between my smartphone car. Lastly, I uninstalled both Spotify and the BMW Apps. Nothing works. Additionally, it would be great if my Playlist order in my car matched the order on the phone. For example, although my phone app is sorted alphabetically, my car would only show playlists in the order of what was most recently created. Who else thinks Spotify needs to get it together and provide a quality app that integrates with iDrive? Fix the Spotify Bug!

title: [Mobile] Swipe left to 'Hide this song'
author: kkzo
body: There are too many taps required to 'Hide this song'. Having to select the menu next to the song often leads to mistakenly selecting the song you were going to hide. Currently swiping right is a shortcut for 'Adding to queue'. Consider adding swiping left (on the song) to trigger 'Hide this song'. Allowing the user to configure directional swipe actions would be even better.

title: [Apple Watch] Remember Podcast positions for offline listening
author: MattSuda
body: When I am listening to podcasts offline on my Apple Watch, Spotify doesn’t remember where I was in an episode which means I have to skip forward and try and find where I was. It also doesn’t remember where I left off on the Apple Watch when I switch back to the mobile app later on. This means I have to manually sync where I was in the episode when listening in the mobile app later on.

title: [Amazon Echo] Stop auto shuffling Songs when you request an Artist via Alexa
author: mdriscoll33
body: You changed the setting so that Alexa auto shuffles songs by artist when you use your voice to start spotify. For some reason, I have to request this as a new idea for you to reverse the setting. You already can tell alexa to shuffle when you request an artist. Why would it auto shuffle and force you to interrupt the music you just started to play?

title: [Subscription] Send a Receipt to Premium Users Each Month
author: Samsmith2
body: For years I subscribe to Spotify Premium, I got only one email receipt from Spotify in the first month, and not any more. Is Spotify trying to hide our receipts to let people forget "Unsubscribe"? Please send us receipt via email every month unless we unsubscribe the notification.

title: Disability Concession for disabled people
author: rrrq3ba33a6xhnz
body: I do notice that there is not enough kudos for this topic. Are you sure? I strongly believe that if you have discounts for students - able bodied in most senses- then physical and intellectually disabled people should receive the same concessions.Monitoring the bona fide of this would not be hard. The user would need to submit the details of their concession card.I am writing this on behalf of my intellectually disabled sister who loves her music. She has limited finances, and any financial discount helps her to access other things.I just cannot believe in this age, that there is not enough “kudos” for this. I’m sure the artist who get a token amount of money from Spotify would agree to monetary concessions to disabled people.Spotify could do a great service to themselves and the community to concede to such an idea. Don’t forget it is 2021. Get with the times please Stan Kluzek.

title: [iOS] Do NOT automatically hide the Timer in Now Playing
author: vmc923
body: A recent upgrade has resulted in the song timer blacking out in the Spotify App after a few seconds on a song -- I am a cycling instructor, and I need to see where I am in a track without having to reach down an hit the screen for it to show up again (I accidently jumped to the following track in the middle of a workout the other day trying to figure out where we were in the song). So yes, you can make it re-appear, but when you are leading a class with 50 people in it, and still riding, it is a huge pain to have to pick up your phone multiple times in a song, and very carefully tap the screen (without swiping) to see what minute mark you are at. Having the slider is not sufficient as we time our classes and songs with planned races and pickups (so, for example, I need to be able to know that there is a pickup at 1:22-157, and that there are 7 seconds before it happens, or 32 seconds until the end of the song, etc. etc.). Removing the timer saves NO space on the screen, and is more of nuscance than anything else. Please bring back the song timer, or at least give people the option to say "Yes hide the timer after a few seconds", or, "No, leave the timer there". There are thousands of fitness professionals in the same position -- along with my entire studio who use spotify, and we are all irritated with this new feature. Please, please, PLEASE change it back. This has been a huge headache since last week's update.

title: [Desktop][Other] Sleep timer for desktop
author: Scrambled
body: I noticed recently I can’t use the sleep timer feature on the desktop version of Spotify. This is pretty inconvenient seeing as 99% of the time I’m not using my phone for Spotify if i'm planning to listen to music while going to sleep. Obviously i don’t know the ins and outs of adding such a feature but surely something so small can’t be hard to implement? I’m assuming the feature is in the process of being added as I see no point in giving it to mobile users with no intentions of adding it to the desktop version which seems far more practical in my mind.

title: [Desktop][Playlists] Let us change our playlist's accent color
author: TerryZúñiga
body: Let us choose an accent color for our playlists, and not from a preset color palette chosen by the app, but with any color we can think of. This would be for aesthetic purposes only, yet I think that many users wish they could have that option. (At least let us use that option on the desktop and let the color show on the phone, tv, desktop, etc.) The problem is that when you add a custom thumbnail to your playlist, Spotify sets an automatic accent color to it. Sometimes you can get lucky and have it match your thumbnail, sometimes it just looks dull. Also, it always picks a different color for the phone and desktop apps. So it would be pretty nice if you just let us do that job instead of the AI. We would have a consistent color for all apps and we would all enjoy more aesthetic playlists! Thanks<3

title: [Ads] Ads Filter
author: xletoatreides
body: I know we can't pick and choose what ads to see, but at least for a teensy bit of decency (especially for people listening to spotify in a professional work environment) can we not have half naked Victoria's Secret super sexy models? Personally, I could care less about ads. And in fact, I am a woman who shops at Victoria's Secret. Still- I just had an awkward moment with some coworkers AND my boss. I'd like very much for that not to happen again. In the very least, how about an image that isn't half the size of the window? I know no one's going to agree, and believe me, I'd be the last person to complain about spotify (it's awesome). But seriously, it's a bit much. Thanks.

title: [Amazon Echo] Alexa controls via Spotify Connect
author: maestro72x
body: There should be a way for any Echo to control a remote spotify connect.say my speaker that has spotify connect and is playing Elvis. I should be able to use any Echo to change that remote speakers playlist,song,artist etc. The new playlist, song, artist etc will start be playing on that remote spotify connect but controlled by any Echo. August

title: [All Platforms][Other] Sony's 360 Reality Audio
author: tommy536
body: Hello Friends, i am using Spotify Premium since years. At the Moment i am missing some features like HD Streaming or Sony's new 360 Reality Audio. Especially Reality Audio is truly a real gain and even more useful than HD Streaming. The 3D sound is literally phenomenal good and also Sportify should gradually deal with newer technologies. Is this topic already planned? If it does not come, please tell it so your users can make a decision.

title: [All Platforms] Changelog after each Update (In-App)
author: liamwhear
body: With each new update, no matter what gets added or taken away, there is a curious lack of accountability from the actual staff, and the (paying) userbase are left confused. Why can we not drag from iTunes into our playlists anymore? Why can we not order our playlist columns as we see fit? So a detailed, easily accessible, log after each update would sort this. In this log should be a list of all the changes made with each update, and with the reasons why the changes were made. This is most important. We pay for this service. Why should we be left utterly confused with each update? We're left to scurry over to this forum, where your lackeys (who actually aren't on the development team) have no choice but to say 'I don't know' to each question, and with each request to implement back a feature in the Ideas section, the only response is 'This is not a priority'. What's wrong with some honesty, eh?

title: [Desktop] To include engineers and other credits
author: sashabowers
body: This is way overdue. Spotify MUST include those responsible for the music other than the songwriters and producers. This can include:Recording engineers, Mixing engineers, Mastering engineers, Cover artist, Additional Instrumentalists/Vocalists. (This can look like how it is done on TIDAL) As an engineer, I'd love to be credited and to be able to check who's behind the music by opening another application to check. I have attatched a comparison of how Spotify looks in comparison to the competitor mentioned above.

title: [All Platforms][Search] Spotify Charts for Kenya
author: BTSKENYA
body: Kenya became a recent addition to the recent expansion of Spotify to new markets earlier this year. With the rise in popularity of the app we feel the need for charts to showcase the popularity of artists and songs within our country that is (Viral 50,Top 50 Daily and Weekly Charts and album charts too)This benefits both the artists in gauging their popularity and fans in seeing how their favourite artists are fairing in the country. We hope to soon see the implementation of this idea.Thankyou

title: [Mobile][Your Library] Pin a filter type to make it the default Library sorting.
author: Shohan
body: With the new update to the library that brings in filters for Library and a single list, I and I assume many users would like a way to default a filter to Library. For example, I want the ability to pin the "Playlists" filter as default so that whenever i open Library it automatically opens the view on "Playlists" instead of having a single list of everything tucked together. This would mean anyone who only used Playlists (or Artists or Albums) before the new update would get something similar while people who like the new update could just opt to not pin any filters.

title: Native app for Mercedes-Benz User Experience (MBUX)
author: Nicscap1
body: Hello! I'd like to Have native app for new mbux. I know that I can use the app with the Phone, but a native app without needing to use the phone would be cool!Mercedes will use the mbux on all its machines and it could be a good choice for spotify! Thanks!

title: [All Platforms] Add visuals (or upload) for desktop and TV
author: DaleCocoDale
body: I think it would be awesome to add a visuals feature, for Desktop and TV players (Roku). Some times I just don't want to see the menu while I'm listening music, to delve into the full experience of what you want to hear, visuals reenforce it and if you have the chance to customize what you watch while listing to music, it only amplifies the experience, a whole no perspective of audiovisuals. With an "on and off " button if the listener wants to use it or not.

title: [Mobile][Playlists] Please add a Play Next option by sliding left.
author: SoGroovy
body: Hey guys, you're doing a great job with the app! My favorite music streaming platform. However, I'd like to see an option to add a song to play next in queue. Searching for songs to add to queue can get tricky when you find a song youd like to hear next after you've already set up a queue. Instead of having to go to queue, scroll down to specific song you'd like to hear next and drag all the way back up to top of queue. Something I've been hoping to see for years and I'm happy to see I can reach out and toss a suggestion your way. Thanks to your teams hard work and progress over the years.I can't wait to see what you guys have next in store for us. Thanks again.

title: [Radio] AM/FM Radio Streaming
author: user-removed
body: A suggestion like this has already been marked inactive, but I do believe that Spotify can be made a more complete service by incorporating AM and FM radio channel streaming. If it would be possible to add stations in to the radio feature, perhaps separating stations into two categories, live radio and Spotify radio, then Spotify would truly become the chosen one, giving users access to virtually every legal music listening service on the market. Listeners could use the feature for new popular music, news, and talk entertainment. Similar to the way the feature currently works, listeners could save their favorite stations, and browse through lists organized by genre, location, or amplitude/frequency. Feedback from people familiar with the way that radio stations would react to third-party streaming would be particularly appreciated to solve the business end of this proposal. Let's get this second attempt at implementing a good feature a shot at getting off the ground!

title: [Android][Other] Modernize app icon to support Android 13 Material You device theming
author: Andrewcpu
body: Android 13 has introduced the required API to theme app icons based on user color themes. The Spotify app is a perfect candidate for this style of theming given the fact it's a simple icon that can be colored and themed independently from the actual shape of the icon. The implantation of the themed icon is relatively simple for a developer and would only require at MOST 3 hours of work for infinite benefit to users. The actual change in reality is setting a simple XML flag and pointing to the monochrome logo. There's a list of apps which are adding support for this feature here: https://9to5google.com/2022/08/27/android-13-themed-icons/ It's a good plan to add it soon because currently users consider the Spotify app icon because it's an eye sore compared to other themed app icons. The updated Material You logo is now present in the Alpha + Beta channels. However, I would say either the monochrome icon needs to be shrunk slightly, OR Spotify should drop the solid circle from the monochrome logo, and leave the 3 lines as solid instead of the 3 lines being a cut out.

title: [All Platforms] Offer Subscription Option for Those Not Going Online Every 30 Days
author: rmurgaz
body: This issue has been already posted several times, but no solution up to now.Some people have the problem of not having an Internet connection for months. Or at least, not good enough.This can happen to military, fishermen or humanitarian aid workers. Spotify disables the downloaded music in case the App in the device does not go "online" at least once every 30 days, no matter if you pay the subscription or not.Therefore, one can be paying the Premium subscription to Spotify, but not having the downloaded songs available due to a lack of Internet connection (it occurs even when there is Internet connection, but not "good enough" for Spotify).So, my request to Spotify is to find a different way to have the downloaded songs available even if the App cannot go online.Thank you.

title: Setup Spotify Kids as a service in Sonos
author: Benjiiim
body: I would love to be able to setup a Spotify Kids account as a service in Sonos, in order not to pollute my recommandations with my kids favorites... 🙂

title: [Desktop] Bring back the popularity bars
author: natewrigh
body: Bring back the little bars that signified how popular each song was on an album!

title: [Browse] Show upcoming album and release date on artist’s homepage
author: drchris
body: Spotify doesn’t currently provide any info as to when an upcoming album will be released or even if there’s an upcoming album at all. It would be awesome to add upcoming albums to the artist’s homepage with the expected release date. See Apple Music screenshot.

title: Support of Яндекс.Станция
author: Egor4
body: There is smart speaker Яндекс.Станция in Russia. It would be good to have Spotify on it.

title: [Other] Bookmark audio books and separate them from music
author: murpsel
body: Please implement bookmarks for audio books and separate them from music.________________________There was an idea for bookmarks in audio books. Sadly it was closed, because one half of the idea (save the position in podcasts) has been implemented, even though nearly all of the 30 pages was about people wanting this for audio books. As the moderator posted "If you'd like to see the same behaviour for audio books, we'd recommend making a new Community Idea for this.", so this is it. There are many other audio book bookmarks requests, but they were all closed as duplicates because of the now closed idea. As an additional aspect to this, please ensure a separate handling / tagging of audio books and music. When alternating between listening to audio books and music the Spotify engine starts putting book chapters in your recommendation playlists, which doesn't make any sense whatsoever. 01/2023: It's astonishing that Spotify keeps steadfast in ignoring this simple and annoying issue. Getting a best of 2022 list with chapters of audio books still isn't a good idea.

title: [Community][Other] TOP 50 Slovenia chart
author: maya0411
body: Slovenia became a recent, last year addition in availability and access to Spotify. Since almost all European countries have their own TOP 50 chart, we feel we need one too. To see the popularity of different songs in our country + the amount of streams a certain popular song or artist gets. It is also a way to bring more new listeners to the app. I hope you will implement this idea soon. Thank you for your time

title: [Mobile][Playlists] Reinstate “Last Updated” on playlists
author: theiggymoo
body: As from version 8.5.46 on IOS, you can no longer swipe left to find out when a playlist was last updated. Can this feature be reinstated as it’s really quick useful way to check large playlists and when they were last updated.

title: [Search] Search by BPM (Beats per Minute)
author: PhilP
body: Hi All,As someone who loves punishing my body by going for long runs, a good playlist to keep me company is essential! Picking out and discovering which 'choons' are going to speed me up and push me further can be tricky.One trick used by many runners is to search out and find songs which all have a similar number of beats per minute so they can place them in order and then use the beat of the song to run to. As such, it would be awesome to be able to search Spotify for songs which have specific ranges of BPM and then pick the cool [subjective] ones for inclusion in your playlists. Cheers!

title: [All Platforms][Your Music] "Add to queue" with Google assistant
author: Aradrodusa1
body: I would like to add the 'add to queue' function to any google assistant device. I have a google home device and when I try saying "play next" or "add to queue" the speaker just switches to the named song right away. Even tried using 'ifttt' but couldn't find or build a good applet. This kind of missing functionality is a MAJOR gap for my everyday usage of the google assistant. If you think this is an idea/feature that should be added, please send a link to a friend of yours with a Spotify account and ask him to help too.

title: [Mobile] Bring back Thumbs up/down in radio
author: lavieenrose
body: Spotify took away the thumbs up and down options on radio stations. Does that make you as mad as I am. I spent dozen of hours optimizing all my radio stations and now they are useless as Spotify basically plays whatever they want to play on them. It's become just like one of their own playlist. Gone all my beautiful radio stations. I chatted with customer support and here is what they said: "Sorry to hear you're missing your thumbs up and down Radio, and I can see backstage this is due to the recent Spotify update. We're always testing things by adding or removing features to make Spotify better overall." If you are dissatisfied, help get this feature back by liking this post. Thanks!

title: [Desktop] Full Discography Reinstatement
author: jLongerB
body: The full chronological artist discography, with all tracks listed out, has been removed from artist pages. Please add this back, as it was the most efficient way to explore an Artist's discography. Very simple. Spotify seems to be attempting to bury this issue by closing attempts to bring it up and referring to other versions of this question that have also been closed. This is a new issue for users that are experiencing this change for the first time. See:https://community.spotify.com/t5/Closed-Ideas/Desktop-Put-all-of-an-artist-s-songs-back-on-their-pag... and:https://community.spotify.com/t5/Closed-Ideas/All-Platforms-Browse-Provide-a-simple-Tracklist-with-a...

title: [Your Music] Personal Song Counter
author: MozzarellaSticc
body: There should be an option to see how many times you listened to a song.There could be a Favorite Songs tab, etc.You would have to enable it in the settings?

title: Albums & Playlists: Have BOTH Play & Shuffle buttons at the top
author: MattSuda
body: Albums and Playlists should have BOTH a Play Button and a Shuffle Button at the top in the mobile and desktop apps Some users want to easily play the list in order and other users want to play it in shuffle. Some buttons are currently play and some are shuffle. Why not put both buttons there so we can choose if we want to shuffle it or play it? Right now to play in order you can press or click on the first item in the list, but with the different types of play buttons this is still confusing for most users. Shuffle can also be controlled by clicking on the shuffle button on the now playing screen. Right now the play buttons are inconsistent across all of the Spotify apps. On mobile it was recently changed so now when you go to album pages, the button at the top is no longer a shuffle play button but instead a regular play button. Playlists still have the shuffle play button on mobile. On desktop all play buttons are regular play buttons and do not shuffle. See how confusing that is? Why not do like other music apps already do and have both a PLAY and SHUFFLE option buttons at the top of the playlist or album. Problem solved, you get to pick how you want to play it. Doesn't make sense how inconsistent it is currently. I never use the play buttons because you never know if it's going to shuffle or regular play. I just click the first song in the list to play the songs in order usually and if I want to shuffle I just turn shuffle on from the now playing view. For artist pages you can just leave it the way it is now with only a shuffle play button since playing in order wouldn't make sense. You could still add it and pressing the play button would play their most recent releases in order. If you end up keeping the shuffle button then change the icon on it to a shuffle instead of the play with the little shuffle icon underneath it. This is how it would look like at the top of the album and playlist pages in the mobile app. It would look similar in the desktop app too. Keywords: Adele album shuffle play button change

title: [Discover] New Releases Section for Followed Artists
author: MattSuda
body: Please add a section to the desktop and mobile apps where we can see all of the new releases from the artists we follow. When artists release new music, their fans want a way to find it directly in Spotify without having to rely on social media or elsewhere away from the Spotify app. The Release Radar playlist by Spotify only shows some new releases and then it disappears a week later. This new section would act as a "feed" and update automatically when a new album from an artist you follow is available on Spotify. Please make the feed have a high display limit so we can go back months and months and for sure won't miss any releases. For a third party solution check out (PLEASE IMPLEMENT IT LIKE THIS) https://spotifyreleaselist.netlify.app ---> Check out my guide on how to use this third party web app Screenshot from https://spotifyreleaselist.netlify.app: The problem with the current "new releases" section is that it doesn't show new releases from artists you follow. It only show the most popular new releases. The only way right now to find new releases is to go to the artist's page and hunt around for the new release or use the Release Radar playlist. The Release Radar playlist is not what we want. The problem with the Release Radar playlist is that it mixes in suggestions. I want to see followed artists ONLY. And if you check the playlist a week too late, all the songs are GONE. We need a feed that we can scroll back months and months and months so we can see all the new releases from the artists we follow. We shouldn't have to rush through it and it be gone the next week.

title: [Your Music] Add LOCAL FILES to Your Music
author: HjalteRMC
body: First of, I'm a huge fan of the new layout. But as the title says I'd like to add my own beloved local files to the "Your Music". I don't see why this shouldn't be a possibilty. This way I don't need to have one master playlist, I can just have all the music I like under "Your Music -> Songs". Also, as suggested earlier, changing the font size could be usable to many people.

title: [Community][Partnership] Spotify Chart On Bangladesh
author: Armytheallies
body: As Bangladesh has many music lovers, artist and lots of premium spotify users who support their favorite artist by streaming song, we want to see our streaming chart from our country. As a BTS fan specially I want to see Bangladesh Spotify chart and our favorite artist streaming ranking of our country

title: Option to sort songs in a playlist from highest streamed song to the lowest
author: jsiak
body: When you find a playlist that you seem to like, it would be nice to be able to sort the songs from highest streamed to lowest streamed. For me personally that would be a nice way to find new favorite songs: if there are popular songs in a playlist that I’n interested in, that I haven’t heard of before, I should give them a special listen.

title: [Desktop] spotify stat genre info
author: Glitterbruise
body: I am fascinated by my Spotify stats and in particular the large number of genres I apparently listen to. What I would really like to do though is click on a genre and see which songs I have been listening to that fall under that category. As it is now there is no good way to do that.

title: [Mobile][Developer] Get points on your account for the amount of time you listen
author: Logan2112
body: You can get points on your account for the amount of time you listen and can get trophies or other rewards

title: [Android Auto] Show Podcasts Menu in Android Auto
author: edoardocomar
body: The podcasts menu available in the library section of the phone app should be accessible also in Android Auto !This idea is not new, has been requested before - and has 130 votes !! Should not have been closed as inactive !! https://community.spotify.com/t5/Closed-Ideas/Android-Auto-Show-Podcast-in-Menu/idi-p/1603955 plus duplicates https://community.spotify.com/t5/Closed-Ideas/Podcasts-on-Android-Auto/idi-p/4444479https://community.spotify.com/t5/Closed-Ideas/Android-Other-Android-Auto-podcasts-menu-absent-list-s...

title: [Desktop] More options for full screen mode
author: jordonian
body: For some of the spotify made playlist, there are different color gradients while in full screen mode. Apart from the normal grey gradient. If there was a way to have custom preferences for full screen mode, that would make it much more appealing, and be a great thing to have on in the background during a party. Some of the options could be, One color: pick a color, and the background is that gradientCycling colors: the gradients will cycle through all the available colorsPicture / gif upload: someone could upload a specific .jpeg or .gif and it will be behind the album cover, title, artist.Different stylized options for the album cover: This one might be more complex, but it could have the album off to a side, then the other side have the artist / title. The extra space could also be filled with some of the gifs from the mobile app on spotify that artist can upload.I would very much enjoy more options, to have more visual interest at my parties.

title: [Discord] Show Songs on Discord on Mobile
author: Celestial21
body: So, when you have the Spotify all on mobile, you can't see what music you're listening to on the discord app, even though it's connected and the settings are on. This feature is for Free/Premium and it works for PC, but doesn't work in spotify mobile because of its different API. After talking to an agent, I found out this feature hasn't be added, but I'm sure a lot of people would love it, who use both discord and Spotify on mobile. I request the developers to add this feature to mobile, too, so that our friends can too see what music we're listening when we're using the Spotify mobile app. Device- Samsung Galaxy S7 Edge on android 8.0 Oreo Attached are the screenshots of the music not showing up on the discord app.

title: [Discover] Find similar Playlists to your own Playlist
author: Ptomalley35
body: I have a playlist of all of my favorite songs. Just from browsing around Spotify for a little I found a playlist that had about 70% of the songs in my playlist in it. I soon discovered that I loved the majority of the songs in this new playlist that I didn't already have in mine. I have discovered a lot of new music this way, but it is difficult and time consuming to find new playlist similar to mine. I think it would be awesome to have the ability to discover new playlist that contain a lot of the same songs as my own playlist. This could be done with a "Search for Similar Playlists" feature that allows users to drag multiple songs or playlist into a search feature that locates playlists others have created that have a high percentage of similar songs in it.

title: [Artist Page] See if you're a Top Listener
author: margaretgobbell
body: There should be a way to see if you are a top listener for your favorite artist. It would show you what number you are (in your area or worldwide). I would like to see if im a superfan

title: 'Add all songs to playlist'
author: abhedgepath
body: Allow all songs in an existing playlist to be added to a new created playlist. It would be good to have the option to 'Add all songs to playlist' from an existing created playlist to a new created playlist.For example: I have a 'notable songs' playlist for each year. I've been doing this since 2016. If I wanted to have all my favorite songs from the last 5 years in one playlist, it would be really easy to create a 'notable 2016-current' playlist by adding all the existing songs from each year's playlist together. The only option right now is to add each individual song from each year's playlist using the 'Add to playlist' option. That's the difference of 6 clicks and about 600 clicks. Would be helpful. Thanks!

title: [Desktop] An option to disable automatic updates
author: electricwizard
body: Some of us are tired of having these terrible updates forced upon us on desktop. Having the option to use older versions of the software without being forced to update would be extremely useful.

title: [Community][Other] Give Uganda 🇺🇬 Spotify charts
author: BangtanUganda-Admin
body: Ugandans spend hours streaming their favourite music on Spotify with the mindset to both have fun and support their favourite artists. Although there are external means of having competitions with others on a global scale, it does not show much of an impact without official charts for the country. We'd very much appreciate it if this feature were to be added for us music lovers.

title: [Desktop] Airplay for the Desktop Version
author: ruccola
body: I would love to have Airplay built in the app itself, so I don't need another program such as Airfoil.

title: [Your Library] Edit track metadata
author: theknine2
body: Apple Music has this neat feature that allows users to edit track metadata for all tracks added to the user's library. This is most useful for putting custom artwork for albums or removing (Deluxe) or (Remastered) tags on albums, and removing parentheses in track titles. This feature is also useful for scrobbling with Last.fm, a feature that is not built into Apple Music. Custom artwork for albums is a popular feature on Apple as fans can use their fan-made artwork in screenshots. Being able to edit track and album metadata on Spotify would be great for people like me who love to micro-manage their music library.

title: [Android][Other] Improve the Spotify icon for rounded icons
author: AnthCristiano
body: Hello! The android Spotify icon recently got updated with a black border. For anyone with a dark or black wallpaper, the icon now appears to be smaller than all the other icons on the phone because the black blends in the the backdrops, making it look really off-putting and out of place. Looked a lot nicer when the logo took up the whole space! Not sure if iPhone users would have the same issue, but it would make sense they do. HopwHopef this can be easily adjusted!

title: [iOS] Landscape mode on iPhone
author: Rocio
body: Hello folks! Since we just released "Landscape Mode on Android" and we marked the idea as "implemented", we wanted it to be fair with iPhone users (half of the comments were supporting Android half iPhone) so we have created this idea just for you iPhone users! We have also added half of the kudos to be entirely fair. Give it some kudos if you want to see this implemented. Thanks.

title: [Your Library] Remove individual track from saved album
author: headoncollision
body: I don’t know when this change was made, but today I noticed that when I am looking through my saved music library by album, there are songs I specifically did not save for a reason, whether that be because it is a re-released song from a previous album I already have saved, or a song I just don’t like that I don’t want to play when I’m listening through an album. This change gives us way less control over our own saved music library. Please change it back.

title: [Partnerships] Serato DJ
author: Cguzmanlaserna
body: I love Spotify and find amazing music all the time. Recently I started using Serato DJ but haven’t been able to see my Spotify playlists, something I would love to be able to do as it is making me use alternatives like iTunes - which makes me feel I am going back in time.

title: [Community][Connect] Spotify Charts in Pakistan
author: BTSPAKGALAXY
body: Spotify was launched in Pakistan since February 2021 making music accessible to Pakistani however due to absence of Pakistan charts, it is impossible to see how well are artists performing in the region. In view of public interest as well as of BTS fans who want to support their favorite artists by streaming their music, we would like the introduction of regional Spotify charts in Pakistan to see the artists popularity and demand in the region. It would prove helpful to Pakistani artists for them to see their demand in their hometown, and Pakistani fan to see how their favorite international musicians are doing in their own island. We hope this idea finds you in great health and is given a thought by Spotify Team. Thank You!

title: [Desktop] Mac Widget
author: vlb152
body: There used to be a mini player you could minimize spotify to on desktop that disappeared a few years ago - can you bring that back?

title: [Android] Swipe to Queue on SEARCH
author: Gannondank
body: Hello! I advocated for the "swipe to queue" feature on Android, and I want to thank the developers for partially implementing that. My request is for songs to be swipeable on the search page. Frankly, that's what most of us were expecting when we requested the feature. Again, I want to stress how this feature improves both the safety and quality of life of each listener by streamlining the time spent constructing one's feed. Whether when navigating or in public, situational awareness is paramount. In a time when many of us could stand to deflate our phone usage, simple quality-of-life features such as this make surprising improvements to user happiness and to the connection with their music. Thank you for considering! At its current stage, the swipe feature remains incomplete at best for many people. My thanks again to the dev team!

title: [Android] Remove the Shuffle / Play Button
author: -quazar
body: Hi, I tried out your new design, which I have mixed feelings about, but nevermind that. The most annoying thing I come over in the new Spotify (for iPhone by the way) is the dumb, big, overlapping, unnecessary shuffle play button that pops up everywhere. Is this a bug or is this on purpose? Could at least had add an option for it. Also, it doesn't look streamlined at all with the current design. Did it even occur that not everyone wants a shuffle play button?

title: Allow users to rate their daily mixes
author: rileybolen
body: I find that some days my daily mix is great and others it's just okay. I would like to be able to rate my daily mixes so that these ratings could be incorporated into the recommender algorithm, to improve the quality of my future mixes.

title: [Desktop][Friend Feed] Move 'Share Activity' Toggle to Friend Activity
author: LouisDavis
body: Spotify recently decided to change the default of whether a user is sharing their activty or not. This update doesn't actually solve the issue that the activity toggle is hard to find and unknown by a large majority of users. My suggestion is to place a toggle and indicator at the top of the 'Friend Activty' sidebar so that users can turn on and off their activty sharing with ease and be aware of their sharing status. This will not totally resolve the issue because a user will need to have the 'Friend Activity' sidebar enabled to see it to start with but it is a start to making this functionality far more accessible and obvious. An additional change would be to place a 'Share Activty with Friends' button under the 'Private Session' button in the profile dropdown menu with a green check mark to it when enabled similar to what the 'Private Session' button does when enabled. If this is done it is important to make it clear in the settings menu and possibly through hints what the difference is between enabling a private session, and disabling sharing your activity.

title: [Oculus][Other] Spotify for Oculus Rift & Quest VR Platform
author: DJ-MastaJ
body: It would be really cool to have two of my favourite things for entertainment join forces....... My Oculus Quest (or Rift) and Spotify. It would give users the very unique ability to see Spotify in such a different way and have access to their library and playlists in a whole new amazing way. That would make it enjoyable to manage, listen to and curate playlists. Not only that, it would then give users the ability to link Spotify to certain apps and games within Oculus allowing them to stream Spotify music while playing games or apps in VR. With a surround sound experience to accompany amazing visual content. Virtual Reality Oculus is amazing and it's made by Facebook, I could only imagine what could be possible if Spotify was to integrate also.... There is also an app called Tribe which is an amazing DJing VR app, there is even potential to pay a special membership for using Spotify for Oculus and being able to use the songs on the virtual decks only while using VR as to not infringe copyrights etc etc. I think there is so much potential in this especially in these down dark times of Coronavirus where we are all stuck at home in lockdowns etc. And are turning to VR or remote platform to work, live play and entertain ourselves and our families while at home. While keeping each other and our world as safe as we can with Social distancing. Spotify for Oculus VR........ I reckon it's a winner, please bring it on!

title: [PC] Show "Added to (name of playlist)" insteed of "Added to Playlist".
author: emilorjes
body: On my PC when i add a song to one of my playlists it says "Added to Playlist". It would be nice if i could see what list i added the song to, exampel "Added to Acoustic Chill" insted of "Added to Playlist".

title: [Your Library] Automatically follow artists whose songs are saved
author: isprayaxe5
body: I went to go to my artists tab on spotify to find ideas for what to listen to today, but it's been utterly butchered with the new update. Now, you have to follow artists individually instead of being able to see the artists of all your liked songs. This is a regressive change, and very inconvenient. I can still go to my own likes songs and sort by artist there to get a list of all my artists, but that's really inconvenient cause I have to scroll through all of the songs by one artist in order to get to the next one. Plus, if I wanna play just my liked songs by an artist, I have to type in the artist's name in my liked songs playlist instead of just going to my artist library and tapping on that artist. please fix this.

title: [Podcasts] Download and play podcasts on Samsung Gear smart watch.
author: MBRK
body: The spotify app for the Samsung Galaxy watch does not allow users to download and listen to podcasts on the watch while not connected to wifi/another device. While users can download music (songs, playlists, etc) and listen to it straight from the watch (e.g. while running), this is not possible with podcasts.

title: [All Platforms][Playlists] Recover Playlists From Since the Account Opened
author: draskosky
body: I used to be able to access all of my deleted playlists through the "Recover Playlist" page and now I can only see them if they've been deleted within the past 30 days. I was recently looking for a playlist that I had had for three years and had deleted a year ago but I wanted to get back into. With the option to get it back, I have lost it forever and that honestly sucks. I say all playlists should show up in the recover playlist page with the option to delete them forever if you want.

title: [Android] Set Spotify as Default Player
author: francocm
body: Android applications seem to support some form of integration with the Android OS to identify as a music player. Going to: Settings > Apps > *Gear Icon* > *Default Section* > Music app: I'm able to select which application on my phone should be the default app for music, and the phone presents me with a list of choices:Google Play MusicMX Player ProES File Explorer ProIPTV Pro.As you can see, Spotify is not on the list. If those apps can make it to the list, so can Spotify. Would be really great to see official integration with Android in this regard, especially because such integration helps a lot when connecting the phone with the car! Screenshot attached. Phone: OnePlus 5OS: Oxygen OS 4.5.2 / Android 7.1.1OS Build: ONEPLUS A5000_23_170624 Thanks (P.S. Originally posted in the Android section, but was recommended to post it here)

title: [Android] Long Press on Android
author: SpederParker
body: For a week or two now I've lost the option to long-press on a song, album, etc. in order to access the menu for things like adding it to the queue or a playlist. This was by far the easiest way to interact with the app. Please reimplement this feature. Please. Like really. Please.

title: [Community][Connect] JAMAICAN CHARTS
author: TheJAU876
body: Despite having our own unique music industry with artists from across the island being huge overseas, Jamaica was deprived of this streaming platform for several years. it wasn't until February of 2021 that we finally got access to Spotify alongside other Caribbean/African nations. Now that we have Spotify (which is great for the visibility of Jamaicans and our artists world-wide), we now feel that we need some charts to truly showcase the popularity of artists and songs within our nation. This includes a Hot Hits chart, Viral 50, Top Songs Weekly and a Daily Top 50. Jamaican artists deserve to see how popular they are within their own nation and Jamaican fans deserve to see how their favorite international musicians fare in their own island. We hope that our idea finds the Spotify team well. The Jamaican ARMY Union

title: [Desktop][Playlists] Add density slider for UI display
author: Bun-Bun
body: With every update the density is decreased in the desktop app. The most recent update to turn the desktop app into the web app has made it even worse. More now than ever we need a density option to increase display density and turn off album art per line in playlists. This has been suggested before and closed despite lots of votes, but it really needs to be considered now. This is an absolute deal breaker for my continued subscription to your service.

title: [Desktop][Social] Separate friends from artists
author: midoriha_senpai
body: It's a little clunky when you're trying to see all the non-artists you follow. Currently, those people are mashed into the complete list of follows, which can be among hundreds or more of artists, and you have to know to go to your profile first to see them. It's also clunky that you can't see all friends on the friend feed or get to a full list of them, but that's a whole other suggestion, lol. Here's what I had in mind to decouple the non-artists on our profile page [image attached]. The concept here would be similar on mobile too. Friends decoupled on profile page

title: [Partnership] SDK for Video Game Integration
author: gottfridsson
body: Similar to the move onto game consoles, why not connect with the game development community, 2 months free then forced premium. In-game music in GTA V or whatever complimented with spotify of your personal liking whith the game music code managing when/where/volume to avoid destroying the feel when conversation and such starts. It would allow for an aging game to still have fresh audio, maybe lock to original games music "radio" selection. Seems like a way for all involved to win.

title: [Playlists] Birthday Playlist Under 'Made For You'
author: Jæk
body: Aside from all the other playlists y'all make, when it's my birthday and I really hope to would find a playlist made specially for me... It would be like a birthday present. How fun would that be? I vote fun 10/10. Open to collaborate.

title: [Desktop] Toggle the display of album covers in playlists
author: balonlon
body: UPDATE: thank you all who supported the idea! A clean UI is a happy UI, hopefully we will have to option to clean ours up very soonPlease give us the ability to decide if you want album covers toggled on or off in a playlist. In the current look they takes up so much unnecessary space and it would be nice to just be able to set them to 'do not display'. I am aware this will be marked as a duplicate of this idea but that was 2 months ago and is now closed.

title: [Subscription][Security] Re-enter Payment Details to Upgrade to Family
author: honda234
body: Once hackers get access to my Spotify account, they will change my regular Premium subscription to Premium For Family and add strangers to my plan. I will be charged $5 extra each month! Spotify does NOT require to enter my credit card number to change the subscription type, which leaves the risk to users. It means hackers NOT ONLY have stolen Spotify accounts, but also have stolen stored payment method to pay for family plans. But in France and the UK, Spotify requires to enter the credit card number to change the subscription type to a Family plan. (free Google home mini was the reason why Spotify start asking for re-enter credit card info, but the offer has ended, Spotify no longer ask for re-enter card info...) Idea: Please ask users to re-enter card number when changing regular Premium to a Family plan. Just like what Spotify did in US/UK/FR markets when free Google Home minis were giving to family owners for free. So hacked users won't be charged unauthorized money when hackers upgrading their plans to the family plan using stored payment method.

title: [Mobile][Search] Alphabet scroll bar
author: shima11
body: I'm really missing the alphabet scroll bar for artists and songs on the iPhone Spotify app. Please return this feature!

title: [Desktop] Support WASAPI Output
author: seanpatrick76
body: Hey there, I've just got the trial subscription to Spotify and am enjoying it thus far, HOWEVER there's a pretty major downside to its playback capabilities when compared to other programs - in that it doesn't have either a WASAPI output. You can force "all channel stereo" through a receiver, but that doesn't sound quite as good. XBMC does this excellently, and has a rudimentary spotify app - however it's not near as user-friendly or functional as the actual spotify app. It just sounds WAY WAY better. When deciding whether to continue my subscription after the trial period in a few months time this will definitely be one of the deciding factors. Thanks for bringing Spotify to Canada though! TL;DR - Add Wasapi support.

title: [Subscription] Spotify for Twitch Streamers
author: user-removed
body: In this day and age, one thing that's missing for gamers who are streaming is the ability to place background music into their streams. It would be lovely if we could pay spotify for the right to stream music without copyright issue. The cost may be higher, but certain streamers are making enough to warrant purchasing said account level.

title: [Desktop] Allow an optional switch between desktop and web player look on desktop app
author: jjonnn
body: Basically, a few people got forced to switch to the web player for some kind of A/B test. Here are the disadvantages of the web player: It is impossible to see the friends that you are following, follow any non artist profiles, to change the playlist image, search for a song within a playlist, or sort playlist by filters such as: date added; song length; artist name; or album name. It is also impossible to see an album on an artist's page after you click on the album. Here's video proof of that. https://streamable.com/rs9m2. Also now it doesn't show you the correct labels, and says stuff like navbar.search and artist.monthly-listeners-count instead. I want to be able to switch back to the desktop version. I've logged in on a different account on my desktop app and desktop version loads. When I log in on my account, the web version loads. Here's a screenshot for yall who don't believe me. Please let me have the desktop player back. I love Spotify, have had an account for years, and this has been very frustrating.

title: [Desktop][Other] Add a way to find out when you first listened to a song or album
author: justin1772
body: I was just curious about my music listening history and thought this feature would help me and others find out their long term listening history.

title: [Playstation][Other] Spotify App for PS Vita - a great music player with an awesome DAC
author: Uber-Duper
body: The PS Vita community is massive, even in 2020.We would love a Spotify app on our wonderful handheld console. Music playback from the Vita is phenomenal, and having access to the Spotify streaming service would generate even more interest in the device and bolster the PS Vita community; prolonging the life of our beloved console. On behalf of every PS Vita fan, I'm down on my hands and knees hoping that Spotify will make our music streaming dreams come true. All gamers, show your support!!

title: [Mac] Spotify in Notification Center
author: mattysouthall
body: It would be cool to get a feature we can turn on to have song changes display in the Notification Center on OS X!

title: [Discover] See what I listened to Days, Months, Years ago
author: Ella123
body: Hi Spotify team and users,I would really enjoy if I could see what I listened to one and two years ago, or longer. I've had Spotify for over 6 years so imagine how the music taste changes.Sometimes it's so much fun finding an old song you used to love but haven't heard for so long. Maybe you could be able to access your old Starred playlist from a year or more ago etc. Possibilities are endless!I've spent whole nights just looking for and playing nostalgic music, and imagine how good it would be for the artists.Hope it'll be considered!Kind regards,Ella

title: [Search] Globe Learning 🤓
author: EmanueleRagusi
body: I am Emanuele and I am 16 years old. I thought about an interesting idea that I would add to your platform. I would build a world map, where artists all around the globe are shown up and you can zoom in and look for what people in that specific country/city are listening to. I would add it in the premium accounts to incentivize people to buy it. That would bring people to know more artists and be able to listen to foreign artists more easily. For instance, I would like to improve my German, what's the best way to do it? Listen to German music and learn new vocables. So, what shall I do? I'll just go to the main world map of Spotify, zoom on Germany, and look for artists. I'm pretty sure that this innovative idea could bring Spotify Premium listeners different benefits! I hope that you will consider this offer and contact me.

title: [iOS] Allow custom iOS widget color scheme
author: mmcgill829
body: Thanks for implementing a widget for the app for iOS14. However, the lack of the ability to set a static color scheme is frustrating. The widget automatically changes color based on playlist/artist image, but doesn't seem to adjust to black/white. Many users have spent a large amount of time setting up custom icon sets and themes that this widget clashes with. I have a black/white setup on mine, for example, and the bright green widget just doesn't work. Would be as simple as adding a menu in settings for widgets and allowing choice between color schemes. Should be fairly easy from a coding perspective.

title: [All Platforms][Other] Make spotify green - use clean energy for your servers!
author: florig1
body: Spotify should run its servers on 100% rebewable energy. Other music streaming portals do it! Why not Spotify?

title: [Chromecast] Stream highest possible Quality to Chromecast
author: hevaKmaI
body: After casting Spotify from my iPhone or Android phone onto my new Chromecast audio device(s) I was disappointed to discover that I could not set the device to extreme quality, even though I am a premium member. It would be good to allow a default extreme quality setting on all devices used on my account or to allow setting the quality in the iOS/Android app. Support says Spotify transcodes from their native Vorbis codec to 256kbps AAC, which further reduces audio quality, especially since Chromecast Audio seems to natively support Vorbis. Spotify should strive to make their service use the best possible audio quality on any platform, and that doesn't seem to be the case right now with Chromecast.

title: [Music] 8D Surround Sound
author: 9783bre
body: With the reemergance of layered/3D/8D/headphones only audio videos on youtube, I would love to see an option like that become available for Spotify. It would:A.) create competitive edge over all other streaming platformsB.) potentially become a money making premium only feature (free to trial first of course)C.) be a great way to connect with artists who truly care about their musical output and the experience for listenersD.) be really freaking awesome. Here's a list of songs that would be grerat in 8D:Slow Dancing In The Dark – Joji3005 – Childish GambinoYou Should See Me In A Crown – Billie EilishWait a Minute! – WillowSUMMER – BROCKHAMPTONCall Out My Name – The Weeknd and basically every song ever because music is wonderful

title: [Desktop] Import iTunes Playlists
author: JanDC
body: It was such a good feature that made Spotify complete. I is so easy that you could import the playlists and don't have to use 2 different applications. Best of both worlds.Spotify does not give an explanation or reason why they disabled it and tells me to share it with the community.Do we really have to quit Spotify and go to Apple Music for this??It seems you need a lot of likes so please vote a lot!! Thank YouJan DC

title: [Android] Resizable Android Widget
author: zachc94
body: As of 1/8/2018 the spotify widget is currently on a 1x4 size. Many newer phones have the ability to hold more icon columns (more than 4) therefore the spotify player looks poorly made and ill fitting. I know that google play, and samsung play provide the ability to resize the widget to match the width/# of icon columns you have on your screen. Can it be possible to allow the widget to be resizeable like other music playing competitor apps? It feels weird that spotify doesn't take this idea into account. It has been submitted many times on the forum: https://community.spotify.com/t5/Closed-Ideas/Android-Music-Still-no-resizable-widget/idi-p/1453390 https://community.spotify.com/t5/Live-Ideas/Android-Widget-Scale-for-bigger-phone/idi-p/1450583 https://community.spotify.com/t5/Closed-Ideas/Android-Resizable-Widget/idi-p/4158889 https://community.spotify.com/t5/Closed-Ideas/Android-Other-Widget-Size-Adjustment/idi-p/1280262 https://community.spotify.com/t5/Closed-Ideas/Android-Other-Spotify-widget-resizing-on-Android/idi-p... https://community.spotify.com/t5/Closed-Ideas/Android-Widget-should-be-resizable/idi-p/1151879 https://community.spotify.com/t5/Android/Spotify-Widget/m-p/760295 I assume it isn't that much work to do compared to some of the other ideas I have seen you guys implement. Please look into this, as there are definitely people complaining about this everywhere. Thanks, Zach

title: [IFTTT] More Triggers/Options for IFTTT
author: Bjoern112
body: Can you create more options for ifttt? for Example: if Spotify is playing music... ore if Spotify stop play music... I need it to turn on or off a Hifi system.

title: [Partnerships] Kodi Plugin (XBMC)
author: Crazy-S
body: Hey, how about an official Spotify XBMC Plugin, so that many users of this gorgeous media center can experience the best music jukebox on their TV's. I know that there are some unofficial Apps like Spotimc or Spotixbmc etc, but those are very buggy and don´t look professional. A XBMC Plugin would be a epic win!

title: [Shows] TV Shows & Movies
author: jrjessen7
body: I would love to have a feature where, similar to podcasts, listeners could look up their favorite TV shows (ie Parks and Recreation, The Office, Family Guy, BBC Sherlock), and listen to episodes. I like to listen to podcasts when I go to sleep and when I'm driving and sometimes I want to listen to my favorite shows, without running netflix (since I can't lock my phone). I would assume this would require some time of partnership with television producers to have partial ownership of the shows. However, I think a lot of people would largely support this based off of the amount of playlists with television show titles that already exist, as well as podcasts centered around them.

title: [All Platforms] Streaming Service On Spotify for Sports on VOD
author: user-removed
body: It would be nice if they was a free and premium streaming service for sports on VOD on Spotify

title: [Subscription] Discount for National Service members
author: lillykera
body: The student discount for Spotify premium helps college students afford to listen to sweet tunes, but what about those who recently graduated college and have committed to doing National/International Service through Americorps, PeaceCorps, etc? Individuals who choose to serve with Americorps (1 year) or PeaceCorps (2 years) are given a very small living stipend to use and a spotify discount would be greatly appreciated!

title: Redistribute Spotify on Linux Distributions
author: NicoHood
body: Dear Spotify Team,my name is NicoHood and I am an official ArchLinux Trusted User. This means I maintain some packages in the official [community] repository [1]. I am also able to move packages from the ArchLinux User Repository (AUR)[2] into [community] if the packages are popular enough (>10 votes). As you can imagine spotify is really popular on ArchLinux with more than 1100 votes on AUR[3]. Me and the community would love to have spotify in our official repositories to provide our users a simpler channel of installing Spotify on ArchLinux. The problem we face is that the Terms of Use forbid us to redistribute Spotify. We'd require an official statement that ArchLinux is allowed to package Spotify in its repositories. I've already contacted Brendan Marsh (Product Owner, Desktop) about this topic via email without any further response. It would be nice if you can give the linux community a better channel for installing Spotify on non-debian systems. Furthermore we then can cooperate and optimize spotify for ArchLinux (e.g. using more shared libraries, providing gpg signed tarballs and https downloads etc). Me and the community hope to get some positive feedback. Thanks for taking the time. Please upvote this post if you also with to natively install Spotify on ArchLinux and other Linux Systems. [1]: https://www.archlinux.org/packages/?maintainer=NicoHood[2]: https://aur.archlinux.org/[3]: https://aur.archlinux.org/packages/spotify/ Edit 28.08.2019: This request has been marked as idea by the spotify staff. Please upvote it here: https://community.spotify.com/t5/Live-Ideas/Linux-Add-Spotify-to-the-official-Linux-repositories/idi...
